question.title: Will Mike Pence be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Mike Pence is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:
Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden not die before Saturday?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if there is no official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Joe Biden will pass away before Saturday?
para_P.body:
This resolves to YES if an official declaration of Joe Biden's death occurs prior to the market's closing on Friday, July 26th. 

If not, it resolves to NO.

question.title: Will Joe Biden remain President through the end of July 2024 and not die before Saturday, July 26th, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Joe Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (Eastern Time). This means he does not resign, die, or otherwise cease to be President before then. A temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment, making his VP the Acting President, does not cause a NO resolution as Acting President is different from President under the Constitution. (b) There is no official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, 2024. If both conditions are satisfied, the question resolves YES. If either or both conditions are not satisfied, the question resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden not remain President through the end of July 2024 or die before Saturday, July 26th, 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves YES if at least one of the following conditions is met: (a) Joe Biden does not remain US President through the end of July 2024 (Eastern Time). This means he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. A temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment, making his VP the Acting President, does cause a NO resolution as Acting President is different from President under the Constitution. (b) There is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, 2024. If either or both conditions are satisfied, the question resolves YES. If neither condition is satisfied, the question resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden serve as President until the conclusion of July 2024 and survive until Saturday, July 26th, 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with a YES if both of the following criteria are fulfilled: (a) Joe Biden remains the President of the United States until the end of July 2024 (Eastern Time). This indicates that he does not resign, pass away, or otherwise stop being President before that time. A temporary transfer of authority under the 25th amendment, which appoints his Vice President as the Acting President, does not result in a NO answer, as Acting President is distinct from President according to the Constitution. (b) There is no formal declaration of Joe Biden's death prior to the market closing on Friday, July 26th, 2024. If both criteria are met, the question will be answered YES. If either or both criteria are not met, the question will be answered NO.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden dies before Saturday, July 26th, 2024, or (b) Joe Biden does not remain President through the end of July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves YES if either of the following occurs: (a) There is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, 2024. (b) Joe Biden ceases to be the US President before the end of July 2024 (ET) due to resignation, death, or any other reason. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not affect the YES resolution for part (b). Otherwise, the question resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden dies before Saturday, July 26th, 2024, nor (b) Joe Biden remains President through the end of July 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves YES if neither of the following occurs: (a) There is no official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, 2024. (b) Joe Biden does not cease to be the US President before the end of July 2024 (ET) due to resignation, death, or any other reason. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does affect the YES resolution for part (b). Otherwise, the question resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of these events happens: (a) Joe Biden passes away prior to Saturday, July 26th, 2024, or (b) Joe Biden is no longer in the position of President by the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered YES if at least one of the following takes place: (a) An official declaration of Joe Biden's passing is made before the market closes on Friday, July 26th, 2024. (b) Joe Biden no longer holds the office of US President before the end of July 2024 (ET) due to resignation, death, or any other circumstances. A temporary transfer of authority under the 25th amendment does not influence the YES outcome for part (b). If neither occurs, the question will be answered NO.

question.title: Will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.body: (a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President in the 2024 cycle. question.title: Will the USA win more Gold than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if the United States Olympic Team wins more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics.

not_P.title: Will the USA win no more Gold than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
not_P.body: This question resolves Yes if the United States Olympic Team wins no more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics.

para_P.title: Will the United States secure a greater number of Gold medals compared to Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered affirmatively if the USA Olympic Team achieves a higher count of Gold medals than Silver medals during the Paris 2024 Olympic Games.

question.title: Will the USA both top the Olympic Medal Table and win as many or more Silver than Gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question will resolve positively if both of the following occur:
(a) The United States Olympic Team are the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. The medal table is calculated by taking all the medals won by each participating country and ordering by:
1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals

(b) The United States Olympic Team wins as many or more Silver medals than Gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics.

The question will resolve ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027.

not_P.title: Will the USA not top the Olympic Medal Table or win fewer Silver than Gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve positively if at least one of the following occurs:
(a) The United States Olympic Team are not the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. The medal table is calculated by taking all the medals won by each participating country and ordering by:
1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals

(b) The United States Olympic Team wins fewer Silver medals than Gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics.

The question will resolve ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027.

para_P.title: Will the USA rank first in the Olympic Medal Table while securing at least as many Silver medals as Gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if both of the following conditions are satisfied:
(a) The United States Olympic Team is the (sole) highest positioned team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. The medal standings are determined by tallying all medals earned by each participating nation and arranging them based on:
1. Quantity of Gold Medals
2. (In case of a tie at 1) Quantity of Silver Medals
3. (In case of a tie at 2) Quantity of Bronze Medals

(b) The United States Olympic Team attains at least as many Silver medals as Gold medals during the Paris 2024 Olympics.

The inquiry will be considered unclear if the Paris Olympics are not conducted prior to 2027.

question.title: Will either of the following occur at the Paris 2024 Olympics: (a) The USA wins more Gold than Silver medals (b) The USA tops the Olympic Medal Table?
question.body:
This question resolves YES if either of the following conditions are met:
(a) The United States Olympic Team wins more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics.
(b) The United States Olympic Team is the unique highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics, based on the medal table which orders countries by the number of Gold medals, then Silver medals, then Bronze medals. This question resolves ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. It resolves NO if neither condition is met.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur at the Paris 2024 Olympics: (a) The USA wins more Gold than Silver medals (b) The USA does not top the Olympic Medal Table?
not_P.body:
This question resolves YES if neither of the following conditions are met:
(a) The United States Olympic Team wins more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics.
(b) The United States Olympic Team is not the unique highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics, based on the medal table which orders countries by the number of Gold medals, then Silver medals, then Bronze medals. question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump not be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The lack of removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves positively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be excluded or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has officially been excluded or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

Confirmation of the exclusion or prevention must come from official announcements by state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or reliable media reports. Speculative articles, opinion columns, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will be deemed "No" if these criteria are not fulfilled by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that could happen after the specified date. It only concerns whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated conditions as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is excluded or prevented from a ballot and subsequently reinstated, resulting in him not being excluded or prevented from any ballot as of July 15, the inquiry will resolve negatively.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Donald Trump will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (2) Donald Trump will not be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

2. As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. There must be no official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports confirming such a removal or block. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has not been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves positively.

The question will resolve as **No** if either or both of these conditions are not met.

1. Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

2. As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. There must be official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports confirming such a removal or block. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is removed or blocked from a ballot, the question resolves positively.

The question will resolve as **No** if either or both of these conditions are met.

question.title: Kamala president by Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

Resolver

not_P.title: Kamala not president by Friday?
not_P.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is not formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

Resolver

para_P.title: Will Kamala Harris be the president by Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a "Yes" if Kamala Harris, the Vice President, is officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any time prior to July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. If this does not occur, the market will conclude with a "No".

The main source for resolution will be official announcements from the US government, although a consensus of reliable news reports will also be taken into account.

Resolver

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden drops out before July 20, 2024, and (b) Kamala Harris is not designated President by July 26, 2024?
question.body: (a) Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20, 2024, midnight Eastern Time. (b) Vice President Kamala Harris is not formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. The primary resolution source for Kamala Harris's status will be official information from the US government, however, a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

not_P.title: Will at least one of the following occur: (a) Biden does not drop out before July 20, 2024, or (b) Kamala Harris is designated President by July 26, 2024?
not_P.body: (a) Biden does not drop out or is otherwise able to continue the race before July 20, 2024, midnight Eastern Time. (b) Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. The primary resolution source for Kamala Harris's status will be official information from the US government, however, a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following happen: (a) Biden withdraws from the race prior to July 20, 2024, and (b) Kamala Harris is not appointed as President by July 26, 2024?
para_P.body: (a) Biden withdraws or becomes otherwise unable to participate in the election before July 20, 2024, at midnight Eastern Time. (b) Vice President Kamala Harris is not officially appointed as President or Acting President of the United States at any time before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. The main source for determining Kamala Harris's status will be official announcements from the US government, although a consensus of reliable news reports will also be considered.

question.title: Will either of the following occur before their respective deadlines: (a) Kamala Harris becomes President or Acting President of the United States (b) Joe Biden drops out of the race?
question.body:
(a) Kamala Harris becomes President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. This will be confirmed by official information from the US government or a consensus of credible reporting. 

(b) Joe Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20, 2024, midnight Eastern Time.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur before their respective deadlines: (a) Kamala Harris becomes President or Acting President of the United States (b) Joe Biden drops out of the race?
not_P.body:
(a) Kamala Harris does not become President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. This will not be confirmed by official information from the US government or a consensus of credible reporting. 

(b) Joe Biden does not drop out and is able to continue the race before July 20, 2024, midnight Eastern Time.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following happens prior to their set deadlines: (a) Kamala Harris takes on the role of President or Acting President of the United States (b) Joe Biden withdraws from the race?
para_P.body:
(a) Kamala Harris assumes the position of President or Acting President of the United States at any time before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, as confirmed by official announcements from the US government or a general agreement from reliable news sources. 

(b) Joe Biden either steps down or is otherwise unable to continue his campaign before July 20, 2024, midnight Eastern Time.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump not be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The absence of removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has not been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is not removed or blocked from a ballot and then subsequently removed, such that as of July 15th he is removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is there a chance that Donald Trump will be disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot for any U.S. state for a federal position due to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The disqualification or prevention must be verified through official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or reliable media reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be sufficient for resolution.

The inquiry will be answered with "No" if these conditions are not satisfied as of July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent changes that may occur after the specified date. It solely focuses on whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or prevented from a ballot and later reinstated such that as of July 15th he is not disqualified or prevented from any ballot, the question will resolve negatively.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) Donald Trump not be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
(a) This part of the question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It does not matter who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(b) This part of the question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The lack of removal or block is confirmed through the absence of official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports indicating such a removal. The question strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has not been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024.

not_P.title: Will at least one of the following not occur: (a) Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or (b) Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
not_P.body:
(a) This part of the question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It does not matter who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(b) This part of the question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block is confirmed through the presence of official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports indicating such a removal. The question strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024.

para_P.title: Are both of the following conditions met: (a) Ted Cruz becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 United States Presidential Election and (b) Donald Trump remains eligible on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position as per Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
(a) This segment of the inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Ted Cruz is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 United States Presidential Election. It is irrelevant who obtains the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 U.S. election; the determination is solely based on the selection made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(b) This segment will resolve as "Yes" if, *as of* July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has not been officially excluded or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The confirmation of no exclusion or prevention is established through the lack of official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documentation, or credible news reports indicating such an exclusion. The inquiry strictly focuses on whether Donald Trump has not been barred from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified criteria by July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves positively. para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered "Yes" if at least one of the following takes place: (a) By July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. Speculative information, opinion articles, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution. The inquiry will be deemed "No" if these criteria are not satisfied by July 15, 2024. This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither Glenn Youngkin nor Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to voice their opposition to their party’s attempt to finalize President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than initially intended, arguing that it suppresses the vital ongoing discussion regarding his candidacy, according to a legislator involved in the initiative.

A letter drafted, shared by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, represents the first public indication from Democrats following the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that many of their own members are still profoundly concerned about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Someone believes it’s a smart way to shut down debate and I suppose by sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t function that way,” Huffman stated in an interview. He refrained from confirming the letter's existence.

This market will resolve to YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination initiative is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who are part of the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple letters with a total of 20 lawmakers’ signatures combined would also be adequate to resolve this market to YES. 

If these conditions are not fulfilled by market close, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20, and (2) fewer than 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?

Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

(1) Will at least 10 Democratic Senators urge Biden to step aside prior to July 20?
Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If, at any moment before midnight on July 20 Central Time, there are 10 or more Democratic Senators, this market will conclude with a yes. If not, it will conclude with a no.

question.title: Will Latvia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Latvia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Latvia does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Latvia not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Latvia does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Latvia qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Latvia going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if Latvia takes part in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if Latvia fails to qualify, the question will be answered with **No**.

question.title: Will Belgium qualify and Latvia fail to qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Belgium participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Latvia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as not having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either or both conditions are not met, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Belgium not qualify or Latvia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if at least one of the following conditions is met: (a) Belgium does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) Latvia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If both conditions are met, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Belgium advance while Latvia does not make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if both of the following criteria are fulfilled: (a) Belgium takes part in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Latvia takes part in a Semi-final and is then officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as not having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either or both of these criteria are not fulfilled, the inquiry will be deemed **No**.

question.title: Will either Latvia or Belgium qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Latvia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (b) Belgium participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. not_P.title: Will neither Latvia nor Belgium qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?

(b) Belgium participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. para_P.title: Will Latvia or Belgium make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?

question.title: Will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Dem Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

not_P.title: Will fewer than 10 Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
not_P.body:
Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows fewer than 10 Dem Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

para_P.title: Will 10 or more Democratic Senators urge Biden to resign prior to July 20?
para_P.body:
Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If at any moment before midnight July 20 Central Time, there are 10 or more Democratic Senators, this market will resolve to yes. If not, it will resolve to no.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) another Democratic party presidential debate occurs before the 2024 Democratic National Convention, and (b) fewer than 10 Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

(b) If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, the New York Times source shows fewer than 10 Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out, this resolves to YES. Otherwise, it resolves to NO.

not_P.title: Will either of the following not occur: (a) another Democratic party presidential debate occurs before the 2024 Democratic National Convention, or (b) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
not_P.body:
(a) Resolves YES if there is no debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

(b) If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, the New York Times source shows 10 or more Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out, this resolves to YES. Otherwise, it resolves to NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following happen: (a) there is another presidential debate among Democratic candidates before the 2024 Democratic National Convention, and (b) less than 10 Democratic Senators urge Biden to resign before July 20?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be considered YES if a debate occurs among potential Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. It will be NO if such a debate does not take place.

(b) If, at any time before midnight July 20 Central Time, the New York Times reports that fewer than 10 Democratic Senators are calling for Biden to step down, this will be deemed YES. If not, it will be NO.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20, or (b) there is another Democratic party presidential debate?
question.body:
(a) Will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20? Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html. If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Dem Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

(b) Will there be another Democratic party presidential debate? Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20, nor (b) there be another Democratic party presidential debate?
not_P.body:
(a) Will fewer than 10 Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20? Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html. If at no point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Dem Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

(b) Will there be no Democratic party presidential debate? Resolves YES if there is no debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: Is it possible for one of the following to happen: (a) at least 10 Democratic Senators urge Biden to resign before July 20, or (b) another debate among Democratic presidential candidates takes place?
para_P.body:
(a) Is it possible that 10 or more Democratic Senators will urge Biden to step down before July 20? The resolution source for this is: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html. If it is confirmed that there are 10 or more Democratic Senators by midnight July 20 Central Time, this market will resolve to yes. If not, it will resolve to no.

(b) Will there be another debate among Democratic presidential candidates? This will resolve to YES if a debate occurs involving potential Democratic nominees (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. It will resolve to NO otherwise.

question.title: Will Ireland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ireland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Ireland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Ireland not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ireland does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Ireland qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is there a chance that Ireland will make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered as **Yes** if Ireland takes part in a Semi-final and is formally recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a spot in the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. Conversely, if Ireland fails to qualify, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur in Eurovision 2024: (a) Luxembourg qualifies for the Grand Final and (b) Ireland fails to qualify for the Grand Final?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Luxembourg participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (2) Ireland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as not having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For all other outcomes, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will at least one of the following occur in Eurovision 2024: (a) Luxembourg fails to qualify for the Grand Final or (b) Ireland qualifies for the Grand Final?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if at least one of the following conditions is met: (1) Luxembourg participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as not having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (2) Ireland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For all other outcomes, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will both of these events take place in Eurovision 2024: (a) Luxembourg makes it to the Grand Final and (b) Ireland does not make it to the Grand Final?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if both of the following scenarios occur: (1) Luxembourg competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (2) Ireland competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having not advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For all other results, the inquiry will be deemed **No**.

question.title: Will either Ireland or Luxembourg qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Ireland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final; (b) Luxembourg participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Ireland nor Luxembourg qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither Ireland nor Luxembourg qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs: (a) Ireland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final; (b) Luxembourg participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Ireland or Luxembourg qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will either Ireland or Luxembourg make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if one of the following situations occurs: (a) Ireland competes in a Semi-final and is officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final; (b) Luxembourg competes in a Semi-final and is officially declared by the EBU as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Ireland nor Luxembourg advances, the inquiry will be answered with **No**.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is not selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Donald Trump going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Donald Trump is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No**. Future candidates that may emerge will also be taken into account.

For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republicans on the day of the 2024 US election; it is strictly based on who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee and Donald Trump not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if BOTH of the following conditions are met: (1) Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, AND (2) Donald Trump is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The resolution of this question is not affected by who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention. New candidates may be considered in the future, but both conditions must be simultaneously satisfied for a **Yes** resolution.

not_P.title: Will Ted Cruz not be the Republican nominee or Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if ANY of the following conditions are met: (1) Ted Cruz is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, OR (2) Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The resolution of this question is not affected by who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention. New candidates may be considered in the future, but at least one of the conditions must be satisfied for a **Yes** resolution.

para_P.title: Is Ted Cruz going to be the chosen candidate for the Republican Party while Donald Trump is not the chosen candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if BOTH of the following criteria are fulfilled: (1) Ted Cruz is appointed by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, AND (2) Donald Trump is not appointed by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The outcome of this inquiry is not influenced by who secures the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively determined by the selection made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention. New candidates may be evaluated in the future, but both criteria must be met at the same time for a **Yes** outcome.

question.title: Will either Donald Trump or Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either Donald Trump or Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will neither Donald Trump nor Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither Donald Trump nor Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. At least one of the other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Will either Donald Trump or Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either Donald Trump or Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.body:

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a Woman (b) Kamala's odds of winning not increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?

(b) Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is <=46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

not_P.title: Will at least one of the following occur: (a) The 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a Woman (b) Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
not_P.body:
(a) Will resolve “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates select a male presidential nominee for the 2024 election. Will resolve “no” if/when the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

(b) Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) A Woman will be the Democratic Presidential Nominee in 2024 (b) Kamala's chances of winning will not rise in the coming week according to Nate Silver's projections?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be marked as “yes” if the Democratic delegates choose a female candidate for the presidential nomination in the 2024 election. It will be marked as “no” if a male candidate is selected by the Democratic delegates for the 2024 election.

(b) This will be marked as YES if the probability of Harris winning in Nate Silver's model is <=46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. It will be marked as NO otherwise.

(b) Will the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a Woman? Will resolve “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election. Will resolve “no” if/when the Democratic delegates select a male presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

not_P.title: Will neither Kamala's odds of winning increase according to Nate Silver's model nor the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a Woman?
not_P.body:
(a) Will Kamala's odds of winning not increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model? Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is ≤46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise. Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

(b) Will the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee not be a Woman? Will resolve “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates select a male presidential nominee for the 2024 election. Will resolve “no” if/when the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that either Kamala's chances of winning will rise based on Nate Silver's model or that a Woman will be the Democratic Nominee for President in 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Will Kamala's chances of victory improve in the coming week as per Nate Silver's model? This will be marked as YES if the Electoral College likelihood for Harris in Nate Silver's model exceeds 46.6% on Friday, August 9th at 8:40 PM. It will be marked as NO otherwise. Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

(b) Will a Woman be chosen as the Democratic Presidential Nominee for 2024? This will be marked as “yes” if the Democratic delegates choose a female candidate for the presidential nomination in the 2024 election. It will be marked as “no” if they select a male candidate.

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

not_P.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT not be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
not_P.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is not generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they cannot access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If available in certain EU countries, or available to (for example) minors, this will still resolve negatively, assuming at least >50% of the population cannot use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves negatively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially different (not entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be accessible to the general public in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is accessible to the general public in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** if it is not.

The term "accessible to the general public" indicates that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without needing a VPN (though it may require payment). If it is not accessible in certain EU nations (as was the situation in Italy in early 2023), or if it is not available to specific groups (like minors), the outcome will still be positive as long as more than 50% of the population can access it.

The term "ChatGPT" here refers to the standard web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. The outcome will still be positive if the name or website changes, provided that OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (inputting queries to systems based on Large Language Models).
