question.title: Will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election and Joe Biden not announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
Will both of the following occur: (a) The Republican Party retains Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election, and (b) Joe Biden does not announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolution criteria:

1. The first component will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for Ohio's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

2. The second component will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign does not make a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. If such a definitive statement is made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this component will resolve as No.

This combined question will resolve as Yes if both components resolve as Yes.

not_P.title: Will the Republican Party not retain Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election or Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
not_P.body:
Will at least one of the following occur: (a) The Republican Party does not retain Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election, or (b) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolution criteria:

1. The first component will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has not won the special election for Ohio's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

2. The second component will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this component will resolve as No.

This combined question will resolve as Yes if at least one component resolves as Yes.

para_P.title: Will the Republican Party keep control of Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election while Joe Biden refrains from announcing before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
Will both of the following take place: (a) The Republican Party maintains control of Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election, and (b) Joe Biden does not declare before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolution criteria:

1. The first part will be considered Yes if reliable sources report that a representative of the Republican Party has won the special election for Ohio's 6th district. If credible sources conflict, an Ohio State source or statement will be referenced. If no election occurs before January 1, 2025, the question will be voided.

2. The second part will be considered Yes if before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign does not make a clear, public, official announcement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. If such a clear statement is made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this part will resolve as No.

This combined inquiry will resolve as Yes if both parts resolve as Yes.

question.title: Will either Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, or will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
question.body: Will either of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announce before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle, with a definitive, public, official announcement that is unambiguous and conclusive, or (b) the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election, as reported by credible sources, or if there is disagreement, by an Ohio State source or statement? If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question regarding Ohio's 6th district is annulled.

not_P.title: Will neither Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will accept the Democratic nomination for President, nor will the Republican Party lose Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
not_P.body: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announce before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle, with a definitive, public, official announcement that is unambiguous and conclusive, nor (b) the Republican Party lose Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election, as reported by credible sources, or if there is disagreement, by an Ohio State source or statement? If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question regarding Ohio's 6th district is annulled.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden declare before July 15, 2024, that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination for President, or will the GOP keep Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
para_P.body: Is it true that at least one of the following will happen: (a) Joe Biden will make a definitive and public announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will not seek the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election, with clarity and finality, or (b) the Republican Party will maintain control of Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election, as confirmed by reliable sources, or in case of disputes, by an official statement from Ohio? Should no election take place prior to January 1, 2025, the inquiry regarding Ohio's 6th district is rendered void.

question.title: Will Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Vivek Ramaswamy not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Vivek Ramaswamy going to be the Republican candidate for the US Presidential Election in 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently listed; additional options may be introduced later.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who obtains the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; the determination is based solely on who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Rishi Sunak fails to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election (b) Vivek Ramaswamy is not the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) This question resolves as **Yes** if for any reason Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election. If Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4 2024 UK general election, this question will resolve as **No**. Resolution should cite [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) media reports, or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate (if he is a candidate in any constituency).

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If any other candidate is selected, this question will resolve as **Yes**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Rishi Sunak is elected in the 2024 UK General Election (b) Vivek Ramaswamy is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
(a) This question resolves as **Yes** if for any reason Rishi Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election. If Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4 2024 UK general election, this question will resolve as **No**. Resolution should cite [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) media reports, or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate (if he is a candidate in any constituency).

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If he is not selected, this question will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Rishi Sunak does not get elected in the 2024 UK General Election (b) Vivek Ramaswamy does not become the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) This question will be answered with **Yes** if Rishi Sunak does not succeed in being elected as a Member of Parliament in the UK general election on July 4, 2024. If he is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in that election, the answer will be **No**. The resolution should refer to [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) news reports or an official statement from the returning officer of the constituency where Sunak is a candidate (if he is running in any constituency).

(b) This question will be answered with **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is not chosen by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If any other candidate is chosen, the answer will be **Yes**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently listed; additional candidates may be included later. The determination for this question does not depend on who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively based on who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will either Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or Rishi Sunak fail to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

1. Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

2. Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election for any reason. If Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in this election, this part of the question will resolve as **No**.

Resolution for the second part should cite [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) media reports, or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate (if he is a candidate in any constituency).

not_P.title: Will neither Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election nor Rishi Sunak be elected in the 2024 UK General Election?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs:

1. Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

2. Rishi Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election for any reason. If Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in this election, this part of the question will resolve as **No**.

Resolution for the second part should cite [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) media reports, or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate (if he is a candidate in any constituency).

para_P.title: Is it possible for Vivek Ramaswamy to secure the Republican nomination for the 2024 US Presidential Election or for Rishi Sunak to be unsuccessful in his bid during the 2024 UK General Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if at least one of the following happens:

1. Vivek Ramaswamy is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, as decided by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), independent of who is awarded the Republican nomination on election day in 2024.

2. Rishi Sunak does not win a seat as a Member of Parliament in the UK general election on July 4, 2024, for any reason. If Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency during this election, this portion of the question will resolve as **No**.

For the second part, resolution should refer to [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) news sources or an official statement from the returning officer of the constituency where Sunak is a candidate (if he is running in any constituency).

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

not_P.title: Will Biden not remain President through end of July 2024?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if Biden does not remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he remains President through that time.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a NO resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

para_P.title: Will Biden be in office as President until the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
Resolves YES if Biden is still the US President at the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he steps down, passes away, or otherwise stops being President prior to that date.

A temporary delegation of authority under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as Acting President) does not result in a YES resolution. (An Acting President is distinct from a President according to the Constitution)

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed from a primary ballot for federal office under the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, and will Biden cease to be President before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if both of the following conditions are met:

1. As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the condition is not met.

2. Joe Biden ceases to be US President before the end of July 2024 (ET) by resigning, dying, or otherwise leaving office. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e., making his VP the Acting President) does not meet this condition, as Acting President is different from President under the Constitution.

The question resolves as "No" if either or both of these conditions are not met.

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump not be removed from a primary ballot for federal office under the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, or will Biden continue to be President after the end of July 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if either of the following conditions is met:

1. As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The absence of removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has not been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the condition is met.

2. Joe Biden continues to be US President after the end of July 2024 (ET) by not resigning, dying, or otherwise leaving office. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e., making his VP the Acting President) does not meet this condition, as Acting President is different from President under the Constitution.

The question resolves as "Yes" if either or both of these conditions are met.

para_P.title: Is Donald Trump going to be disqualified from a primary election ballot for federal office due to the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, and will Joe Biden no longer hold the presidency before the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered "Yes" if both of the following criteria are fulfilled:

1. By July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The disqualification or prevention must be verified through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or trustworthy media reports. Speculative accounts, opinion articles, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution. This question does not take into account any legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may happen after the specified date. It strictly concerns whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or prevented from a ballot and later reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not disqualified or prevented from any ballot, the condition is not satisfied.

2. Joe Biden must no longer be the President of the United States before the conclusion of July 2024 (ET) by resigning, passing away, or otherwise vacating the office. A temporary transfer of authority under the 25th Amendment (i.e., appointing his Vice President as the Acting President) does not fulfill this requirement, as the Acting President is distinct from the President according to the Constitution.

The question will be resolved as "No" if either or both of these criteria are not fulfilled.

question.title: Will either Biden remain President through July 2024 or Trump be removed from a primary ballot under the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024?
question.body: Will either of the following occur: (a) Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024, meaning he does not resign, die, or otherwise cease to be President before then (temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not count as ceasing to be President); (b) Donald Trump is officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment as of July 15, 2024. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals after July 15, 2024.

not_P.title: Will neither Biden remain President through July 2024 nor Trump be removed from a primary ballot under the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024?
not_P.body: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024, meaning he does not resign, die, or otherwise cease to be President before then (temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not count as ceasing to be President); (b) Donald Trump is officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment as of July 15, 2024. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals after July 15, 2024.

para_P.title: Will either Biden stay in office until July 2024 or will Trump face disqualification from a primary ballot under the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024?
para_P.body: Will one of the following happen: (a) Biden continues as the President of the United States until the conclusion of July 2024, which means he does not resign, pass away, or otherwise stop being President prior to that date (a temporary power transfer under the 25th amendment does not count as stopping being President); (b) Donald Trump is officially disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024. The disqualification or prevention must be validated through official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or reliable media coverage. This question does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or any later changes after July 15, 2024.

question.title: Will the European Union announce new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

not_P.title: Will the European Union not announce new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before July 5, 2024, there are no credible sources reporting that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the European Union will declare new tariffs or duties on the importation of Chinese electric vehicles prior to July 5, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if, before July 5, 2024, reliable sources indicate that the European Union (EU) has declared the imposition of new tariffs or duties that would affect the import of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) At least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th, 2024, AND (2) The EU does not announce new tariffs on Chinese EVs before July 5, 2024?
question.body:
(1) At least 5 named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators must work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or urge him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th, 2024 (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter or another form of collective action. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient. Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy the criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are made public before the end date. Ambiguous cases will err towards resolving NO. If these criteria are not met before July 20th, 2024, this condition resolves NO.

(2) The European Union (EU) must not announce any new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024. This condition will resolve as YES if there are no credible reports of the EU announcing new tariffs or duties that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU before the specified date.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (1) At least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th, 2024, NOR (2) The EU announce new tariffs on Chinese EVs before July 5, 2024?
not_P.body:
(1) At least 5 named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators must not work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or urge him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th, 2024 (Pacific Time). This means that either no such group exists or that any group that does exist fails to meet the criteria outlined. Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy the criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are made public before the end date. Ambiguous cases will err towards resolving YES. If these criteria are met before July 20th, 2024, this condition resolves YES.

(2) The European Union (EU) must announce new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024. This condition will resolve as NO if there are credible reports of the EU announcing new tariffs or duties that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU before the specified date.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (1) A minimum of 5 identified Democratic House Members or US Senators will urge Biden to withdraw from the race prior to July 20th, 2024, AND (2) The EU will refrain from declaring new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024?
para_P.body:
(1) A minimum of 5 specified Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators must collaborate to persuade Joe Biden to contemplate ceasing his 2024 re-election bid, or to encourage him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th, 2024 (Pacific Time). This could be achieved through signing a letter or other forms of collective action. All five individuals must participate in the same group communication. Simply having five individuals convey their opinions to journalists that they believe Biden should withdraw is not adequate. Reports mentioning any number of unnamed Democrats requesting Biden to step down will not meet the criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are disclosed publicly before the deadline. Any ambiguous instances will lean towards a NO resolution. If these conditions are not satisfied before July 20th, 2024, this condition will result in a NO.

(2) The European Union (EU) must not make any announcements regarding new tariffs or duties on the importation of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024. This condition will be considered YES if there are no credible reports of the EU declaring new tariffs or duties applicable to the importation of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU prior to the specified date.

question.title: Will either of the following occur before their respective deadlines: (1) The EU announce new tariffs on Chinese EV imports, or (2) A group of 5 named Dem lawmakers pressure Biden to drop out?
question.body:
(1) The EU announces new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024. This will resolve as **Yes** if credible sources report that the EU has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

(2) A group of at least 5 named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before July 20th, 2024 (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter, speaking with Biden in person, or another form of collective action. All five individuals must be part of the same group message, and the names must be made public. In ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this will resolve NO.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur before their respective deadlines: (1) The EU announce new tariffs on Chinese EV imports, nor (2) A group of 5 named Dem lawmakers pressure Biden to drop out?
not_P.body:
(1) The EU does not announce new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024. This will resolve as **Yes** if there are no credible sources reporting that the EU has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

(2) A group of at least 5 named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators do not work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before July 20th, 2024 (Pacific Time). This could not be by signing a letter, speaking with Biden in person, or another form of collective action. All five individuals must not be part of the same group message, and the names must not be made public. In ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this will resolve YES.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following events takes place prior to their deadlines: (1) The EU implements new tariffs on electric vehicles imported from China, or (2) A coalition of 5 specified Democratic lawmakers pressures Biden to withdraw from the race?
para_P.body:
(1) The European Union enacts new tariffs or levies on the importation of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024. This will be considered **Yes** if reliable sources indicate that the EU has decided to impose new tariffs or levies affecting the import of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

(2) A coalition of at least 5 identified members of the Democratic Party in the US House of Representatives or US Senate collaborates to request that Joe Biden contemplate halting his 2024 re-election bid, or to encourage him to do so, prior to July 20, 2024 (Pacific Time). This could be through signing a letter, having a direct conversation with Biden, or another method of collective action. All five individuals must be included in the same group communication, and their names must be publicly disclosed. In cases of uncertainty where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this will be resolved as NO.

question.title: Will the New York Knicks win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the New York Knicks are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** for all other teams if they are eliminated from contention.

not_P.title: Will the New York Knicks not win the 2024 NBA Finals?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the New York Knicks are not crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** for all other teams if they are not eliminated from contention.

para_P.title: Will the New York Knicks be the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals?
para_P.body: This inquiry is answered with **Yes** if the New York Knicks are declared the winners of the 2024 NBA Finals, based on [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It is answered with **No** if any other team is declared the champion.

question.title: Will the Miami Heat win and the New York Knicks not win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
This question resolves **Yes** if both of the following are true according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/): (a) The Miami Heat is crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals. (b) The New York Knicks are not crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals. 

It resolves **No** if either the Miami Heat is not crowned champion or the New York Knicks are crowned champion.

not_P.title: Will the Miami Heat not win or the New York Knicks win the 2024 NBA Finals?
not_P.body:
This question resolves **Yes** if either of the following is true according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/): (a) The Miami Heat is not crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals. (b) The New York Knicks are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals. 

It resolves **No** if both the Miami Heat is crowned champion and the New York Knicks are not crowned champion.

para_P.title: Will the Miami Heat be the champions while the New York Knicks fail to win the 2024 NBA Finals?
para_P.body:
This inquiry is answered with **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/): (a) The Miami Heat is declared the winner of the 2024 NBA Finals. (b) The New York Knicks do not become the winner of the 2024 NBA Finals. 

It is answered with **No** if either the Miami Heat is not declared the winner or the New York Knicks are declared the winner.

question.title: Will either the New York Knicks or the Miami Heat win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either the New York Knicks or the Miami Heat is crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** if any other team is crowned champion or if both the New York Knicks and the Miami Heat are eliminated from contention.

not_P.title: Will neither the New York Knicks nor the Miami Heat win the 2024 NBA Finals?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if neither the New York Knicks nor the Miami Heat is crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** if either the New York Knicks or the Miami Heat is crowned champion or if both teams are still in contention.

para_P.title: Will the 2024 NBA Finals be won by the New York Knicks or the Miami Heat?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the New York Knicks or the Miami Heat are declared the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals, based on information from [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It will be answered with **No** if another team wins the championship or if both the New York Knicks and the Miami Heat are no longer in the running.

question.title: Will Liz Cheney be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Liz Cheney is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Liz Cheney not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Liz Cheney is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If Liz Cheney is selected, this question will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Liz Cheney going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if Liz Cheney is chosen by the Republican National Convention to be the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be resolved as **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently known; additional options may be introduced later.

For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who gets the Republican nomination on the date of the 2024 US election; the resolution is solely based on who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election and Liz Cheney not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following conditions are met:

1. Credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for Ohio's 6th district, previously held by Bill Johnson. In case of disagreement among popular sources, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, this part of the question is annulled.

2. Liz Cheney is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If any other candidate is selected, this condition is satisfied. This determination is based solely on the selection by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

not_P.title: Will the Republican Party not retain Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election or Liz Cheney be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if either of the following conditions is met:

1. Credible sources report that no person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for Ohio's 6th district, previously held by Bill Johnson. In case of disagreement among popular sources, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, this part of the question is annulled.

2. Liz Cheney is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This determination is based solely on the selection by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

para_P.title: Will Ohio's 6th congressional district remain under Republican control in the special election of 2024, and will Liz Cheney not be the chosen candidate for the Republican nomination in the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with a Yes if both of the following criteria are fulfilled:

1. Reliable sources indicate that a candidate representing the Republican Party has emerged victorious in the special election for Ohio's 6th district, which was formerly held by Bill Johnson. In the event of conflicting reports among well-known sources, a statement from an Ohio State source will be utilized. Should no election occur before January 1, 2025, this segment of the question will be rendered void.

2. Liz Cheney is not nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This condition is met if any other individual is chosen. This conclusion will be based solely on the decision made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, irrespective of who is announced as the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Liz Cheney becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) The Republican Party retains Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

(a) Liz Cheney is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the decision of the delegates of the Republican National Convention, irrespective of who receives the nomination on the day of the election.

(b) A person representing the Republican Party wins the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district. This will be confirmed by credible sources, and in case of disagreement among popular sources, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, this part of the question is annulled.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Liz Cheney becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, nor (b) The Republican Party retains Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs:

(a) Liz Cheney is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the decision of the delegates of the Republican National Convention, irrespective of who receives the nomination on the day of the election.

(b) A person representing the Republican Party wins the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district. This will be confirmed by credible sources, and in case of disagreement among popular sources, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, this part of the question is annulled.

para_P.title: Is it possible that either of the following happens: (a) Liz Cheney is chosen as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) The Republican Party keeps control of Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if at least one of the following takes place:

(a) Liz Cheney is nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This will be based solely on the choice made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who is named the nominee on election day.

(b) A candidate from the Republican Party secures victory in the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district. This will be verified by reliable sources, and in the event of conflicting reports among popular sources, an official statement or source from Ohio will be utilized. If no election occurs before January 1, 2025, this segment of the question will be rendered void.

question.title: Will Greece qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Greece participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Greece does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Greece not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Greece does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Greece qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Greece set to reach the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Greece takes part in a Semi-final and is formally declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if Greece fails to qualify, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will Lithuania qualify and Greece fail to qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following occur: (a) Lithuania participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Greece does not qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Lithuania does not qualify or Greece qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Lithuania not qualify or Greece qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Lithuania does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) Greece qualifies for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If both Lithuania qualifies and Greece does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Lithuania make it to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final while Greece does not?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Lithuania competes in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having made it to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Greece fails to qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Lithuania does not qualify or if Greece qualifies, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will either Greece or Lithuania qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Greece participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (b) Lithuania participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Greece nor Lithuania qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither Greece nor Lithuania qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs: (a) Greece participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (b) Lithuania participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Greece or Lithuania qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Are Greece or Lithuania going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if one of the following happens: (a) Greece competes in a Semi-final and is officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) to have qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (b) Lithuania competes in a Semi-final and is officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) to have qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Greece nor Lithuania qualifies, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but at most 3 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as indicated on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President AND will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. Prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination.

2. On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is less than or equal to 2 points or greater than 3 points, as reported on the chart for that date and accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead.

If both conditions are not met, this question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden not announce before July 15, 2024, that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President OR will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 AND less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following conditions is met:

1. Prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign does not make a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be ambiguous or inconclusive, leaving room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination.

2. On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 points and less than or equal to 3 points, as reported on the chart for that date and accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead.

If either condition is met, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Before July 15, 2024, will Joe Biden publicly declare that he is not going to accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, and will the difference in polling between Trump and Biden be either 2 points or less, or greater than 3 points on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if both of the following criteria are satisfied:

1. Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear and official public statement that he will not pursue or accept the nomination of his party for another presidential term in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be clear-cut and definitive, eliminating any possibility that Biden would agree to accept the Democratic Party's nomination.

2. On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential race is either 2 points or fewer, or more than 3 points, as indicated on the chart for that date and referenced by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure shows a Trump advantage, while a negative figure shows a Biden advantage.

If either of these criteria is not met, this question will be resolved as **No**.

question.title: Will either Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, or will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

1. Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

2. Prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If neither of these conditions is met, this question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, nor will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs:

1. Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is not greater than 2 or not less than or equal to 3 in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

2. Prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes no definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will seek and will accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If either of these conditions is met, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Trump's advantage over Biden exceed 2 but not surpass 3 in 538's national polling average, or will Joe Biden publicly declare before this date that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if at least one of the following happens:

1. Donald Trump has a lead over Joe Biden that is more than 2 and at most 3 in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. In this context, a positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure indicates Biden is ahead.

2. Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official statement declaring that Joe Biden will not pursue and will not accept his party's nomination for another presidential term in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If neither of these scenarios occurs, this question will be answered with **No**.

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

not_P.title: Will 538 Project Biden as not the favorite on Friday?
not_P.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

para_P.title: Will 538 indicate Biden as the frontrunner on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a “Yes” if Joe Biden is projected to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Conversely, this market will conclude with a “No” if Donald Trump is forecasted to have a higher chance of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. In the event that Biden and Trump are shown to have equal probabilities, this market will resolve at 50-50.

The source for resolution will be the FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, found at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically referencing the values represented by the blue and red trend lines on the resolution date. Any changes to FiveThirtyEight's calculation methods will not affect the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve based on the data for July 19 as soon as data for July 20 is released. It may not reach a resolution until the data for July 20 is available. Should there be no data for July 19 by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve using the closest previous data to July 19.

Please note that the resolution will refer to the likelihood of each candidate winning as a percentage out of 100, reported to one decimal place (e.g., "Trump 57 out of 100"). The number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will not be taken into account.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris’ VP Pick be Kelly or Shapiro and will 538 Project Trump as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market resolves YES if BOTH of the following occur: (a) Kamala Harris announces her pick for running mate being either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro before August 7th, confirmed by Kamala herself, and (b) Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. 

The market resolves NO if either: (a) Kamala Harris announces anyone else as her running mate, or (b) Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024.

For Kamala Harris' VP pick, the resolution source is Kamala Harris' announcement. For the FiveThirtyEight projection, the resolution source is FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for July 19, 2024.

not_P.title: Will Kamala Harris’ VP Pick not be Kelly or Shapiro and will 538 Project Trump as the underdog on Friday?
not_P.body:
This market resolves YES if EITHER of the following occur: (a) Kamala Harris announces her pick for running mate being someone other than Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro before August 7th, confirmed by Kamala herself, or (b) Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. 

The market resolves NO if BOTH: (a) Kamala Harris announces her running mate being either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro, and (b) Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024.

For Kamala Harris' VP pick, the resolution source is Kamala Harris' announcement. For the FiveThirtyEight projection, the resolution source is FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for July 19, 2024.

para_P.title: Will Kamala Harris select either Kelly or Shapiro as her running mate and will FiveThirtyEight indicate Trump as the frontrunner on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will resolve to YES if BOTH of the following conditions are met: (a) Kamala Harris makes a public announcement regarding her choice of running mate, specifically naming either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro, before August 7th, and this is confirmed by Kamala herself, and (b) according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024, Donald Trump is projected to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden. 

The market will resolve to NO if either: (a) Kamala Harris announces a different individual as her running mate, or (b) Joe Biden is projected to have a higher chance of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024.

For the determination of Kamala Harris' choice of VP, the source of resolution will be her announcement. For the FiveThirtyEight forecast, the resolution will come from the 2024 presidential election forecast provided by FiveThirtyEight, specifically referencing the data shown by the blue and red trend lines for July 19, 2024.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) 538 Project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024, or (b) Kamala Harris pick Kelly or Shapiro as VP?
question.body:
(a) 538 Project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024: This will occur if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for July 19. Changes in methodology will not affect resolution. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, this will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

(b) Kamala Harris pick Kelly or Shapiro as VP: This will occur if Kamala Harris announces her pick for running mate being either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro before August 7th. The resolution will wait until the pick is confirmed by Kamala Harris herself.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) 538 Project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024, nor (b) Kamala Harris pick Kelly or Shapiro as VP?
not_P.body:
(a) 538 Project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024: This will not occur if Joe Biden does not have a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for July 19. Changes in methodology will not affect resolution. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, this will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

(b) Kamala Harris pick Kelly or Shapiro as VP: This will not occur if Kamala Harris does not announce her pick for running mate being either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro before August 7th. The resolution will wait until the pick is confirmed by Kamala Harris herself.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that one of the following will happen: (a) 538 will show Biden as the frontrunner on July 19, 2024, or (b) Kamala Harris will select either Kelly or Shapiro as her vice presidential candidate?
para_P.body:
(a) 538 showing Biden as the frontrunner on July 19, 2024: This will take place if Joe Biden is projected to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast on July 19, 2024. The source for resolution will be FiveThirtyEight's forecast for the 2024 presidential election, specifically referencing the data indicated by the blue and red trend lines for that date. Any changes in methodology will not influence the resolution. If there are no data points available for July 19 by July 22, the resolution will rely on the closest preceding figures to July 19.

(b) Kamala Harris selecting Kelly or Shapiro as her vice presidential pick: This will occur if Kamala Harris makes an announcement regarding her choice for running mate, specifically naming either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro, before August 7th. The resolution will depend on the confirmation of the pick by Kamala Harris herself.

It is important to note that a temporary shift of authority under the 25th amendment, appointing his VP as Acting President, does not result in a YES outcome for Biden continuing as President.

question.title: At the Paris Summer Olympics in 2024, will the men's 100m dash winning time break the Olympic record of 9.63s?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if any athlete runs the Men's 100M race at the 2024 Paris Summer Olympics in less than 9.63s, according to results posted by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or credible sources. Conversely, if this does not occur, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will seek and will accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Before July 15, 2024, will Joe Biden publicly declare that he will not be accepting the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will neither pursue nor accept the nomination from his party for another presidential term in the 2024 election.

For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it must eliminate any possibility that Biden would agree to accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear declaration is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Larry Elder be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and Kamala Harris not be nominated as the Democratic VP?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if BOTH of the following occur: (a) Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, AND (b) Kamala Harris is not nominated as the Democratic Vice President. 

For Larry Elder, this is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention). For Kamala Harris, the resolution is based on whether she is nominated as the Democratic VP. If she is not nominated, this part resolves to yes. If she is nominated, it resolves to no. The resolution for Kamala Harris can occur immediately after the nomination, and any changes to the VP after the initial nomination do not affect the resolution.
