para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Ted Cruz is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently listed; additional options may be introduced later.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who obtains the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively based on who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, and (b) Ted Cruz not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

This question resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. If such a statement is not made by the deadline, this resolves as No.

(b) Will Ted Cruz not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

This question resolves as Yes if Ted Cruz is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It does not matter who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

not_P.title: Will at least one of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will accept the Democratic nomination for President, or (b) Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

This question resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will seek and will accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. If such a statement is made by the deadline, this resolves as No.

(b) Will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

This question resolves as Yes if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It does not matter who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Joe Biden makes an announcement before July 15, 2024, stating he will not be accepting the Democratic nomination for President, and (b) Ted Cruz will not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) Is Joe Biden going to declare before July 15, 2024, that he will not pursue the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

This question will be answered with Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be explicit and definitive, allowing no possibility that Biden would agree to accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the upcoming election cycle. If such a declaration is not made by the specified deadline, the answer will be No.

(b) Is it the case that Ted Cruz will not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

This question will be answered with Yes if Ted Cruz is not chosen by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the election day; the determination is based solely on who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will either Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: 

1. Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, irrespective of who is the nominee on the day of the election.

2. Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.

If either of these conditions is met, the question resolves as **Yes**. If neither condition is met, the question resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election nor will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will accept the Democratic nomination for President?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs: 

1. Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, irrespective of who is the nominee on the day of the election.

2. Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will seek and will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would decline the nomination.

If either of these conditions is met, the question resolves as **No**. If neither condition is met, the question resolves as **Yes**.

para_P.title: Is Ted Cruz going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or will Joe Biden publicly declare before July 15, 2024 that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry is answered with **Yes** if at least one of the following takes place: 

1. Ted Cruz is chosen as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election by the Republican National Convention, as decided by its delegates, regardless of who is officially nominated on election day.

2. Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear and formal public statement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not run for and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be explicit and final, eliminating any possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.

If either of these scenarios occurs, the answer is **Yes**. If neither occurs, the answer is **No**.

question.title: On July 21, 2024, will the closing value of BSE SENSEX be greater than 75k and less than or equal to 76k?
question.body: This question resolves as the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, according to Yahoo Finance.

not_P.title: On July 21, 2024, will the closing value of BSE SENSEX be less than or equal to 75k or greater than 76k?
not_P.body: This question resolves as the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, according to Yahoo Finance.

para_P.title: Will the final value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, exceed 75,000 but not surpass 76,000?
para_P.body: This inquiry is determined by the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, as reported by Yahoo Finance.

question.title: Will BOTH of the following occur: (a) The linked market gets at least 377 traders by end of July 15, 2023, and (b) On July 21, 2024, the closing value of BSE SENSEX is less than or equal to 75k or greater than 76k?

(b) The question resolves based on the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, according to Yahoo Finance, being less than or equal to 75k or greater than 76k.

not_P.title: Will NOT BOTH of the following occur: (a) The linked market gets at least 377 traders by end of July 15, 2023, and (b) On July 21, 2024, the closing value of BSE SENSEX is less than or equal to 75k or greater than 76k?
not_P.body:
(a) The linked market will resolve NO if it has 377 traders before market close (July 15, 2023, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). Resolves YES otherwise. [Link: https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g]
(b) The question resolves based on the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, according to Yahoo Finance, being greater than 75k and less than or equal to 76k.

para_P.title: Is it true that BOTH of the following will happen: (a) The associated market achieves a minimum of 377 traders by the conclusion of July 15, 2023, and (b) On July 21, 2024, the final figure of BSE SENSEX is either 75k or lower, or exceeds 76k?
para_P.body:
(a) The associated market will confirm YES if it reaches 377 traders prior to market closure (July 15, 2023, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). It will confirm NO otherwise. [Link: https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g]
(b) The resolution of the question depends on the closing figure of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, as reported by Yahoo Finance, being 75k or less or greater than 76k.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) BSE SENSEX closes between 75k and 76k on July 21, 2024 (b) Mira's market gets at least 377 traders by July 15, 2024?
question.body: (a) The closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, must be greater than 75,000 and less than or equal to 76,000 according to Yahoo Finance. (b) Mira's market must have at least 377 traders by July 15, 2024, 11:59 PM Pacific Time, as per the linked market.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) BSE SENSEX closes between 75k and 76k on July 21, 2024 (b) Mira's market gets at least 377 traders by July 15, 2024?
not_P.body: (a) The closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, must not be greater than 75,000 or not be less than or equal to 76,000 according to Yahoo Finance. (b) Mira's market must not have at least 377 traders by July 15, 2024, 11:59 PM Pacific Time, as per the linked market.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following happens: (a) the BSE SENSEX finishes between 75,000 and 76,000 on July 21, 2024, or (b) Mira's market has a minimum of 377 traders by July 15, 2024?
para_P.body: (a) The final value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, needs to be more than 75,000 but not exceeding 76,000 according to Yahoo Finance. (b) Mira's market should have no fewer than 377 traders by July 15, 2024, at 11:59 PM Pacific Time, based on the referenced market.

question.title: Will Poland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Poland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Poland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Poland not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Poland does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Poland qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Poland set to reach the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Poland takes part in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if Poland fails to qualify, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will Ireland qualify and Poland fail to qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following occur: (a) Ireland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Poland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as not having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Ireland does not qualify or Poland qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Ireland not qualify or Poland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Ireland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as not having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) Poland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Ireland qualifies and Poland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Ireland make it to the Grand Final while Poland does not in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Ireland takes part in a Semi-final and is officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Poland takes part in a Semi-final and is officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as not having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Ireland fails to qualify or Poland qualifies, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will either Poland or Ireland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Poland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) Ireland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Poland nor Ireland qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither Poland nor Ireland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs: (a) Poland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) Ireland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Poland or Ireland qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Poland or Ireland make it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if at least one of the following happens: (a) Poland takes part in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a spot in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) Ireland competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a spot in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Poland nor Ireland advances, the inquiry will be deemed **No**.

question.title: Will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024.

The Data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

not_P.title: Will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI not increase by more than 0.1% in July?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 does not increase by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024.

The Data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that the Core CPI in the US will rise by over 0.1% from June to July?
para_P.body:
This will be considered a YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 shows an increase greater than 0.1% when compared to the figure for June 2024.

The resolution will be based on data from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL, using the precise (not rounded) value.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024 (b) The Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by 0.1% or less in July 2024?
question.body:
(a) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024: Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

(b) The Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by 0.1% or less in July 2024: Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by 0.1% or less compared to June 2024. The Data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Biden not be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024 (b) The Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) Biden not be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024: Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

(b) The Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July 2024: Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The Data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following will take place: (a) Biden is officially declared incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August 2024 (b) The US Core CPI sees a Month-over-Month rise of 0.1% or less in July 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Biden is officially declared incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August 2024: This will be considered YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another pertinent body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and duties of his office" and allows the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this inquiry. Biden leaving the Presidency through death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment is also not included.

(b) The US Core CPI experiences a Month-over-Month increase of 0.1% or less in July 2024: This will be deemed YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 rises by 0.1% or less compared to June 2024. The data for resolution will be sourced from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will utilize the exact (not rounded) figure.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) The Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July 2024, or (b) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024?
question.body:
(a) The question about the US Core CPI resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The data for resolution will be sourced from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

(b) The question about Biden resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count. Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) The Month-over-Month US Core CPI not increase by more than 0.1% in July 2024, nor (b) Biden not be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) The question about the US Core CPI resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 does not increase by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The data for resolution will be sourced from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

(b) The question about Biden resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and do not cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count. Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that either (a) the US Core CPI will rise by over 0.1% from June to July 2024, or (b) Biden will be officially recognized as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry regarding the US Core CPI will be answered affirmatively if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 shows an increase greater than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The resolution data will be obtained from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL, utilizing the precise (not rounded) figure.

(b) The question concerning Biden will be answered affirmatively if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or another pertinent body) activate Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and duties of his office" and subsequently appoint the Vice President as Acting President, prior to August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this question. Events such as Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., are not considered. Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not applicable. Context: A GOP lawmaker has requested Merrick Garland to invoke the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from the presidency.

question.title: Will Chris Christie be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Chris Christie is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

not_P.title: Will Chris Christie not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Chris Christie is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: Will Chris Christie be chosen as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Chris Christie is appointed by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently discussed; additional options may emerge later.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republicans on the day of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively determined by the choice made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden drops out before 7/13 and (b) Chris Christie is not the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: (a) Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue his run as president before midnight July 13 Central Time. (b) Chris Christie is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

not_P.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Biden does not drop out before 7/13 or (b) Chris Christie is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body: (a) Biden does not drop out or is otherwise able to continue his run as president after midnight July 13 Central Time. (b) Chris Christie is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of these events take place: (a) Biden withdraws from the race before 7/13 and (b) Chris Christie does not become the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body: (a) Biden withdraws or is otherwise incapacitated from continuing his presidential campaign before midnight on July 13 Central Time. (b) Chris Christie is not chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Chris Christie be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) Biden drop out before July 13, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Chris Christie will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election if he is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee. This is not restricted to currently mentioned candidates; other options may be added later. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the nomination on the day of the election.

(b) Biden will drop out if he either voluntarily withdraws or is otherwise unable to continue his run as president before midnight July 13, 2024, Central Time. If either of these conditions is met, the market will resolve to yes.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Chris Christie be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, nor (b) Biden drop out before July 13, 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) Chris Christie will not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election if he is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee. This is not restricted to currently mentioned candidates; other options may be added later. It is solely determined by who is not selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who does not receive the nomination on the day of the election.

(b) Biden will not drop out if he neither voluntarily withdraws nor is otherwise unable to continue his run as president before midnight July 13, 2024, Central Time. If neither of these conditions is met, the market will resolve to no.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following will happen: (a) Chris Christie becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) Biden resigns before July 13, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Chris Christie will be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election if he is chosen by the Republican National Convention as their nominee. This is not limited to the candidates currently discussed; additional candidates may emerge later. The decision is solely based on who is chosen by the delegates at the Republican National Convention, rather than who is nominated on election day.

(b) Biden will resign if he either chooses to step down or is otherwise unable to continue his presidential campaign before midnight on July 13, 2024, Central Time. If either of these scenarios occurs, the market will conclude with a yes.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

not_P.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain less than 3% among Manifold respondents?
not_P.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by less than 3% when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 < 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Trump competes against Joe Biden rather than a standard Democrat, will he increase his support by at least 3% among Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
There are two polls from Manifold that will close on July 6. One poll asks Manifold participants to cast their votes for Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other asks them to vote for a standard Democrat on a similar ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Surveys of public sentiment frequently indicate that Joe Biden is trailing Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, whereas every other Democrat considered in hypothetical scenarios tends to either lead or remain within the margin of error. Are the Manifold participants reflective of the broader public?

This market will conclude with a YES if the proportion of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or more upon the closing of both polls.

The calculation for determining Trump’s vote percentage is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). The result is YES if the difference between the calculations for poll 1 and poll 2 is at least 0.03. If not, the result is NO.

The polls and this question will not resolve as N/A, and will stay open until the designated closing time regardless of circumstances.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump testifies at the hush money trial (b) Trump gains less than 3% among Manifold respondents facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. [Credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

2. In the Manifold polls that close on July 6, the percentage of votes for Donald Trump when facing Joe Biden does not exceed that when facing a generic Democrat by 3% or more. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 < 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO. The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump testifies at the hush money trial (b) Trump gains 3% or more among Manifold respondents facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following conditions are met:

1. [Credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has not testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

2. In the Manifold polls that close on July 6, the percentage of votes for Donald Trump when facing Joe Biden exceeds that when facing a generic Democrat by 3% or more. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO. The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: Are the following two events going to happen: (a) Donald Trump provides testimony at the hush money trial (b) Trump receives less than 3% of support among Manifold respondents when compared to Joe Biden rather than a generic Democrat?
para_P.body:
This question will be considered **Yes** if both of these criteria are satisfied:

1. [Reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) confirm that Donald Trump has given testimony, either in person or via remote means, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) related to the alleged "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

2. In the Manifold surveys closing on July 6, the share of votes for Donald Trump against Joe Biden does not surpass that against a generic Democrat by 3% or more. The calculation for the share of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The result is YES if the calculation for poll 1 minus the calculation for poll 2 is less than 0.03. If not, it is NO. The polls and this inquiry will never resolve as N/A and will stay open until the closing time, regardless of circumstances.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Biden vs a generic Democrat, (b) Trump testifies at the hush money trial?
question.body:
(a) There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot. Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error. This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO. The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

(b) This question will resolve as YES if credible sources report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Biden vs a generic Democrat, (b) Trump does not testify at the hush money trial?
not_P.body:
(a) There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot. Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error. This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO. The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

(b) This question will resolve as YES if there are no credible sources reporting Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that one of the following happens: (a) Trump achieves a minimum of 3% more support among Manifold respondents when compared to a generic Democrat versus Biden, (b) Trump provides testimony in the hush money trial?
para_P.body: (a) Two Manifold polls are available, both closing on July 6. One poll surveys Manifold respondents about voting for Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other asks about voting for a generic Democrat. Public opinion surveys generally indicate that Joe Biden trails Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, whereas other Democrats surveyed typically either lead or are within the margin of error. This market will be marked YES if Donald Trump's vote percentage in poll 1 is at least 3% greater than in poll 2 at the time both polls close. The calculation for Trump's vote percentage is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The result is YES if the difference between poll 1's formula and poll 2's formula is 0.03 or greater. If not, it will be NO. The polls and this question will not resolve as N/A and will stay open until the designated closing time regardless.

question.title: Will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

not_P.title: Will Biden not drop out before July 20?
not_P.body: If Biden does not drop out and is able to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

para_P.title: Is it possible for Biden to withdraw from the race prior to July 20?
para_P.body: If Biden withdraws or is otherwise incapacitated from continuing his campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20, this market will be considered a yes. If he does not, the market will be deemed a no.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump is removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, and (b) Biden does not drop out before July 20, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

(b) Biden does not drop out and is able to continue the race until July 20, 2024, midnight Eastern Time. If Biden drops out before this time, the question will resolve as "No".

The question will resolve as "No" if either or both of these conditions are not met.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump is removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, nor (b) Biden drops out before July 20, 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if neither of the following conditions are met:

(a) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The lack of removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has not been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves positively.

(b) Biden drops out before July 20, 2024, midnight Eastern Time. If Biden does not drop out before this time, the question will resolve as "Yes".

The question will resolve as "No" if either or both of these conditions are met.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that the following two events will take place: (a) Donald Trump is barred or excluded from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, and (b) Biden remains in the race without withdrawing before July 20, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if both of these conditions are satisfied:

(a) By July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially barred or excluded from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This exclusion or barring must be validated through official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution. The question does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may happen after the specified date. It strictly concerns whether Donald Trump has been excluded from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is excluded from a ballot and later reinstated, resulting in him not being excluded from any ballot as of July 15th, the question will resolve negatively.

(b) Biden does not withdraw and is able to remain in the race until midnight Eastern Time on July 20, 2024. If Biden withdraws before this deadline, the question will resolve as "No".

The question will resolve as "No" if either or both of these conditions fail to be met.

question.title: Will either Biden drop out before July 20, 2024, or Donald Trump be removed from the primary ballot of any U.S. state under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as "Yes" if either of the following conditions is met: (a) Joe Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20, 2024, midnight Eastern Time. (b) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question regarding Trump will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. Note: The question about Trump does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

not_P.title: Will neither Biden drop out before July 20, 2024, nor Donald Trump be removed from the primary ballot of any U.S. state under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as "Yes" if neither of the following conditions is met: (a) Joe Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20, 2024, midnight Eastern Time. (b) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question regarding Trump will resolve as "No" if these conditions are met as of July 15, 2024. Note: The question about Trump does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has not been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves positively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Joe Biden will withdraw from the race prior to July 20, 2024, or that Donald Trump will be disqualified from the primary ballot in any U.S. state due to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if one of the following scenarios occurs: (a) Joe Biden withdraws from or is unable to proceed with the campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20, 2024. (b) As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The disqualification or prevention must be validated through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media sources. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution. The question regarding Trump will be answered with "No" if these criteria are not satisfied by July 15, 2024. Note: The inquiry concerning Trump does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or any subsequent changes that may arise after the specified date. It solely focuses on whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state’s primary election ballot for a federal office under the stated conditions as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or prevented from a ballot and then later reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or prevented from any ballot, the question will resolve negatively.

question.title: Will Inflection publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body: For Inflection, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

not_P.title: Will Inflection not publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
not_P.body: For Inflection, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they do not publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

para_P.title: Is it expected that Inflection will release a public report detailing the findings from an external red-team assessment of their models' safety by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body: For Inflection, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they release a *public* report containing the findings from an *external* entity red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by June 30, 2024: (a) OpenAI's ChatGPT will be generally available in the European Union, and (b) Inflection will not publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety?
question.body:
This question resolves as **YES** if both of the following conditions are met by June 30, 2024:

(a) [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024. "Generally available" means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries, or unavailable to certain groups (e.g., minors), this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for interacting with GPT models, and resolves positively if the service is substantially the same, even if the name or website changes.

(b) Inflection does not publish a *public* report with results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024.

The question resolves as **NO** if either condition (a) or condition (b) is not met by the specified date.

not_P.title: Will at least one of the following occur by June 30, 2024: (a) OpenAI's ChatGPT will not be generally available in the European Union, or (b) Inflection will publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as **YES** if at least one of the following conditions is met by June 30, 2024:

(a) [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is not generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024. This means that the default state for people in the EU is that they cannot access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If available in certain EU countries, or available to certain groups (e.g., minors), this will still resolve negatively, assuming at least >50% of the population cannot use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for interacting with GPT models, and resolves negatively if the service is not substantially the same, even if the name or website changes.

(b) Inflection publishes a *public* report with results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024.

The question resolves as **NO** if both condition (a) and condition (b) are met by the specified date.

para_P.title: By June 30, 2024, will both of the following take place: (a) OpenAI's ChatGPT will be widely accessible in the European Union, and (b) Inflection will refrain from releasing a report detailing results from external red-teaming of their models regarding safety?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **YES** if both of the following criteria are satisfied by June 30, 2024:

(a) [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is widely accessible in the EU on June 30, 2024. "Widely accessible" indicates that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without needing a VPN (possibly requiring payment). If it is not available in specific EU nations, or not accessible to certain demographics (e.g., minors), it will still be considered positive as long as more than 50% of the population can utilize it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for interacting with GPT models, and it will be deemed positive if the service remains largely unchanged, even if the branding or website alters.

(b) Inflection does not release a *public* report with findings from an *external* entity red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024.

The question will be answered with **NO** if either condition (a) or condition (b) is not fulfilled by the designated date.

question.title: Will either Inflection publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024, or OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **YES** if at least one of the following occurs by the specified dates:

(a) Inflection publishes a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024.

(b) OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024. "Generally available" means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN, possibly requiring payment. It resolves positively even if unavailable in certain EU countries or to certain demographics, as long as >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for interacting with GPT models, resolving positively if the service remains substantially the same even if rebranded.

not_P.title: Will neither Inflection publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024, nor OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as **YES** if neither of the following occurs by the specified dates:

(a) Inflection publishes a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024.

(b) OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024. "Generally available" means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN, possibly requiring payment. It resolves positively even if unavailable in certain EU countries or to certain demographics, as long as >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for interacting with GPT models, resolving positively if the service remains substantially the same even if rebranded.

para_P.title: By June 30, 2024, will Inflection release a report detailing the outcomes of external safety assessments of their models, or will OpenAI's ChatGPT be accessible to users in the European Union?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be marked as **YES** if at least one of the following takes place by the given deadlines:

(a) Inflection issues a *public* document showcasing the findings from an *external* evaluation of the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024.

(b) OpenAI's ChatGPT is available for general use in the European Union on June 30, 2024. "Generally available" indicates that for most individuals in the EU, access is granted without the need for a VPN, and may involve a fee. It counts as a yes even if it is not accessible in some EU nations or to specific groups, provided that over 50% of the population can utilize it. "ChatGPT" refers to the standard web interface for engaging with GPT models, and it resolves positively if the service remains largely unchanged, even if it undergoes rebranding.

question.title: Will Scotland hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if there is a referendum held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom, and this referendum is held before May 3, 2024.  This referendum may be an "advisory" referendum; that is, it is not necessary for the referendum to have any legally binding effect.

It shall not be deemed resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style of referendum where the UK government has declined permission for the vote, nor by a vote organised by civil society institutions. A referendum must be deemed to have the consent of the London government

not_P.title: Will Scotland not hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if there is no referendum held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom, and this referendum is held before May 3, 2024.  This referendum may be an "advisory" referendum; that is, it is not necessary for the referendum to have any legally binding effect.

It shall be deemed resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style of referendum where the UK government has declined permission for the vote, nor by a vote organised by civil society institutions. A referendum must not be deemed to have the consent of the London government.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Scotland will conduct a formal, authorized referendum on its independence prior to May 3, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if a referendum concerning Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom takes place in Scotland before May 3, 2024. This referendum can be categorized as an "advisory" referendum; it is not required for the referendum to possess any legal binding authority.

A referendum will not be considered resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” type of referendum where the UK government has refused to grant permission for the vote, nor by a vote organized by civil society organizations. A referendum must have the approval of the London government to be valid.

(b) Resolves YES if there is no referendum held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom before May 3, 2024, or if any referendum held does not have the consent of the London government. It will not resolve as Yes if a "wildcat" or "Catalan" style of referendum is held without UK government permission, or if a vote is organised by civil society institutions without official sanction.

(a) Resolves YES if the market embedded in the link (https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g) does not have 377 traders before market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). Resolves NO otherwise.

(b) Resolves YES if there is a referendum held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom before May 3, 2024, or if any referendum held has the consent of the London government. It will resolve as Yes if a "wildcat" or "Catalan" style of referendum is held without UK government permission, or if a vote is organised by civil society institutions with official sanction.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) the linked market will have a minimum of 377 traders by the end of July 15, 2023, and (b) Scotland will not conduct an official, authorized referendum on independence prior to May 3, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the market referenced in the link (https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g) achieves 377 traders before the market closes (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). Resolves NO in all other cases.

(b) Resolves YES if Scotland does not hold any referendum concerning its independence from the United Kingdom before May 3, 2024, or if any referendum that takes place lacks the approval of the London government. It will not resolve as Yes if a "wildcat" or "Catalan" type of referendum occurs without UK government authorization, or if a vote is organized by civil society groups without official endorsement.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Scotland holds an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024, or (b) the linked market gets at least 377 traders by end of July 15, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Will Scotland hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024? This question will resolve as **Yes** if there is a referendum held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom, and this referendum is held before May 3, 2024.  This referendum may be an "advisory" referendum; that is, it is not necessary for the referendum to have any legally binding effect. It shall not be deemed resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style of referendum where the UK government has declined permission for the vote, nor by a vote organised by civil society institutions. A referendum must be deemed to have the consent of the London government.

(b) Will the linked market get at least 377 traders by end of July 15, 2024? Resolves YES if the market embedded above has 377 traders before market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). Resolves NO otherwise.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Scotland holds an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024, nor (b) the linked market gets at least 377 traders by end of July 15, 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) Will Scotland not hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024? This question will resolve as **Yes** if there is no referendum held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom, and this referendum is not held before May 3, 2024. This referendum may be an "advisory" referendum; that is, it is not necessary for the referendum to have any legally binding effect. It shall be deemed resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style of referendum where the UK government has declined permission for the vote, nor by a vote organised by civil society institutions. A referendum must be deemed to have the consent of the London government.

(b) Will the linked market not get at least 377 traders by end of July 15, 2024? Resolves YES if the market embedded above has fewer than 377 traders before market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following happens: (a) Scotland conducts an official, authorized referendum on independence prior to May 3, 2024, or (b) the associated market attracts a minimum of 377 traders by the conclusion of July 15, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Is Scotland set to conduct an official, authorized referendum on its independence before May 3, 2024? This question will be resolved as **Yes** if a referendum concerning Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom takes place, and it occurs before May 3, 2024. This referendum may be classified as an 'advisory' referendum; it is not required to have any legally binding consequences. It will not be considered resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” type of referendum where the UK government has refused permission for the vote, nor by a vote organized by civil society groups. A referendum must have the approval of the London government.

(b) Is the linked market expected to have at least 377 traders by the end of July 15, 2024? Resolves YES if the market mentioned above has 377 traders before it closes (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). Resolves NO otherwise.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will seek and will accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden declare before July 15, 2024 that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue nor accept the nomination from his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would agree to accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will be answered with **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, and (b) Joe Biden not announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. **Russia's Control of Chasiv Yar**: When accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:
   - Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine
   - Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours
   - Assessed Russian Control
   - Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine
   - Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location

   The question will resolve as **No** with respect to this condition if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:
   - Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours
   - Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives
   - Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare
   - Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location.

2. **Joe Biden's Announcement**: Prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign does not make a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

   To qualify for a **Yes** resolution with respect to this condition, the absence of such a statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: there should be no room for the possibility that Biden has announced he would not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

   If such a definitive statement is made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this condition will resolve as **No**.

The overall question will resolve as **Yes** only if both conditions are satisfied as described above. If either condition resolves as **No**, the overall question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, nor (b) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following conditions are met:

1. **Russia's Control of Chasiv Yar**: When accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as NOT under any of the following categories:
   - Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine
   - Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours
   - Assessed Russian Control
   - Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine
   - Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location.

   The question will resolve as **No** with respect to this condition if the location is assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:
   - Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours
   - Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives
   - Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare
   - Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location.

2. **Joe Biden's Announcement**: Prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will seek and will accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

   To qualify for a **Yes** resolution with respect to this condition, the presence of such a statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: there should be no room for the possibility that Biden has not announced he would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

   If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this condition will resolve as **No**.

The overall question will resolve as **Yes** only if neither condition is satisfied as described above. If either condition resolves as **Yes**, the overall question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Russia controls Chasiv Yar by June 1, 2024, and (b) Joe Biden does not publicly declare before July 15, 2024, that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if both of the subsequent criteria are fulfilled:

1. **Russia's Control of Chasiv Yar**: Upon review by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) indicates the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E are classified under any of these categories:
   - Evaluated Russian Advance in Ukraine
   - Evaluated Russian Gains in the Last 24 Hours
   - Evaluated Russian Control
   - Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine
   - Any additional categories established by ISW that signify Russian authority over the area

   The inquiry will be marked as **No** regarding this criterion if the site is not classified within any of the categories that denote Russian authority, which includes but is not limited to:
   - Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Last 24 Hours
   - Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives
   - Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare
   - Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian authority over the area or a lack of Russian authority over the area.

2. **Joe Biden's Announcement**: Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign does not make a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

   To achieve a **Yes** resolution regarding this condition, the lack of such an announcement must be clear and definitive: there should be no uncertainty that Biden has declared he would not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

   If such a clear statement is made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this criterion will resolve as **No**.

The overall inquiry will be marked as **Yes** only if both criteria are met as specified above. If either criterion resolves as **No**, the overall inquiry will resolve as **No**.
