question.title: Will Georgia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Georgia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For any other outcome, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Georgia not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Georgia does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For any other outcome, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Georgia set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Georgia takes part in a Semi-final and is formally declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. For all other results, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Estonia qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, and (b) Georgia fails to qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Estonia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (2) Georgia either does not participate in a Semi-final or is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as not having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either or both of these conditions are not met, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Estonia does not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, or (b) Georgia qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following conditions are met: (1) Estonia does not participate in a Semi-final or is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as not having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (2) Georgia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If both of these conditions are met, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Estonia secures a spot in the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024, and (b) Georgia does not secure a spot in the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if both of the following criteria are fulfilled: (1) Estonia competes in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (2) Georgia either does not compete in a Semi-final or is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having not advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either or both of these criteria are not fulfilled, the question will be answered with **No**.

question.title: Will either Georgia or Estonia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Georgia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) Estonia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For any other outcome, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither Georgia nor Estonia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs: (a) Georgia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, nor (b) Estonia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For any other outcome, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will either Georgia or Estonia make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if at least one of the following happens: (a) Georgia competes in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having made it to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) Estonia competes in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the EBU as having made it to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither occurs, the question will be resolved as **No**.

question.title: Will Kalenjin athletes win both the men's and women's marathon races at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if both the winner of the men's and winner's marathon at the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris have Kalenjin roots, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

not_P.title: Will Kalenjin athletes not win both the men's and women's marathon races at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either the winner of the men's marathon or the winner's marathon at the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris do not have Kalenjin roots, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

para_P.title: Will Kalenjin runners secure victories in both the men's and women's marathon events at the 2024 Paris Olympic Games?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if both the male and female marathon champions at the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris are of Kalenjin heritage, as per [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) A swimmer wins the most gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics (b) Kalenjin athletes fail to win at least one of the men's or women's marathon races at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body:
(a) The question resolves as **Yes** if the athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events.
(b) This question resolves as **Yes** if either the winner of the men's marathon or the winner of the women's marathon at the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris does not have Kalenjin roots, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) A swimmer does not win the most gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics (b) Kalenjin athletes win at least one of the men's or women's marathon races at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
not_P.body:
(a) The question resolves as **Yes** if the athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals does not compete in the swimming events.
(b) This question resolves as **Yes** if both the winner of the men's marathon and the winner of the women's marathon at the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris have Kalenjin roots, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

para_P.title: Is it true that: (a) A swimmer secures the highest number of gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics and (b) Kalenjin runners do not achieve at least one victory in either the men's or women's marathon events at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body:
(a) The resolution is **Yes** if the athlete who accumulates the most gold medals in swimming at the 2024 Olympics participates in those events.
(b) This question resolves as **Yes** if the champion of the men's marathon or the champion of the women's marathon at the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris does not have Kalenjin heritage, based on [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

question.title: Will either Kalenjin athletes win both the men's and women's marathon races at the 2024 Paris Olympics or a swimmer win the most gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Both the winner of the men's and women's marathon at the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris have Kalenjin roots, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions). (b) The athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events.

not_P.title: Will neither Kalenjin athletes win both the men's and women's marathon races at the 2024 Paris Olympics nor a swimmer win the most gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs: (a) Both the winner of the men's and women's marathon at the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris have Kalenjin roots, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions). (b) The athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events.

para_P.title: Is it possible for Kalenjin runners to secure victories in both the men's and women's marathon events at the 2024 Paris Olympics, or for a swimmer to achieve the highest gold medal count at the same Olympics?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if at least one of the following conditions is met: (a) The champions of both the men's and women's marathon events at the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris have Kalenjin heritage, as confirmed by [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions). (b) The competitor with the most gold medals at the 2024 Olympics is a swimmer.

question.title: If Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet cover the story at least 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
Question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.

Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient.

This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

not_P.title: If Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet not cover the story at least 6 hours in advance?
not_P.body:
Question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post does not cover the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.

Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient.

This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

para_P.title: Should Joe Biden decide to withdraw, will a credible news source report on it at least 6 hours prior?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered YES if a major and trustworthy news organization such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post reports the withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden makes his official announcement of withdrawal through a letter, speech, etc.

Coverage from local news, conspiracy theory websites, or comments made by individual users on Manifold will not be considered sufficient.

This market will be deemed N/A if President Joe Biden does not withdraw before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Donald Trump Jr. is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (2) If Joe Biden drops out, no reliable media outlet covers the story at least 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
(1) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(2) This question resolves YES if no big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.

Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient.

This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

not_P.title: Will at least one of the following occur: (1) Donald Trump Jr. is not the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (2) If Joe Biden drops out, at least one reliable media outlet covers the story at least 6 hours in advance?
not_P.body:
(1) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **Yes** as well. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(2) This question resolves YES if at least one big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.

Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient.

This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (1) Donald Trump Jr. becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (2) If Joe Biden withdraws, no credible media outlet reports the news at least 6 hours beforehand?
para_P.body:
(1) This question will be marked as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will be marked as **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently in the spotlight; other possibilities may emerge later.

For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republicans on election day in 2024; it solely depends on the selection made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(2) This question will be considered YES if no major and trustworthy media outlet such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post reports on the withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours prior to President Joe Biden's official announcement of his withdrawal through a letter, speech, etc.

Local news, conspiracy sites, or statements from individual users on Manifold will not suffice.

This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not withdraw before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) A reliable media outlet covers Joe Biden's dropout at least 6 hours in advance, or (b) Donald Trump Jr. is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

question.title: Will Francis Suarez be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) FiveThirtyEight project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024; (b) Francis Suarez not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) FiveThirtyEight will project Joe Biden as having a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to their election forecast for July 19, 2024. The resolution will be based on the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast website. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this will resolve 50-50. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the nearest previous figures to July 19 will be used.
(b) Francis Suarez will not be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The question will resolve as Yes if any other candidate is selected. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

not_P.title: Will not both of the following occur: (a) FiveThirtyEight project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024; (b) Francis Suarez be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
(a) FiveThirtyEight will not project Joe Biden as having a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to their election forecast for July 19, 2024. The resolution will be based on the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast website. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this will resolve 50-50. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the nearest previous figures to July 19 will be used.
(b) Francis Suarez will be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The question will resolve as Yes if he is selected.

para_P.body:
(a) FiveThirtyEight will indicate that Joe Biden has a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump based on their election forecast dated July 19, 2024. The outcome will rely on the values shown by the blue and red trend lines on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast page. If Biden and Trump have the same probability, this will be resolved as 50-50. If there are no data points available for July 19 by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the closest prior figures to July 19 will be referenced.
(b) Francis Suarez will not be nominated by the Republican National Convention for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The answer will be Yes if any other candidate is chosen. This is determined solely by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Francis Suarez is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024.

For part (a), the resolution is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention). This is not restricted to candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For part (b), the resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for July 19, 2024. Changes in FiveThirtyEight's methodology will not affect the resolution. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this part will resolve 50-50. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, it will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

For part (a), the resolution is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention). This is not restricted to candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For part (b), the resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for July 19, 2024. Changes in FiveThirtyEight's methodology will not affect the resolution. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this part will resolve 50-50. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, it will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

para_P.body:
The answer to this inquiry will be **Yes** if at least one of the following conditions is met: (a) Francis Suarez is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) Joe Biden is projected to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump, according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024.

For condition (b), the resolution will rely on FiveThirtyEight's forecast for the 2024 presidential election, specifically the values represented by the blue and red trend lines for July 19, 2024. Adjustments in FiveThirtyEight's methods will not influence the outcome. If Biden and Trump are shown to have equal chances, this portion will resolve at 50-50. If there are no data points available for July 19 by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the resolution will be based on the closest preceding figures to July 19.

(b) Resolves YES if the domestic box office opening for "Deadpool & Wolverine" reported by Boxofficemojo on the movie's page is not higher than $185,548,391, which is the sum of the box openings for "Deadpool" (2016) and "The Wolverine" (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752. This question resolves the same as the original on Metaculus, and once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that one of the following happens: (a) Taylor Swift makes a cameo in Deadpool and Wolverine (b) The opening weekend earnings of "Deadpool & Wolverine" surpass those of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be marked as YES if Taylor Swift appears in the film "Deadpool & Wolverine" in any capacity, including just providing her voice for a character. It will also be considered YES even if she is not listed on IMDB, provided that independent sources confirm her involvement.

(b) This will be marked as YES if the opening weekend revenue for "Deadpool & Wolverine" reported by Boxofficemojo on the film's page exceeds $185,548,391, which is the total of the opening earnings for "Deadpool" (2016) and "The Wolverine" (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752. The resolution of this question will align with the original on Metaculus, and once the original is resolved, its outcome will automatically apply to this market.

question.title: Will Malta qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Malta participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If they do not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Malta not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Malta does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If they qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Malta going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Malta takes part in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if they fail to qualify, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will Serbia qualify and Malta fail to qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following occur: (a) Serbia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final; and (b) Malta does not qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, meaning they either do not participate in a Semi-final or are not announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Grand Final. If either Serbia does not qualify or Malta qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Serbia not qualify or Malta qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Serbia does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final; or (b) Malta qualifies for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, meaning they participate in a Semi-final and are announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Grand Final. If both Serbia qualifies and Malta does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Serbia make it to the Grand Final while Malta does not?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Serbia competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having made it to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final; and (b) Malta does not make it to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, which means they either do not compete in a Semi-final or are not recognized by the EBU as having qualified for the Grand Final. If either Serbia fails to qualify or Malta qualifies, the inquiry will be marked as **No**.

question.title: Will either Malta or Serbia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Malta participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (b) Serbia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither Malta nor Serbia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs: (a) Malta participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (b) Serbia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Malta or Serbia make it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if one of the following takes place: (a) Malta competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (b) Serbia competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither of them qualifies, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: On July 17, 2024, will Nvidia's market capitalization be larger than Apple's?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if, on July 17, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

not_P.title: On July 17, 2024, will Nvidia's market capitalization not be larger than Apple's?
not_P.body: This question resolves Yes if, on July 17, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is not greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

para_P.title: Will Nvidia's market valuation exceed that of Apple on July 17, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a Yes if, as of July 17, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization surpasses Apple's, based on Companies Market Cap, verified by Metaculus around 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump is removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, and (b) Nvidia's market capitalization is not larger than Apple's on July 17, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

(b) On July 17, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is not greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

The question will resolve as "No" if either or both of these conditions are not met.

not_P.title: Will at least one of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump is not removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, or (b) Nvidia's market capitalization is larger than Apple's on July 17, 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if at least one of the following conditions is met:

(a) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The lack of removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has not been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

(b) On July 17, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

The question will resolve as "No" if both of these conditions are met.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Donald Trump is barred or excluded from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, and (b) Nvidia's market value does not exceed that of Apple's on July 17, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered "Yes" if both of the following criteria are satisfied:

(a) As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially barred or excluded from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The barring or exclusion must be validated through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media coverage. Speculative articles, opinion columns, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution. This question does not take into account any legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that could occur after the specified date. It strictly relates to whether Donald Trump has been barred from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is initially barred or excluded from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not barred or excluded from any ballot, the question will resolve as "No."

(b) On July 17, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization is not greater than that of Apple, as reported by Companies Market Cap, when assessed by Metaculus around 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

The question will resolve as "No" if either or both of these conditions fail to be met.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by mid-July 2024: (1) Nvidia's market capitalization exceeds Apple's on July 17, 2024, or (2) Donald Trump is removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves to Yes if at least one of the following conditions is met:

1. On July 17, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization is greater than Apple's, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

2. By July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question resolves to No if neither of these conditions are met by their respective dates.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur by mid-July 2024: (1) Nvidia's market capitalization exceeds Apple's on July 17, 2024, nor (2) Donald Trump is removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024?
not_P.body:
This question resolves to Yes if neither of the following conditions is met:

1. On July 17, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization is not greater than Apple's, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

2. By July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question resolves to No if at least one of these conditions is met by their respective dates.

para_P.title: Is it possible that by mid-July 2024, either Nvidia's market value surpasses that of Apple on July 17, 2024, or Donald Trump faces removal or disqualification from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position as per Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will yield a Yes if at least one of the following scenarios occurs:

1. On July 17, 2024, Nvidia's market value exceeds that of Apple, as reported by Companies Market Cap, when verified by Metaculus around 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

2. By July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or removed from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This must be substantiated through official state government announcements, court rulings, legal documents, or reliable media sources. Unofficial announcements, opinion articles, or speculative reports will not be adequate for resolution.

The question will resolve to No if neither of these conditions are fulfilled by their respective deadlines.

question.title: Will the linked market get at least 377 traders by end of July 15? (78 more!)
question.body:
Sorry to my extremely loyal followers, I’ve become embroiled in some market shenanigans, so I’m making this market.

(https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g)Resolves YES if the market embedded above has 377 traders before market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). Resolves NO otherwise.

not_P.title: Will the linked market not get at least 377 traders by end of July 15? (78 more!)
not_P.body:
Sorry to my extremely loyal followers, I’ve become embroiled in some market shenanigans, so I’m making this market.

(https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g)Resolves YES if the market embedded above has no proof/evidence/reports of 377 traders before market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the linked market to reach a total of 377 traders by the end of July 15? (An increase of 78 traders!)
para_P.body:
I apologize to my incredibly loyal supporters; I've found myself caught up in some market antics, which is why I'm creating this market.

(https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g)This will resolve to YES if the market linked above achieves 377 traders before it closes (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). It will resolve to NO if it does not.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) ISS advises voting against Elon Musk's pay package or Kimbal Musk's re-election, and (b) the linked market gets fewer than 377 traders by July 15?
question.body:
(a) The question will resolve **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) releases a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors. Otherwise the question will resolve as **No**.

(b) Resolves YES if the market embedded above has fewer than 377 traders before market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). Resolves NO otherwise.

not_P.title: Will at least one of the following occur: (a) ISS does not advise voting against Elon Musk's pay package and Kimbal Musk's re-election, or (b) the linked market gets 377 traders or more by July 15?
not_P.body:
(a) The question will resolve **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) does not release a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting AND does not advise against the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors. Otherwise the question will resolve as **No**.

(b) Resolves YES if the market embedded above has 377 traders or more before market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) ISS recommends shareholders vote against the compensation package of Elon Musk or the re-election of Kimbal Musk, and (b) the specified market has less than 377 participants by July 15?
para_P.body:
(a) The outcome will be **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) publishes a notice clearly urging Tesla investors to vote *against* Elon Musk's compensation at the 2024 Tesla shareholder gathering OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board. If not, the outcome will be **No**.

(b) The question will resolve YES if the market mentioned above has fewer than 377 participants before the market closes (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). It will resolve NO in all other cases.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) The linked market gets at least 377 traders by end of July 15 (b) ISS advises Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's $57 billion package or the re-election of Kimbal Musk?
question.body: (a) The linked market will resolve YES if it has 377 traders before market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). It will resolve NO otherwise. (b) The question will resolve YES if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) releases a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors. Otherwise, the question will resolve as NO.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) The linked market gets at least 377 traders by end of July 15 (b) ISS advises Tesla shareholders to vote in favor of Elon Musk's $57 billion package and the re-election of Kimbal Musk?
not_P.body: (a) The linked market will resolve YES if it does not have 377 traders before market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). It will resolve NO otherwise. (b) The question will resolve YES if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) does not release a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting AND the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors. Otherwise, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following happens: (a) The associated market reaches a minimum of 377 traders by the close of July 15 (b) ISS recommends that Tesla investors oppose Elon Musk's $57 billion compensation package or the re-election of Kimbal Musk?
para_P.body: (a) The associated market will be deemed YES if it achieves 377 traders prior to market closure (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). It will be marked NO if it does not. (b) The inquiry will be considered YES if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) issues a statement clearly advising Tesla investors to oppose Elon Musk's remuneration package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the board of directors at Tesla. If not, the inquiry will be marked as NO.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but not exceeding 3, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden as indicated by 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure signifies a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure indicates Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, and (b) Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

(b) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, nor (b) Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
(a) This question will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must not be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

(b) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 20, 2024, will there be an increase in the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) compared to the same date in the previous year, and will Trump's advantage over Biden be either 2 or less, or exceed 3 on July 15, 2024, according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
(a) The resolution of this question will depend on the data provided by the St. Louis Fed found here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The figure reported for July 20, 2024 must surpass the figure from July 20, 2023.

(b) The outcome of this question will be determined by Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reflected in the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies a lead for Biden. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value indicates Trump is ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by their respective dates: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? (b) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

(b) This question will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur by their respective dates: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? (b) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) be lower Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

(b) This question will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be less than or equal to the reported number on July 20, 2023.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that by their specified deadlines, (a) Trump's margin over Biden exceeds 2 but does not go beyond 3 on July 15, 2024, according to the national polling average from 538? (b) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will show an increase compared to the previous year on July 20, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) The outcome of this inquiry will be determined by Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart dated July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies a lead for Biden. For instance, if on July 5, 2024, the value shows Trump ahead by 2.4 points over Biden, it will count as a positive value of 2.4 for this question.

(b) The resolution of this question will rely on data from the St. Louis Fed found here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The figure reported on July 20, 2024 must surpass the figure reported on July 20, 2023.

question.title: Will the United States win gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics
question.body: Resolves Yes if Team USA wins both gold medals. Resolves no if either the men's or women's team places anywhere other than gold.

not_P.title: Will the United States not win gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics
not_P.body: Resolves Yes if Team USA does not win both gold medals. Resolves no if both the men's and women's team win gold.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the United States to secure gold in both the Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball events at the Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: This will resolve to Yes if Team USA claims both gold medals. It will resolve to No if either the men's or women's squad finishes in any position other than first.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Philadelphia 76ers win the 2024 NBA Finals (b) The United States fails to win gold in either Men's or Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics?
question.body:
The question resolves **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) The Philadelphia 76ers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). (2) Either the United States men's or women's basketball team places anywhere other than gold at the Paris Olympics. 

It resolves **No** if either the Philadelphia 76ers do not win the 2024 NBA Finals or if the United States wins gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics.

not_P.title: Will at least one of the following not occur: (a) The Philadelphia 76ers win the 2024 NBA Finals (b) The United States wins gold in either Men's or Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics?
not_P.body:
The question resolves **Yes** if at least one of the following conditions is met: (1) The Philadelphia 76ers are not crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). (2) The United States men's or women's basketball team wins gold at the Paris Olympics. 

It resolves **No** if both the Philadelphia 76ers win the 2024 NBA Finals and if the United States fails to win gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics.

para_P.title: Will the following events take place: (a) The Philadelphia 76ers become champions of the 2024 NBA Finals (b) The United States does not secure a gold medal in either Men's or Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics?
para_P.body:
The answer is **Yes** if both of these criteria are fulfilled: (1) The Philadelphia 76ers are declared the winners of the 2024 NBA Finals, as per [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). (2) Either the men's or women's basketball team from the United States finishes in a position other than gold at the Paris Olympics. 

The answer is **No** if the Philadelphia 76ers fail to win the 2024 NBA Finals or if the United States claims gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Team USA wins gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics (b) The Philadelphia 76ers win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if either of the following conditions is met: (a) Team USA wins gold medals in both the Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball events at the Paris Olympics. (b) The Philadelphia 76ers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves **No** if neither condition is satisfied.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Team USA does not win gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics (b) The Philadelphia 76ers do not win the 2024 NBA Finals?
not_P.body: This question resolves **Yes** if neither of the following conditions is met: (a) Team USA does not win gold medals in both the Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball events at the Paris Olympics. (b) The Philadelphia 76ers are not crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves **No** if at least one condition is satisfied.

para_P.title: Is it possible for one of these events to happen: (a) Team USA secures gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics (b) The Philadelphia 76ers claim victory in the 2024 NBA Finals?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if at least one of the following scenarios occurs: (a) Team USA achieves gold medals in both the Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball competitions at the Paris Olympics. (b) The Philadelphia 76ers are declared the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals as per [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It will be answered with **No** if neither scenario takes place.

question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Democrats not have a brokered convention in 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires only one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If more than one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Will there be a brokered convention for the Democrats in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the Democratic Party needs multiple voting rounds during its roll call ballot to officially select its nominee for the 2024 US presidential election. Conversely, if a single ballot suffices, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024, and (b) Democrats do not have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body:
(a) Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out, this condition will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

(b) This condition resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party does not require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If more than one ballot is required, then this condition resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Will not both of the following occur: (a) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024, or (b) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows fewer than 10 Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out, this condition will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

(b) This condition resolves as **No** if the Democratic Party does require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If one ballot is required, then this condition resolves as **Yes**.

para_P.title: Will both of the following take place: (a) at least 10 Democratic Senators urge Biden to resign prior to July 20, 2024, and (b) the Democrats avoid a brokered convention in 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Source of resolution: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If, before midnight Central Time on July 20, there are indications of 10 or more Democratic Senators advocating for Biden to step down, this condition will be deemed true. If not, it will be considered false.

(b) This condition will be deemed **Yes** if the Democratic Party does not need more than a single round of voting in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If more than one ballot is necessary, then this condition will be deemed **No**.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024 (b) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
(a) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024: This resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this resolves as **No**.

(b) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20: This resolves as **Yes** if at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, the New York Times shows 10 or more Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out. Otherwise, it resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Democrats do not have a brokered convention in 2024 (b) fewer than 10 Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
not_P.body:
(a) Democrats do not have a brokered convention in 2024: This resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires only one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If more than one ballot is required, then this resolves as **No**.

(b) Fewer than 10 Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20: This resolves as **Yes** if at no point before midnight July 20 Central Time, the New York Times shows fewer than 10 Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out. Otherwise, it resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following happens: (a) The Democrats hold a brokered convention in 2024 (b) More than 10 Democratic Senators urge Biden to resign prior to July 20?
para_P.body:
(a) The Democrats hold a brokered convention in 2024: This will be marked as **Yes** if the Democratic Party needs more than a single round of voting in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one round is needed, then this will be marked as **No**.

(b) More than 10 Democratic Senators urge Biden to resign prior to July 20: This will be marked as **Yes** if at any moment before midnight July 20 Central Time, the New York Times reports that 10 or more Democratic Senators are calling for Biden to step down. Otherwise, it will be marked as **No**.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

not_P.title: Will Biden not be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland not to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

para_P.title: Will Biden be deemed unable to fulfill his presidential responsibilities under the 25th Amendment Section 4 prior to August?
para_P.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another applicable authority) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and enable the Vice President to act as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not considered. Biden's invocation of section 3 of the 25th amendment is also not included.

Context: GOP lawmaker requests Merrick Garland to implement the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday and not be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body: Resolves YES if both of the following occur: (a) There is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. (b) The Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of any incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count towards the second condition. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count towards the second condition.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden not die before Saturday or be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
not_P.body: Resolves YES if either of the following occurs: (a) There is no official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. (b) The Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of any incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count towards the second condition. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count towards the second condition.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Joe Biden will pass away before Saturday without being recognized as incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 prior to August?
para_P.body: This is considered TRUE if both of the following take place: (a) An official statement regarding Joe Biden's death is made before the market closes on Friday, July 26th. (b) The Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate authority) do not activate Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of any incapacitation is irrelevant to this inquiry. Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., does not fulfill the second requirement. Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also excluded from the second requirement.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024? (b) Joe Biden die before July 26th, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024: Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

(b) Joe Biden die before July 26th, 2024: Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, 2024. Otherwise, resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024? (b) Joe Biden die before July 26th, 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024: Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

(b) Joe Biden die before July 26th, 2024: Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, 2024. Otherwise, resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following happens: (a) Biden is recognized as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August 2024? (b) Joe Biden passes away before July 26th, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Biden is recognized as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August 2024: This will be marked YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant authority) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially declare that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and appoints the Vice President as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this inquiry. Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also excluded.

(b) Joe Biden passes away before July 26th, 2024: This will be marked YES if there is an official declaration of Joe Biden's death before the market closes at the end of Friday, July 26th, 2024. If not, it will be marked NO.

question.title: Will at least 24 world records be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the number of world records broken during the Paris Olympics is 24 or greater.

not_P.title: Will fewer than 24 world records be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the number of world records broken during the Paris Olympics is less than 24.

para_P.title: Is it possible for 24 or more world records to be set during the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the total number of world records established at the Paris Olympics reaches 24 or more.

question.title: Will France place in the Top 5 and fewer than 24 world records be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body:
This question will resolve positively if both of the following conditions are met: (a) France places in the top 5 (ties resolve positively) at the 2024 Paris Olympics, and (b) fewer than 24 world records are broken during the Paris Olympics. The question will resolve ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

For condition (a), the medal table is calculated by taking the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals

For condition (b), the number of world records broken during the Paris Olympics must be fewer than 24.

not_P.title: Will France not place in the Top 5 or 24 or more world records be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve positively if at least one of the following conditions is met: (a) France does not place in the top 5 (ties resolve negatively) at the 2024 Paris Olympics, or (b) 24 or more world records are broken during the Paris Olympics. The question will resolve ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

For condition (a), the medal table is calculated by taking the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals

For condition (b), the number of world records broken during the Paris Olympics must be 24 or more.

para_P.title: Will France achieve a Top 5 finish while fewer than 24 world records are set during the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered affirmative if both of the following criteria are fulfilled: (a) France secures a position within the top 5 (ties are counted as positive) at the 2024 Paris Olympics, and (b) the total number of world records established during the Paris Olympics is less than 24. The inquiry will be deemed unclear if the Olympics do not occur in 2024.

For criterion (a), the medal standings are determined by summing the total medals earned by each participating nation and ranking them based on:

1. Count of Gold Medals
2. (In case of a tie for 1st) Count of Silver Medals
3. (In case of a tie for 2nd) Count of Bronze Medals

For criterion (b), the tally of world records set during the Paris Olympics must be under 24.

question.title: Will either at least 24 world records be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics or France place in the Top 5?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) The number of world records broken during the Paris Olympics is 24 or greater. (b) France places in the top 5 (ties resolve positively) at the Olympics being held in 2024. It will resolve ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024. The medal table is calculated by taking the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering by: 1. Number of Gold Medals 2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals 3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals.

not_P.title: Will fewer than 24 world records be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics and France not place in the Top 5?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs: (a) The number of world records broken during the Paris Olympics is 24 or greater. (b) France places in the top 5 (ties resolve positively) at the Olympics being held in 2024. It will resolve ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024. The medal table is calculated by taking the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering by: 1. Number of Gold Medals 2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals 3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals.

para_P.title: Will at least 24 world records be set during the 2024 Paris Olympics, or will France finish in the Top 5?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if either of the following conditions is met: (a) At least 24 world records are established at the Paris Olympics. (b) France achieves a position in the top 5 (ties count positively) at the 2024 Olympics. If the Olympics do not occur in 2024, the resolution will be unclear. The medal standings are determined by the total number of medals earned by each country, ranked by: 1. Total Gold Medals 2. (In case of ties for Gold) Total Silver Medals 3. (In case of ties for Silver) Total Bronze Medals.

question.title: Will the Pandemic Agreement be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA) the Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources.

not_P.title: Will the Pandemic Agreement not be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA) the Pandemic Agreement is not approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources.

para_P.title: Is the Pandemic Agreement going to receive approval at the World Health Assembly in May 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the Pandemic Agreement is sanctioned through a vote at the World Health Assembly (WHA) in May 2024, as stated by reliable sources.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024, and (b) the Pandemic Agreement is not approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following are true:

1. Before July 1, 2024, OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must indicate a new level of commitment to the principle in question, relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published; it cannot be a reiteration that, for example, "we already have a culture of open criticism". Metaculus verifies that the company has accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may reach out to select signatories or endorsers to assess their level of satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step" for this question to resolve as **Yes**.

2. During the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), the Pandemic Agreement is not approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024, nor (b) the Pandemic Agreement is approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if neither of the following are true:

1. Before July 1, 2024, OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must indicate a new level of commitment to the principle in question, relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published; it cannot be a reiteration that, for example, "we already have a culture of open criticism". Metaculus verifies that the company has accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may reach out to select signatories or endorsers to assess their level of satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step" for this question to resolve as **Yes**.
