2. During the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), the Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources.

para_P.title: Will both the following take place: (a) OpenAI makes a public commitment to the principle of "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" prior to July 1, 2024, and (b) the Pandemic Agreement fails to receive approval at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if both of the subsequent conditions are fulfilled:

1. Before July 1, 2024, OpenAI publicly declares its commitment to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle through a statement made by the company or a representative, such as Sam Altman. This statement can be either formal (like a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or a comment in an interview). The declaration from OpenAI must demonstrate a heightened commitment to the principle compared to the period when the righttowarn.ai statement was released; it cannot simply restate that, for instance, "we already foster a culture of open criticism". Metaculus will confirm that the company has embraced the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus might contact selected signatories or supporters to evaluate their level of satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as strong as "this was a good first step" for this question to be resolved as **Yes**.

2. At the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), the Pandemic Agreement does not gain approval through a vote, based on reports from reliable sources.

question.title: Will either the Pandemic Agreement be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly or will OpenAI publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (1) During the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), the Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources. (2) Before July 1, 2024, both of the following are true regarding OpenAI's commitment to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle: - OpenAI publicly commits to the principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement must indicate a new level of commitment relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published. - Metaculus verifies that the company has accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai, with statements being at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step".

not_P.title: Will neither the Pandemic Agreement be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly nor will OpenAI publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs: (1) During the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), the Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources. (2) Before July 1, 2024, at least one of the following is true regarding OpenAI's commitment to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle: - OpenAI publicly commits to the principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement must indicate a new level of commitment relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published. - Metaculus verifies that the company has accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai, with statements being at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step".

para_P.title: Is it possible that the Pandemic Agreement will receive approval at the World Health Assembly in May 2024, or that OpenAI will make a public commitment to the principle of "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" prior to July 1, 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if one of the following happens: (1) The Pandemic Agreement is voted on and approved during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), as confirmed by reliable sources. (2) Before July 1, 2024, both of these conditions regarding OpenAI's commitment to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle must be met: - OpenAI makes a public commitment to this principle through a statement from the company or a representative, such as Sam Altman. This statement can be either formal (like a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or a quote in an interview). The statement must reflect a heightened commitment compared to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was released. - Metaculus confirms that the company has accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai, with statements that are at least as strong as "this was a good first step".

question.title: Will Malta qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Malta participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If they do not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Malta not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Malta does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If they qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Malta going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Malta takes part in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. If they fail to qualify, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will Cyprus qualify and Malta fail to qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following occur: (a) Cyprus participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Malta participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as not having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Cyprus does not qualify or Malta qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Cyprus fail to qualify or Malta qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following occur: (a) Cyprus participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as not having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Malta participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Cyprus qualifies or Malta does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Cyprus make it to the Grand Final while Malta does not in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Cyprus takes part in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having made it to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Malta takes part in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as not having made it to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Cyprus fails to qualify or Malta successfully qualifies, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will either Malta or Cyprus qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either Malta or Cyprus participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither Malta nor Cyprus qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither Malta nor Cyprus participates in a Semi-final or is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Malta or Cyprus make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if either Malta or Cyprus competes in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If both fail to qualify, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

not_P.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
not_P.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will seek and will accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

para_P.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden publicly declare before July 15, 2024 that he will decline the Democratic...nomination for President?
para_P.body:
Will Joe Biden publicly declare before July 15, 2024 that he will decline the nomination from the Democratic Party for President?

This resolves in the same manner as the original question on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

The question will be considered Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes an unequivocal, public, official statement indicating that he will not pursue or accept the nomination from his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a Yes resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would agree to accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, the question will resolve as No.

Further details and additional context can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original question resolves, its outcome will automatically be applied to this market. Users who are deemed reliable are encouraged to resolve this market early if the outcome is known and clear. Feel free to contact @jskf to request early resolution or to report any issues.

question.title: Will the US government end its agreement with Verisign for .com TLD management before August 3, 2024, AND will Joe Biden not announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following occur: (1) Before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD). (2) No definitive, public, official announcement is made by Joe Biden or his campaign prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. To qualify for a Yes resolution, there must be no unambiguous and conclusive statement that leaves no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If both conditions are met, this question resolves as **Yes**. If either or both conditions are not met, this question resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Will the US government not end its agreement with Verisign for .com TLD management before August 3, 2024, OR will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will accept the Democratic nomination for President?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (1) After August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) does not officially terminate or sunset its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD). (2) A definitive, public, official announcement is made by Joe Biden or his campaign prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will seek and will accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. To qualify for a Yes resolution, there must be an unambiguous and conclusive statement that leaves no room for the possibility that Biden would not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If either condition is met, this question resolves as **Yes**. If both conditions are not met, this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the US government will terminate its contract with Verisign for managing the .com TLD before August 3, 2024, AND that Joe Biden will refrain from announcing by July 15, 2024, that he will decline the Democratic nomination for President?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if both of the following conditions are satisfied: (1) The US Department of Commerce (DOC) formally ends or allows to expire its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign regarding Verisign's oversight of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD) before August 3, 2024. (2) There is no clear, public, official declaration made by Joe Biden or his campaign prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not pursue and will not accept his party's nomination for another presidential term in the 2024 election. For a Yes resolution, there must be no clear and definitive statement that eliminates the possibility of Biden accepting the Democratic Party's nomination for the presidency in the 2024 election cycle. If both criteria are fulfilled, this question will resolve as **Yes**. If either or both criteria are not fulfilled, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will either of the following occur before their respective deadlines: (a) Joe Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, or (b) The US government ends its agreement with Verisign for managing the .com TLD?
question.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive. 

(b) Will the US government end its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD, before August 3, 2024? This resolves as Yes if before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the .com generic top-level domain (TLD).

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur before their respective deadlines: (a) Joe Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, nor (b) The US government ends its agreement with Verisign for managing the .com TLD?
not_P.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden not announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign does not make a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive. 

(b) Will the US government not end its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD, before August 3, 2024? This resolves as Yes if before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce does not officially terminate or sunset its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the .com generic top-level domain (TLD).

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following happens prior to their deadlines: (a) Joe Biden declares he will not pursue the Democratic nomination for President, or (b) The US government cancels its contract with Verisign for overseeing the .com TLD?
para_P.body:
(a) Is it true that Joe Biden will declare before July 15, 2024, that he will not pursue the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This will be considered Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, and official statement that he will not seek or accept the nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be unequivocal and definitive. 

(b) Is it true that the US government will terminate its agreement that allows Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD, prior to August 3, 2024? This will be considered Yes if, before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce officially ends or concludes its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign that recognizes Verisign's management of the .com generic top-level domain (TLD).

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but not exceeding 4, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude based on the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden as indicated by 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on the chart dated July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive number signifies a lead for Trump, whereas a negative number indicates Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) The linked market gets at least 377 traders by end of July 15, 2024, and (2) Trump's lead over Biden is less than or equal to 2 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
(1) The linked market resolves YES if it has 377 traders before market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). Resolves NO otherwise. [Market link](https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g)

(2) This question resolves based on Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, and the question resolves YES if the lead is less than or equal to 2 or greater than 4. For example, a value of 2.4 means Trump is 2.4 points ahead of Biden.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (1) The linked market gets at least 377 traders by end of July 15, 2024, nor (2) Trump's lead over Biden is less than or equal to 2 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
(1) The linked market resolves YES if it has 377 traders before market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). Resolves NO otherwise. [Market link](https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g)

(2) This question resolves based on Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, and the question resolves YES if the lead is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4. For example, a value of 2.4 means Trump is 2.4 points ahead of Biden.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (1) The associated market will have a minimum of 377 traders by the conclusion of July 15, 2024, and (2) Trump's advantage over Biden will be either 2 points or less, or exceed 4 points on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
(1) The associated market will be deemed YES if it achieves 377 traders prior to the market closing (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). Otherwise, it will be considered NO. [Market link](https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g)

(2) This inquiry will be resolved according to Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in the 538 national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on July 15, 2024, when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure signifies a Trump lead, and the question resolves YES if the lead is 2 or fewer points, or more than 4 points. For instance, a figure of 2.4 indicates Trump is ahead of Biden by 2.4 points.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by July 15, 2024: (a) Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 according to 538's national polling average, or (b) the linked market gets at least 377 traders?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as YES if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 points as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

(b) This question will resolve as YES if the market embedded at https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g has at least 377 traders before market close on July 15, 2024, 11:59 PM Pacific Time. Resolves NO otherwise.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur by July 15, 2024: (a) Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 4 or less than or equal to 2 according to 538's national polling average, nor (b) the linked market has fewer than 377 traders?
not_P.body:
(a) This question will resolve as YES if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is not greater than 4 points or not less than or equal to 2 points as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

(b) This question will resolve as YES if the market embedded at https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g has fewer than 377 traders before market close on July 15, 2024, 11:59 PM Pacific Time. Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: Is it possible that by July 15, 2024, one of the following will take place: (a) Trump's advantage over Biden is more than 2 but not exceeding 4 according to 538's national polling average, or (b) the referenced market achieves a minimum of 377 traders?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be answered with YES if Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election exceeds 2 and is at most 4 points as indicated on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure suggests Biden is ahead.

(b) This inquiry will be answered with YES if the market found at https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g has a total of at least 377 traders prior to the market closing on July 15, 2024, at 11:59 PM Pacific Time. It resolves to NO in all other cases.

question.title: Will Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) close sub $100 per share by 7/31?
question.body: This market resolves to YES if NVDA closes below 100$ on any day before 7/31.

not_P.title: Will Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) not close sub $100 per share by 7/31?
not_P.body: This market resolves to YES if NVDA does not close below 100$ on any day before 7/31.

para_P.title: Is it possible for Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) to finish below $100 per share by July 31?
para_P.body: This market will determine a YES outcome if NVDA ends the day priced under $100 at any point prior to July 31.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Month-over-Month US Core CPI increases by more than 0.1% in July 2024 (b) Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) never closes below $100 per share before 7/31?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The data for resolution will be from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

(b) This market resolves to YES if NVDA does not close below $100 on any day before 7/31.

not_P.title: Will either of the following not occur: (a) The Month-over-Month US Core CPI does not increase by more than 0.1% in July 2024 or (b) Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) closes below $100 per share at least once before 7/31?
not_P.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 does not increase by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The data for resolution will be from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

(b) This market resolves to YES if NVDA closes below $100 on at least one day before 7/31.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) The US Core CPI for July 2024 rises by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024 (b) Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) does not drop below $100 per share prior to 7/31?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be confirmed as YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 shows an increase of more than 0.1% relative to June 2024. The resolution will rely on data from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL, using the precise (not rounded) figure.

(b) This market will be confirmed as YES if NVDA maintains a closing price above $100 on every day leading up to 7/31.

question.title: Will either Nvidia close sub $100 per share by 7/31 or US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July?
question.body: This question resolves to YES if either: (a) Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) closes below $100 on any day before 7/31, or (b) the seasonally adjusted US Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024, using the exact (not rounded) value from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL.

not_P.title: Will neither Nvidia close sub $100 per share by 7/31 nor US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July?
not_P.body: This question resolves to YES if neither: (a) Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) closes below $100 on any day before 7/31, nor (b) the seasonally adjusted US Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024, using the exact (not rounded) value from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL.

para_P.title: Is it possible for Nvidia to finish below $100 per share by July 31, or for the US Core CPI to rise by over 0.1% in July?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a YES if either: (a) Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) ends any day before July 31 with a price lower than $100, or (b) the seasonally adjusted US Core CPI for July 2024 shows an increase of more than 0.1% when compared to June 2024, based on the precise (not rounded) figure from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL.

question.title: Will Norway qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Norway participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Norway does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Norway not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Norway does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Norway qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Norway going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Norway competes in a Semi-final and is formally recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a spot in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if Norway fails to qualify, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Will Switzerland qualify and Norway fail to qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following occur: (1) Switzerland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (2) Norway does not qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Switzerland does not qualify or Norway qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Switzerland not qualify or Norway qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occur: (1) Switzerland does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (2) Norway qualifies for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Switzerland qualifies and Norway does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it true that Switzerland will make it to the Grand Final while Norway will not in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if both of the following conditions are satisfied: (1) Switzerland competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (2) Norway fails to qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. The question will be resolved as **No** if Switzerland does not qualify or if Norway does qualify.

question.title: Will either Norway or Switzerland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Norway participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) Switzerland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Norway nor Switzerland qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither Norway nor Switzerland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs: (a) Norway participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) Switzerland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Norway or Switzerland qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Norway or Switzerland make it to the Grand Final at Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if one of the following happens: (a) Norway competes in a Semi-final and is confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) Switzerland competes in a Semi-final and is confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Norway nor Switzerland qualifies, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:



- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location



The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

not_P.title: Will Russia not have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) does not show the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:



- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location



The question will resolve as **No** if the location is assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location.

para_P.title: Will Russia possess authority over Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if, upon review by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) indicates the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as falling under any of the subsequent classifications:



- Evaluated Russian Progress in Ukraine

- Evaluated Russian Gains in the Previous 24 Hours

- Evaluated Russian Control

- Asserted Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any additional categories established by ISW that signify Russian control of the area



The inquiry will resolve as **No** if the site is not classified under any of the categories denoting Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Documented Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Previous 24 Hours

- Asserted Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Documented Ukrainian Partisan Activities

- Any additional categories established by ISW that signify Ukrainian control of the area or a lack of Russian control of the area.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, and will Russia not have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if both of the following conditions are met:

1. **Donald Trump Removal or Blockage:**
   - On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This removal or blockage must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

2. **Russian Control of Chasiv Yar:**
   - On June 1, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as not under any of the following categories: Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine, Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Assessed Russian Control, Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine, or any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location. The question will resolve as "No" if the location is assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to: Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives, Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare, or any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location.

The question will resolve as "No" if either or both of these conditions are not met.

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump not be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, or will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if at least one of the following conditions is met:

1. **Donald Trump Not Removed or Blocked:**
   - On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This means that as of that date, he is either still on the ballot or has not been confirmed removed or blocked through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves positively.

2. **Russian Control of Chasiv Yar:**
   - On June 1, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories: Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine, Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Assessed Russian Control, Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine, or any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location. The question will resolve as "Yes" if the location is assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be excluded or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, and will Russia not possess control over Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered "Yes" if both of the following criteria are satisfied:

1. **Exclusion or Bar of Donald Trump:**
   - As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially excluded or barred from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This exclusion or barring must be validated through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media reports. Speculative information, opinion articles, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution. The question does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent reversals that may take place after the specified date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is excluded or barred from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not excluded or barred from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

2. **Russian Control over Chasiv Yar:**
   - On June 1, 2024, when checked by Metaculus, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map indicates the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as not falling under any of the following classifications: Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine, Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Assessed Russian Control, Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine, or any other classifications established by ISW that signify Russian control of the area. The question will resolve as "No" if the area is evaluated to be in any of the classifications indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to: Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives, Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare, or any other classifications created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location.

The question will resolve as "No" if either or both of these criteria are not satisfied.

question.title: Will either Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, or Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?

This must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports.

The question will resolve as **No** if neither of these conditions is met by their respective dates.

not_P.title: Will neither Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, nor Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?

This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs:

(b) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports.

The question will resolve as **No** if either of these conditions is met by their respective dates.

para_P.title: On June 1, 2024, will Russia possess control over Chasiv Yar or will Donald Trump be disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position as stated in Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if at least one of the following scenarios occurs:

(a) On June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) indicates that the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E are classified under any categories that suggest Russian control, such as:
- Evaluated Russian Progress in Ukraine

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine
- Any additional categories established by ISW that reflect Russian authority over the area.

(b) By July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been formally disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This must be validated through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media sources.

The inquiry will be resolved as **No** if neither of these conditions is fulfilled by their respective deadlines.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be 2 or less, or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but at most 3 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on the margin by which Donald Trump is ahead of Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown in the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies Biden is in front. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value indicates Trump is leading Biden by 2.4 points, which equates to a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) A member of the Trump family will be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024, and (2) Trump's lead over Biden will be ≤2 or >3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
(1) Resolves **Yes** if one of these individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024:

 - Donald Trump
 - Donald Trump Jr.
 - Eric Trump
 - Ivanka Trump
 - Tiffany Trump
 - Melania Trump
 - Barron Trump

(2) Resolves **Yes** if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024, is less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (1) A member of the Trump family will be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024, nor (2) Trump's lead over Biden will be >2 and ≤3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
(1) Resolves **Yes** if none of these individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024:

 - Donald Trump
 - Donald Trump Jr.
 - Eric Trump
 - Ivanka Trump
 - Tiffany Trump
 - Melania Trump
 - Barron Trump

(2) Resolves **Yes** if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024, is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following events will take place: (1) A Trump family member becomes the Republican candidate for the US Presidency in 2024, and (2) Trump's advantage over Biden will be ≤2 or >3 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
(1) Resolves **Yes** if any of the following individuals is the Republican candidate for the US Presidency in 2024:

 - Donald Trump
 - Donald Trump Jr.
 - Eric Trump
 - Ivanka Trump
 - Tiffany Trump
 - Melania Trump
 - Barron Trump

(2) Resolves **Yes** if the lead of Donald Trump over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024, is either less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3. A positive figure indicates a Trump lead, whereas a negative figure signifies Biden is ahead.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? (b) A member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

(a) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024. This is determined by the value reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead.

(b) A member of the Trump family is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024. This includes Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, or Barron Trump.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average nor (b) A member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?
not_P.body:
This question resolves **Yes** if neither of the following occurs:

(a) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024. This is determined by the value reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead.

(b) A member of the Trump family is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024. This includes Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, or Barron Trump.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following happens: (a) On July 15, 2024, Trump's advantage over Biden is more than 2 but not exceeding 3 according to the national polling average from 538? (b) A Trump family member becomes the Republican candidate for the US Presidency in 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if at least one of the following takes place:

(a) On July 15, 2024, the national polling average from 538 shows that Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and at most 3. This will be confirmed by the value shown on the chart for that date, as accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive number signifies a lead for Trump, while a negative number signifies a lead for Biden.

(b) A member of the Trump family is selected as the Republican nominee for the presidency in 2024. This could refer to Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, or Barron Trump.

question.title:
Will the  CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS)	
 be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

not_P.title: Will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) be lower Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be less than or equal to the reported number on July 20, 2023.

para_P.title: Is the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) expected to increase compared to the previous year on July 20, 2024?
para_P.body: The resolution of this inquiry will depend on the data published by the St. Louis Fed at this link: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The figure for July 20, 2024 must exceed the figure recorded on July 20, 2023.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Donald Trump is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election (2) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index is the same or lower Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
question.body:
(1) This resolves as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(2) This resolves as **Yes** if the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) reported by the St. Louis Fed for July 20, 2024, is less than or equal to the reported number on July 20, 2023.

not_P.title: Will at least one of the following not occur: (1) Donald Trump is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election (2) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index is higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
not_P.body:
(1) This resolves as **Yes** if Donald Trump is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is not selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(2) This resolves as **Yes** if the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) reported by the St. Louis Fed for July 20, 2024, is greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following events will happen: (1) Donald Trump becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election (2) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index remains the same or decreases Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
para_P.body:
(1) This will be marked as **Yes** if Donald Trump is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The identity of the Republican nominee on the date of the 2024 US election is irrelevant; the determination is based solely on the choice made by the delegates at the Republican National Convention.

(2) This will be marked as **Yes** if the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) published by the St. Louis Fed on July 20, 2024, is less than or equal to the figure reported on July 20, 2023.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, or (b) Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, if the reported number by the St. Louis Fed (https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS) for July 20, 2024, is greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.
(b) Donald Trump will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election if he is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee. This is determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the nomination on the day of the election. The question considers all candidates, including any new candidates added in the future.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, nor (b) Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
(a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will not be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, if the reported number by the St. Louis Fed (https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS) for July 20, 2024, is less than or equal to the reported number on July 20, 2023.
(b) Donald Trump will not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election if he is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee. This is determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the nomination on the day of the election. The question considers all candidates, including any new candidates added in the future.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following happens: (a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will surpass its Year-over-Year value on July 20, 2024, or (b) Donald Trump will secure the Republican nomination for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will exceed its Year-over-Year figure on July 20, 2024, if the value reported by the St. Louis Fed (https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS) for that date is higher than the value reported on July 20, 2023.
(b) Donald Trump will be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election if he is chosen by the Republican National Convention as their nominee. This decision is made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who is announced as the nominee on election day. The inquiry takes into account all candidates, including any potential new candidates that may emerge.

question.title: Will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump Jr. not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is not selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Donald Trump Jr. going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other contenders will be answered with **No**. This query is not limited to the candidates currently discussed; additional options may emerge later.

For this question, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republicans on the day of the 2024 US election; the resolution is based solely on who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will both of the following be true: (1) Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents, and (2) Donald Trump Jr. is not the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
1. There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot. This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

2. This question will resolve as YES if Donald Trump Jr. is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as NO. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

not_P.title: Will at least one of the following be true: (1) Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, Trump does not gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents, or (2) Donald Trump Jr. is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
1. There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot. This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 does not exceed that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 < 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

2. This question will resolve as YES if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as NO. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following conditions will be met: (1) Trump receives at least a 3% increase in support from Manifold respondents when compared to a generic Democrat, rather than facing Joe Biden, and (2) Donald Trump Jr. does not become the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
1. Two Manifold polls will be conducted, both closing on July 6. One poll will ask Manifold respondents to cast their vote alongside Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other will inquire about a generic Democrat on a similar ballot. The market will conclude with a YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll surpasses that of the second poll by 3% or more at the time of closing. The calculation for determining Trump's vote percentage is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The outcome is YES if the difference between the formula for poll 1 and the formula for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the outcome is NO.

2. This question will be answered YES if Donald Trump Jr. is not chosen as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election by the Republican National Convention. Any other candidates will result in a NO. This question is not limited to those candidates currently mentioned; additional options may be introduced later. The resolution is based solely on the choice made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat?
question.body:
(a) Will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(b) Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents? There are two Manifold polls posted, both closing on July 6. One asks respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and the other with a generic Democrat. This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, nor (b) Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat?
not_P.body:
(a) Will Donald Trump Jr. not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(b) Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump not gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents? There are two Manifold polls posted, both closing on July 6. One asks respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and the other with a generic Democrat. This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 does not exceed that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 < 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that either (a) Donald Trump Jr. becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) Trump achieves at least a 3% increase among Manifold survey participants when compared to Joe Biden rather than a generic Democrat?
para_P.body:
(a) Is Donald Trump Jr. going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This query will be resolved as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be resolved as **No**. This inquiry is not confined to the candidates currently discussed; additional options may be introduced later. The resolution is determined solely by the selection made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(b) When competing against Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump secure at least a 3% advantage among Manifold respondents? Two Manifold polls will be conducted, both closing on July 6. One poll asks participants to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other involves a generic Democrat. This market will resolve as YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll exceeds that in the second poll by 3% or more at the time both polls close. The calculation for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The result is YES if the difference between the formula for poll 1 and the formula for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. Otherwise, it will be NO.

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:
Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden not die before Saturday?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if there is no official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Joe Biden will pass away before Saturday?
para_P.body:
This will be considered a YES if there is a formal declaration of Joe Biden's passing prior to the market closing on Friday, July 26th. 

If no such announcement occurs, it will be deemed a NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Kimberly Cheatle will no longer be the Director of the U.S. Secret Service before October 12, 2024, and (b) Joe Biden will not die before the end of Friday, July 26th?
question.body:
(a) Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, will resign, be fired, or for any other reason no longer be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024.
(b) There will be no official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th.

not_P.title: Will at least one of the following occur: (a) Kimberly Cheatle will still be the Director of the U.S. Secret Service before October 12, 2024, or (b) Joe Biden will die before the end of Friday, July 26th?
not_P.body:
(a) Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, will not resign, be fired, or for any other reason still be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024.
(b) There will be an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th.

para_P.title: Will both of the following take place: (a) Kimberly Cheatle will cease to be the Director of the U.S. Secret Service prior to October 12, 2024, and (b) Joe Biden will remain alive until the conclusion of Friday, July 26th?
para_P.body:
(a) Kimberly Cheatle, currently serving as the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, will step down, be dismissed, or otherwise no longer hold the position of director before October 12, 2024.
(b) There will be no formal declaration regarding Joe Biden's death before the market closes at the end of Friday, July 26th.

question.title: Will either Joe Biden die before Saturday or the head of the Secret Service resign within the next 90 days?
question.body: This resolves YES if either of the following occurs: (a) There is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. (b) Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resigns, is fired, or for any other reason no longer serves as the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024. Otherwise, it resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will neither Joe Biden die before Saturday nor the head of the Secret Service resign within the next 90 days?
not_P.body: This resolves YES if neither of the following occurs: (a) There is no official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. (b) Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, does not resign, is not fired, and for any other reason continues to serve as the director of the Secret Service after October 12, 2024. Otherwise, it resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Joe Biden will pass away before Saturday or that the head of the Secret Service will step down within the next three months?
para_P.body: This will be considered TRUE if either of the following happens: (a) An official announcement of Joe Biden's passing is made before the market closes on Friday, July 26th. (b) Kimberly Cheatle, the head of the U.S. Secret Service, resigns, is dismissed, or for any reason ceases to be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024. If neither occurs, it will be deemed FALSE.

question.title: Will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Ted Cruz not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is not selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
