Any other candidates will result in a **No** outcome. This question is not limited to the candidates currently listed; additional options may be introduced later.

For this query, it does not matter who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; the determination is solely based on who is appointed by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (2) Ted Cruz not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(1) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

(2) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If any candidate other than Ted Cruz is selected, this will resolve as **Yes**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will either of the following not occur: (1) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, or (2) Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
(1) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

(2) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If any candidate other than Ted Cruz is selected, this will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (1) Trump's advantage over Biden will be more than 3 but not exceeding 4 on July 15, 2024, according to the national polling average from 538, and (2) Ted Cruz will not be the nominee for the Republican Party in the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(1) This inquiry will conclude as Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For this inquiry, a positive figure indicates a Trump advantage, while a negative figure signifies Biden is in the lead. For instance, as of July 5, 2024, the reported figure for that date shows Trump ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which would be a positive figure of 2.4 for this inquiry.

(2) This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is not chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If any candidate other than Ted Cruz is chosen, this will resolve as **Yes**. This inquiry is not limited to the candidates currently listed; additional candidates may be introduced in the future. For this inquiry, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 US election; it is determined solely by the selection made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will either Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. (b) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

not_P.title: Will neither Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election nor will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 3 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs: (a) Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. (b) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is less than or equal to 3 or greater than 4 in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

para_P.title: Is it possible for Ted Cruz to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or for Trump's advantage over Biden to exceed 3 but not surpass 4 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if at least one of the following conditions is met: (a) Ted Cruz is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, as determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, rather than by who is announced as the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election. (b) Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden is more than 3 and at most 4 in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive number signifies a lead for Trump.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

para_P.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden publicly declare by July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic...nomination for President?
para_P.body:
Will Joe Biden make a public announcement before July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not accept the nomination from the Democratic Party for President?

This resolves identically to the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will be marked as Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear and official statement confirming that he will not pursue or accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a Yes resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the upcoming 2024 election.

If no such clear statement is made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will be resolved as No.

Further details and context can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original question is resolved, its outcome will automatically apply to this market. Users with a decent level of trust are encouraged to resolve this market early if the result is known and clear. Feel free to contact @jskf for requests regarding early resolution or to report any issues.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) another Democratic party presidential debate before the 2024 Democratic National Convention, and (b) Joe Biden not announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

(b) Resolves YES if no definitive, public, official announcement is made by Joe Biden or his campaign prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. Resolves NO if such a definitive statement is made before this time.

not_P.title: Will either of the following not occur: (a) another Democratic party presidential debate before the 2024 Democratic National Convention, or (b) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will accept the Democratic nomination for President?
not_P.body:
(a) Resolves YES if there is no debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

(b) Resolves YES if a definitive, public, official announcement is made by Joe Biden or his campaign prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that Joe Biden will seek and will accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. Resolves NO if such a definitive statement is not made before this time.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to happen: (a) another presidential debate for the Democratic party takes place before the 2024 Democratic National Convention, and (b) Joe Biden does not make a public announcement before July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be considered a YES if there is a debate involving potential Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. It will be a NO otherwise.

(b) This will be considered a YES if Joe Biden or his campaign does not make a clear, public, official statement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, declaring that Joe Biden will not pursue and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. It will be a NO if such a clear statement is made before this deadline.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, or (b) there is another Democratic party presidential debate before the 2024 Democratic National Convention?
question.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This will resolve as Yes if before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The announcement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination. If no such statement is made before the deadline, this resolves as No.

(b) Will there be another Democratic party presidential debate? This resolves as Yes if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g., Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves as No otherwise.

This question resolves as Yes if either (a) or (b) resolves as Yes.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024 that he will accept the Democratic nomination for President, nor (b) there is not another Democratic party presidential debate before the 2024 Democratic National Convention?
not_P.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This will resolve as Yes if before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will seek and will accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The announcement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would decline the nomination. If such a statement is made before the deadline, this resolves as No.

(b) Will there not be another Democratic party presidential debate? This resolves as Yes if there is not a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g., Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves as No otherwise.

This question resolves as Yes if neither (a) nor (b) resolves as Yes.

para_P.title: Is it possible that: (a) Joe Biden makes an announcement before July 15, 2024, stating he will not be seeking the Democratic nomination for President, or (b) another debate for Democratic presidential candidates takes place prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention?
para_P.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden declare before July 15, 2024, that he will not be pursuing the nomination from the Democratic Party for President? This will be considered Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, and official statement indicating that he will not seek or accept the party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the upcoming 2024 election cycle. The announcement should be straightforward and definitive, eliminating any chance that Biden might accept the nomination. If no such announcement occurs before the specified deadline, this will be regarded as No.

(b) Will there be an additional debate for Democratic presidential candidates? This will be marked as Yes if a debate occurs among prospective Democratic nominees (for instance, Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. It will be No in other cases.

This inquiry will be answered with Yes if either (a) or (b) results in Yes.

question.title: Will Google DeepMind publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body: For Google DeepMind, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

not_P.title: Will Google DeepMind not publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
not_P.body: For Google DeepMind, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they do not publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

para_P.title: Is it expected that Google DeepMind will release a report detailing the outcomes from an external red-team evaluation of their models for safety before June 30, 2024?
para_P.body: For Google DeepMind, this question will be considered **YES** if they issue a *public* report by June 30, 2024, showcasing the findings from an *external* group assessing the safety of one of their AI models.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by June 30, 2024: (a) OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union, and (b) Google DeepMind does not publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety?
question.body:
(a) The question about OpenAI's ChatGPT resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise. "Generally available" means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

(b) For Google DeepMind, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they do not publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

not_P.title: Will at least one of the following not occur by June 30, 2024: (a) OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union, or (b) Google DeepMind publishes a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety?
not_P.body:
(a) The question about OpenAI's ChatGPT resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is not generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise. "Generally available" means that the default state for people in the EU is that they cannot access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If available in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or available to (for example) minors, this will still resolve negatively, assuming less than or equal to 50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves negatively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

(b) For Google DeepMind, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they do publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

para_P.title: By June 30, 2024, will both of these things happen: (a) OpenAI's ChatGPT is accessible to users in the European Union, and (b) Google DeepMind will refrain from releasing a report that includes findings from an external assessment of their models for safety?
para_P.body:
(a) This question regarding OpenAI's ChatGPT will be answered as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is accessible to users in the EU by June 30, 2024, and **NO** if it is not. "Accessible" indicates that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without needing a VPN (though it may require a payment). If it is not accessible in certain EU nations (like Italy in early 2023), or not available to specific groups (such as minors), it will still be considered a positive outcome as long as more than 50% of the population can access it. "ChatGPT" pertains to the general web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. It will still be considered a positive outcome even if the name or website changes, provided that OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (allowing users to input queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

(b) Regarding Google DeepMind, this question will be answered as **YES** if they do not release a *public* report that includes the results from an *external* evaluation of the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by June 30, 2024: (a) Google DeepMind publishes a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety, or (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union?
question.body:
(a) For Google DeepMind, this part resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

(b) For OpenAI's ChatGPT, this part resolves as **YES** if ChatGPT is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise. "Generally available" means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it). If unavailable in certain EU countries, or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models, and still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur by June 30, 2024: (a) Google DeepMind publishes a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety, or (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union?
not_P.body:
(a) For Google DeepMind, this part resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they do not publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

(b) For OpenAI's ChatGPT, this part resolves as **YES** if ChatGPT is not generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise. "Generally available" means that the default state for people in the EU is that they cannot access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it). If unavailable in certain EU countries, or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population cannot use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models, and still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: By June 30, 2024, will one of the following happen: (a) a report from Google DeepMind detailing safety evaluations of their models conducted by an external team is released, or (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT becomes widely accessible in the European Union?
para_P.body:
(a) In the case of Google DeepMind, this will be marked as **YES** if they release a *publicly accessible* report by June 30, 2024, showing results from an *independent* evaluation of the safety of one of their AI models.

(b) Regarding OpenAI's ChatGPT, this will be marked as **YES** if it is broadly available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise. "Broadly available" indicates that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can access it without needing a VPN (though it may require payment). If it is not available in certain EU nations, or restricted for (for instance) younger users, it will still resolve positively, provided that more than 50% of the population can access it. "ChatGPT" refers to the main web interface (not the API) for using GPT models, and it will still resolve positively if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (allowing users to submit queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: Will "House of the Dragon" S2E7 (title TBA) be rated >8.5 on IMDB, 2 days after release?
question.body:

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden exceed 2 but be at most 3, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be settled based on the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden as indicated by 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on the chart dated July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure signifies a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure indicates Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be considered a positive figure of 2.4 for the purpose of this inquiry.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024, and (2) Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
(1) Joe Biden must appear in an in-person interview for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. The interview must be on camera, and can include appearances on a podcast, late night show, or a show like 60 minutes, but there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. Press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., do not count. If no qualifying interview is released before the end of July, this condition is not met. 

(2) Trump's lead over Biden must be either less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates Biden is leading. The value will be checked on the chart for July 15, 2024, accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. 

Both conditions must be satisfied for the overall question to resolve YES.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (1) Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024, nor (2) Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
(1) Joe Biden must not appear in an in-person interview for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. The interview must not be on camera, and cannot include appearances on a podcast, late night show, or a show like 60 minutes, and there must not be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. Press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., do not count. If a qualifying interview is released before the end of July, this condition is met. 

(2) Trump's lead over Biden must be neither less than or equal to 2 nor greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates Biden is leading. The value will be checked on the chart for July 15, 2024, accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. 

Neither condition must be satisfied for the overall question to resolve YES.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (1) Joe Biden will participate in a face-to-face interview for over 45 minutes before July 2024 concludes, and (2) Trump's advantage over Biden will either be 2 or less, or more than 3 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
(1) Joe Biden is required to take part in a face-to-face interview lasting at least 45 minutes prior to the end of July 2024. This interview must be recorded on camera and can include appearances on platforms such as podcasts, late-night television shows, or programs like 60 Minutes, but there must be a minimum of 45 minutes of new footage featuring Biden being interviewed in person. Events like press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., do not qualify. If no suitable interview is made public before the end of July, this condition will not be fulfilled. 

(2) On July 15, 2024, Trump's margin over Biden must be either 2 or lower, or exceed 3, according to 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election. A positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies Biden is in the lead. This value will be verified on the chart for July 15, 2024, as referenced by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. 

For the overall question to be answered YES, both conditions must be met.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? (b) Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

(b) The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? (b) Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

(b) The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden does not appear in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If a qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following happens: (a) Trump's advantage over Biden exceeds 2 but does not go beyond 3 on July 15, 2024, according to the national polling average from 538? (b) Joe Biden engages in a face-to-face interview or discussion on camera lasting over 45 minutes before the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be resolved based on the lead that Donald Trump holds over Joe Biden in the 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as indicated on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value indicates Trump is 2.4 points in front of Biden, which would be a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

(b) The latest qualifying interview occurred during Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, where he responded to questions for approximately 70 minutes. 

Should Biden participate in another such in-person interview lasting at least 45 minutes, this market will resolve to YES. If no qualifying interview is published before the market closes at the end of July, this market will resolve to NO. 

This market does not take into account press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It may include guest spots on podcasts or late-night shows, or interviews that are part of a show like 60 Minutes, provided that there is a minimum of 45 minutes of new footage featuring Biden being interviewed in-person for those appearances to be considered valid. A 50-minute video may only show 20 minutes of Biden being interviewed, and thus would not qualify.

For additional context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his previous segments on 60 Minutes have each contained less than 30 minutes of footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can access a compilation of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

question.title: Will the Orlando Magic win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Orlando Magic are crowned the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** for all other teams as they are eliminated from contention.

not_P.title: Will the Orlando Magic not win the 2024 NBA Finals?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Orlando Magic are not crowned the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** for all other teams if they are crowned champions.

para_P.title: Are the Orlando Magic going to be the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the Orlando Magic are declared the winners of the 2024 NBA Finals, based on information from [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It will be answered with **No** for any other teams that do not succeed.

question.title: Will the New York Knicks win the 2024 NBA Finals and the Orlando Magic not win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/): (a) The New York Knicks are crowned the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals. (b) The Orlando Magic are not crowned the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals. It resolves as **No** if either the New York Knicks do not win the Finals or the Orlando Magic win the Finals.

not_P.title: Will the New York Knicks not win the 2024 NBA Finals or the Orlando Magic win the 2024 NBA Finals?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following conditions is met according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/): (a) The New York Knicks are not crowned the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals. (b) The Orlando Magic are crowned the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals. It resolves as **No** if both the New York Knicks win the Finals and the Orlando Magic do not win the Finals.

para_P.title: Will the New York Knicks emerge victorious in the 2024 NBA Finals while the Orlando Magic do not?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if both of the following criteria are satisfied according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/): (a) The New York Knicks are declared the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals. (b) The Orlando Magic are not declared the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals. It will be answered with **No** if either the New York Knicks fail to win the Finals or the Orlando Magic succeed in winning the Finals.

question.title: Will either the Orlando Magic or the New York Knicks win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either the Orlando Magic or the New York Knicks are crowned the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** if neither team wins and they are both eliminated from contention.

not_P.title: Will neither the Orlando Magic nor the New York Knicks win the 2024 NBA Finals?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if neither the Orlando Magic nor the New York Knicks are crowned the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** if either team wins.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the Orlando Magic or the New York Knicks to become champions in the 2024 NBA Finals?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if either the Orlando Magic or the New York Knicks are declared the winners of the 2024 NBA Finals, as per [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It will result in a **No** if both teams do not win and are removed from the race.

question.title: Before July 1, 2024, will the International Criminal Court issue arrest warrants for any of the listed Israeli leaders?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the below listed Israeli cabinet members. It will resolve as **No** otherwise.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

not_P.title: Before July 1, 2024, will the International Criminal Court not issue arrest warrants for any of the listed Israeli leaders?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) does not issue a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the below listed Israeli cabinet members. It will resolve as **No** otherwise.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

para_P.title: Will any of the specified Israeli leaders have arrest warrants issued by the International Criminal Court prior to July 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the Israeli cabinet members listed below before July 1, 2024. It will be deemed **No** in all other cases.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) A terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics (2) Before July 1, 2024, the ICC does not issue arrest warrants for any of the listed Israeli leaders?
question.body:
(1) The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

(2) This question will resolve as **Yes** if before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) does not issue a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the below listed Israeli cabinet members. It will resolve as **No** otherwise.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

not_P.title: Will at least one of the following occur: (1) A terrorist act does not occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics (2) Before July 1, 2024, the ICC issues arrest warrants for any of the listed Israeli leaders?
not_P.body:
(1) The question will resolve as Yes if no terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

(2) This question will resolve as **Yes** if before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the below listed Israeli cabinet members. It will resolve as **No** otherwise.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following will take place: (1) A terrorist incident happens in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics (2) Prior to July 1, 2024, the ICC refrains from issuing arrest warrants for any of the specified Israeli leaders?
para_P.body:
(1) The answer will be Yes if a terrorist incident in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) results in injuries and/or fatalities of at least one individual, other than the terrorist(s), from the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) to the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The answer will be No if this does not occur.

An event will be deemed a 'terrorist incident' if it is classified as such by any governmental agency of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

(2) This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) does not release a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the listed Israeli cabinet officials. It will conclude as **No** otherwise.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) the ICC issues arrest warrants for listed Israeli leaders by July 1, 2024, (b) a terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a warrant of arrest for any of the following Israeli cabinet members: Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister), Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister), Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff). It will resolve as **No** otherwise.

(b) The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in Metropolitan France injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen. An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) the ICC issues arrest warrants for listed Israeli leaders by July 1, 2024, (b) a terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
not_P.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) does not issue a warrant of arrest for any of the following Israeli cabinet members: Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister), Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister), Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff). It will resolve as **No** otherwise.

(b) The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in Metropolitan France does not injure and/or kill at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does happen. An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that one of the following will take place: (a) the ICC will issue arrest warrants for specified Israeli officials by July 1, 2024, (b) a terrorist incident happens in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
para_P.body:
(a) This question will be marked as **Yes** if, prior to July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues an arrest warrant for any of the following Israeli government officials: Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister), Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister), Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff). It will be marked as **No** otherwise.

(b) The question will be marked as Yes if a terrorist incident in Metropolitan France results in injuries and/or fatalities to at least one person, excluding the terrorist(s), during the period from the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) to the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). It will be marked as No if this does not occur. An event will be classified as a 'terrorist incident' if it is labeled as such by any French State agency, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 3 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden fall between 3 and 4 according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be settled based on the difference in favor of Donald Trump over Joe Biden as indicated by 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure signifies a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure indicates that Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which would count as a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

question.title: Will Chris Christie be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 3 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Chris Christie is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is less than or equal to 3 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to the chart accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. 

For condition (a), it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

For condition (b), a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, a value of 2.4 means Trump is 2.4 points ahead of Biden. The question will resolve as **Yes** if Trump's lead is <= 3 or > 4 on the specified date.

not_P.title: Will Chris Christie not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following conditions are met: (a) Chris Christie is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to the chart accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. 

For condition (a), it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

For condition (b), a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, a value of 2.4 means Trump is 2.4 points ahead of Biden. The question will resolve as **Yes** if Trump's lead is > 3 and <= 4 on the specified date.

para_P.title: Will Chris Christie be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election and will Trump's advantage over Biden be 3 points or less, or exceed 4 points on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (a) Chris Christie is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is 3 points or less, or greater than 4 points on July 15, 2024, based on the chart accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. 

For criterion (a), it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican party on election day; it is strictly based on the selection made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

For criterion (b), a positive number indicates a Trump lead, whereas a negative number indicates Biden is ahead. For instance, a figure of 2.4 indicates Trump is leading Biden by 2.4 points. The question will be resolved as **Yes** if Trump's lead is <= 3 or > 4 on the specified date.

question.title: Will either Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, or Chris Christie be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. (b) Chris Christie is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not by who receives the nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

not_P.title: Will neither Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, nor Chris Christie be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs: (a) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. (b) Chris Christie is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not by who receives the nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Trump's advantage over Biden be more than 3 but no more than 4 according to 538's national polling average, or will Chris Christie be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body: This question will be answered as **Yes** if at least one of the following happens: (a) Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) exceeds 3 and is at most 4 on July 15, 2024, as shown on the chart when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. In this context, a positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure indicates Biden is ahead. (b) Chris Christie is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is based solely on who the delegates of the Republican National Convention select, not on who is announced as the nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

question.title: Will Malta qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Malta participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If they do not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Malta not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Malta does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If they do qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Malta set to advance to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Malta competes in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having progressed to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Malta fails to qualify, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur in Eurovision 2024: (a) Slovenia qualifies for the Grand Final, and (b) Malta fails to qualify for the Grand Final?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Slovenia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Malta either does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either condition is not met, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will either of the following occur in Eurovision 2024: (a) Slovenia does not qualify for the Grand Final, or (b) Malta qualifies for the Grand Final?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following conditions is met: (a) Slovenia does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) Malta participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If both conditions are met, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it true that in Eurovision 2024, both Slovenia will make it to the Grand Final and Malta will not?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if both of these criteria are satisfied: (a) Slovenia competes in a Semi-final and is confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having reached the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Malta either does not take part in a Semi-final or is not confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having reached the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either of these criteria is not fulfilled, the inquiry will be deemed **No**.

question.title: Will either Malta or Slovenia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either Malta or Slovenia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither Malta nor Slovenia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither Malta nor Slovenia participates in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Are Malta or Slovenia going to make it to the Grand Final at Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if either Malta or Slovenia competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. If neither of them qualifies, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate being selected will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Tucker Carlson not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If Tucker Carlson is selected, this question will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Tucker Carlson going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 United States Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 United States Presidential Election. If any other individual is chosen, it will resolve as **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently mentioned; additional contenders may be introduced later.

For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the date of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively based on who is elected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Francis Suarez be the Republican nominee and Tucker Carlson not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Francis Suarez is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) Tucker Carlson is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If either condition is not met, this question will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Francis Suarez not be the Republican nominee or Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following conditions is met: (a) Francis Suarez is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If both conditions are met, this question will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Francis Suarez going to be the Republican candidate while Tucker Carlson will not be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (a) Francis Suarez is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) Tucker Carlson is not chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If either criterion is not fulfilled, this inquiry will conclude as **No**. This inquiry is not limited to the candidates currently discussed; additional options may emerge in the future.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who secures the Republican nomination on the date of the 2024 US election; it is strictly based on who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will either Tucker Carlson or Francis Suarez be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either Tucker Carlson or Francis Suarez is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate being selected will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will neither Tucker Carlson nor Francis Suarez be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither Tucker Carlson nor Francis Suarez is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If either Tucker Carlson or Francis Suarez is selected, it will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Will either Tucker Carlson or Francis Suarez be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

This question will resolve as **Yes** if Will Hurd is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.
