For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Will Hurd going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will resolve as **Yes** if Will Hurd is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently listed; additional options may be included later.

For the purposes of this question, it does not matter who is awarded the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively determined by the selection made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump testifies at the hush money trial and (b) Will Hurd is not the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: 

1. [Credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

2. Will Hurd is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If any other candidate is selected, this condition is met. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will at least one of the following not occur: (a) Donald Trump does not testify at the hush money trial or (b) Will Hurd is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if at least one of the following conditions is met: 

1. [Credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that Donald Trump has not testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

2. Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If he is selected, this condition is met. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Will both of the following happen: (a) Donald Trump gives testimony at the hush money trial and (b) Will Hurd does not become the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following criteria are fulfilled: 

1. [Reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that Donald Trump has provided testimony, either in person or via remote means, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) related to the alleged "hush money" payments made to Stormy Daniels.

2. Will Hurd is not chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This condition is satisfied if any other individual is appointed. This determination is made solely based on who the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention) select.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? (b) Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: 

(a) Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), not who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) [Credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

The question will resolve as **No** if neither (a) nor (b) occurs.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Will Hurd not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? (b) Donald Trump not testify at the hush money trial?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs: 

(a) Hurd is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), not who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) [Credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has not testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

The question will resolve as **No** if either (a) or (b) occurs.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following will happen: (a) Hurd becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election? (b) Will Donald Trump provide testimony at the hush money trial?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if at least one of the following takes place: 

(a) Hurd is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is based on the selection made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), rather than who is announced as the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) [Reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that Donald Trump has given testimony, either in person or virtually, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) regarding the alleged "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

The inquiry will be considered **No** if neither (a) nor (b) takes place.

question.title: Will Tim Scott be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tim Scott is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
question.body:
Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/24034/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question resolves as Yes if before August 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or credible reports:

The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).

The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) Tucker Carlson not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead.

2. Tucker Carlson is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following conditions are met:

1. Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is less than or equal to 3 or greater than 4 on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead.

2. Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if both of the subsequent criteria are fulfilled:

1. Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) exceeds 3 and is no greater than 4 on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a Trump advantage.

2. Tucker Carlson is not chosen by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This determination is based solely on who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will either Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (1) Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This determination is based solely on the selection by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. (2) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 according to 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

This determination is based solely on the selection by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. (2) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 according to 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if one of the following takes place: (1) Tucker Carlson is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision relies exclusively on the choice made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, irrespective of who is declared the Republican nominee on the date of the 2024 US election. (2) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is more than 3 and at most 4 according to 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as shown on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a lead for Trump.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but not exceed 3 based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
The resolution of this inquiry will depend on the difference in favor of Donald Trump compared to Joe Biden as indicated by 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on the chart dated July 15, 2024, as reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure signifies a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure indicates Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value showed Trump ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which would be interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Greens–EFA holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections (b) Trump's lead over Biden is ≤ 2 or > 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, this sub-question will resolve as **Yes**. This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Greens–EFA holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections (b) Trump's lead over Biden is > 2 and ≤ 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group does not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, this sub-question will resolve as **No**. This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

para_P.title: Will the following two events take place: (a) the Greens–EFA group secures the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections (b) Trump's advantage over Biden is ≤ 2 or > 3 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
(a) This question will be answered with **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group secures the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliament elections, and it will be answered with **No** for any other results. If two parties are tied in the number of seats, this sub-question will also be answered with **Yes**. The resolution of this question relies on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable media sources.

(b) This question will be answered with **Yes** if Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is either less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on the chart dated July 15, 2024, as reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. In this context, a positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure signifies a Biden lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would count as a positive value of 2.4 for this question.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? (b) Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**. This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? (b) Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
not_P.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

(b) This question will resolve as **No** if the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **Yes** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **No**. This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following scenarios will take place: (a) Trump's margin over Biden exceeds 2 but does not go beyond 3 on July 15, 2024, according to the national polling average from 538? (b) Will the Greens–EFA secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
(a) The outcome of this inquiry will be determined by Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in the 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies that Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump 2.4 points in front of Biden, translating to a positive value of 2.4 for this inquiry.

(b) This question will be answered with **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political faction holds the majority of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, and will be answered with **No** for any other results. In the event that two factions are tied in seat count, both sub-questions will be regarded as **Yes**. The resolution of this question is based on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable news sources.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024 and (b) Francis Suarez is not the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) The Democrats will have a brokered convention in 2024 if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this condition is not met.

(b) Francis Suarez will not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election if he is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee. This condition is met if any other candidate is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

not_P.title: Will either of the following not occur: (a) The Democrats do not have a brokered convention in 2024 or (b) Francis Suarez is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
(a) The Democrats will not have a brokered convention in 2024 if the Democratic Party requires only one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If more than one ballot is required, then this condition is met.

(b) Francis Suarez will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election if he is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee. This condition is not met if no other candidate is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) The Democrats will hold a brokered convention in 2024, and (b) Francis Suarez will not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) A brokered convention for the Democrats in 2024 will take place if the Democratic Party needs more than one voting round during its roll call ballot to officially choose its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only a single ballot is needed, then this condition does not apply.

(b) Francis Suarez will not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election if he is not chosen by the Republican National Convention as their nominee. This condition holds true if any other candidate is selected by the delegates at the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Francis Suarez is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election (b) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Francis Suarez is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. (b) The Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election, resulting in a brokered convention. If neither of these events occurs, the question resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Francis Suarez is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election (b) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?

This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. (b) The Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election, resulting in a brokered convention. If either of these events occurs, the question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that either of the following happens: (a) Francis Suarez becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election (b) The Democrats hold a brokered convention in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if at least one of the following takes place: (a) Francis Suarez is chosen by the delegates at the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, which is based on their selection, rather than the announcement of the Republican nominee on the day of the election. (b) The Democratic Party needs to conduct multiple rounds of voting during its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election, leading to a brokered convention. If neither scenario occurs, the inquiry will be deemed **No**.

question.title: Will the Republicans Party of France (Les Républicains) form a political alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if before June 30, 2024, an electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming [French legislative election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_French_legislative_election), according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).  If no such agreement is announced, this question resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Will the Republicans Party of France (Les Républicains) not form a political alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if before June 30, 2024, no electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming [French legislative election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_French_legislative_election), according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).  If such an agreement is announced, this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Les Républicains and the National Rally collaborate for the 2024 legislative elections in France?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if an official electoral alliance or coalition agreement is declared between Les Républicains and Rassemblement National prior to June 30, 2024, based on information from [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions). If such an agreement does not occur, the response will be **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Prime Minister of France belongs to the Together coalition on July 30, 2024, and (b) The Republicans Party of France (Les Républicains) does not form a political alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** only if both of the following conditions are met: (a) The party of the Prime Minister of France is Together on July 30th, 2024, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources. (b) No electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the 2024 French legislative election before June 30, 2024, according to credible sources. If either condition is not met, this question resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Will at least one of the following occur: (a) The Prime Minister of France does not belong to the Together coalition on July 30, 2024, or (b) The Republicans Party of France (Les Républicains) forms a political alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if at least one of the following conditions is met: (a) The party of the Prime Minister of France is not Together on July 30th, 2024, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources. (b) An electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the 2024 French legislative election before June 30, 2024, according to credible sources. If both conditions are met, this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: On July 30, 2024, will the Prime Minister of France be a member of the Together coalition, and will the Republicans Party of France (Les Républicains) refrain from forming a political partnership with the National Rally for the upcoming 2024 French legislative election?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** only if both of the following criteria are fulfilled: (a) The Prime Minister of France's party is Together on July 30th, 2024, at 12:00 Central European Time, based on reliable sources. (b) There is no official announcement of an electoral alliance or coalition agreement between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) regarding the 2024 French legislative election prior to June 30, 2024, according to trustworthy sources. If either of these criteria is not satisfied, this question will be answered with **No**.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by mid-2024: (a) The Republicans Party of France forms an alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 legislative election (b) The Prime Minister of France belongs to the Together coalition on July 30, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Before June 30, 2024, an electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming French legislative election, according to credible sources. (b) On July 30, 2024, at 12:00 Central European Time, the party of the Prime Minister of France is Together, according to credible sources. If neither of these conditions is met, this question resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur by mid-2024: (a) The Republicans Party of France forms an alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 legislative election (b) The Prime Minister of France belongs to the Together coalition on July 30, 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs: (a) Before June 30, 2024, an electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming French legislative election, according to credible sources. (b) On July 30, 2024, at 12:00 Central European Time, the party of the Prime Minister of France is Together, according to credible sources. If either of these conditions is met, this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that by mid-2024, one of the following will happen: (a) The Republicans Party of France collaborates with the National Rally for the 2024 legislative election (b) The Prime Minister of France is part of the Together coalition on July 30, 2024?
para_P.body: This question is answered with **Yes** if at least one of the following takes place: (a) An official announcement regarding an electoral alliance or coalition between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and the National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the forthcoming French legislative election is made by June 30, 2024, according to reliable sources. (b) On July 30, 2024, at 12:00 Central European Time, the Prime Minister of France is affiliated with the Together party, based on trustworthy sources. If neither of these scenarios occurs, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be 3 or less, or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump have a lead over Joe Biden that exceeds 3 but does not go beyond 4, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude based on the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as indicated on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies that Biden is in front. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Larry Elder be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 3 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
(a) Larry Elder will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election if he is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(b) Trump's lead over Biden will be less than or equal to 3 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average. This is based on Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

not_P.title: Will either of the following not occur: (a) Larry Elder not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or (b) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
(a) Larry Elder will not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election if he is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee. This is determined by who is not selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(b) Trump's lead over Biden will be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average. This is based on Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

para_P.title: Are both of the following going to happen: (a) Larry Elder becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) Trump's margin over Biden is either 3 or less or exceeds 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
(a) Larry Elder will be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election if he is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the nominee. This selection is made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(b) Trump's margin over Biden will be either 3 or less or more than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average. This is based on the lead that Donald Trump has over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as shown on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

question.title: Will either Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, or Larry Elder be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following conditions is met: (1) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 points on July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart for that date, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead. (2) Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This determination is based on the selection by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), not on who receives the nomination on the day of the election.

not_P.title: Will neither Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, nor Larry Elder be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if neither of the following conditions is met: (1) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 points on July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart for that date, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead. (2) Larry Elder is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This determination is based on the selection by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), not on who receives the nomination on the day of the election.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Trump's advantage over Biden exceed 3 but be at most 4 according to 538's national polling average, or will Larry Elder be chosen as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if at least one of the following scenarios occurs: (1) Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) surpasses 3 and is no greater than 4 points on July 15, 2024, as indicated in the chart for that date, when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive number signifies a lead for Trump. (2) Larry Elder is nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This conclusion is drawn from the decision made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), and not from who is declared the nominee on election day.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will fewer than 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
not_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by fewer than 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of fewer than 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate endorse a public statement against the initiative to nominate Biden prematurely?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to voice their opposition to their party’s initiative to finalize President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than initially intended, which they believe suppresses the vigorous ongoing discussion regarding his candidacy, according to a legislator involved in the initiative.

A letter that has been drafted, shared by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, provides the first public indication from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump that many of their own members are still quite concerned about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a truly poor decision by the DNC. Someone believes it’s a smart tactic to stifle debate and I suppose through sheer force, achieve consensus, but it doesn’t function that way,” Huffman stated in an interview. He chose not to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market will resolve to YES if a public statement opposing the early nomination initiative is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who align with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Several such statements with a total of 20 lawmakers' endorsements would also be adequate to resolve this market to YES. 

If these conditions are not fulfilled by market close, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024 (b) Fewer than 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
(a) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024: This question resolves as Yes if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as No.

(b) Fewer than 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early: This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by fewer than 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple such letters with a combined total of fewer than 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024 (b) 20 or more House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
not_P.body:
(a) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024: This question resolves as Yes if the Democratic Party does not require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If more than one ballot is required, then this question resolves as No.

(b) 20 or more House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early: This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by 20 or more House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 or more lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Democrats will hold a brokered convention in 2024 (b) Less than 20 Democratic House/Senate members will sign a public letter against the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
para_P.body:
(a) Democrats will hold a brokered convention in 2024: This question will be answered affirmatively if the Democratic Party needs more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is necessary, then the answer will be negative.

(b) Less than 20 Democratic House/Senate members sign a public letter against the early nomination plan: This market will resolve positively if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by fewer than 20 House Members or Senators affiliated with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple such letters with a total of fewer than 20 lawmakers' signatures would also suffice to resolve this market positively. If these conditions are not met by market close, this market will resolve negatively.

question.title: Will either at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early, or will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following conditions are met: (a) A public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st, 2024. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient. (b) The Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If neither condition is met, this question resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Will fewer than 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early, and will Democrats not have a brokered convention in 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if neither of the following conditions are met: (a) A public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st, 2024. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient. (b) The Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If either condition is met, this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that at least 20 Democrats from the House or Senate will endorse a public statement against the proposal to nominate Biden early, or will the Democrats face a brokered convention in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if one of the following scenarios occurs: (a) A public statement against the early nomination proposal is endorsed by a minimum of 20 House Representatives or Senators affiliated with the Democratic Party prior to the market closing on Sunday, July 21st, 2024. Alternatively, multiple statements totaling 20 lawmakers' endorsements would also qualify. (b) The Democratic Party is compelled to conduct more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If neither of these scenarios takes place, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Tim Scott be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tim Scott is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(b) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

question.title: Will Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

not_P.title: Will Kamala's odds of winning not increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is <=46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

para_P.title: Will Kamala's chances of victory improve in the upcoming week based on Nate Silver's model?

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, and (b) Kamala's odds of winning not increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

(b) Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is <=46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be ambiguous and inconclusive: it should leave room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

(b) Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of these events will take place: (a) Joe Biden will declare by July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's presidential nomination, and (b) Kamala's chances of winning will not rise in the coming week according to Nate Silver's analysis?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue or accept his party's nomination for another presidential term in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden might accept the Democratic Party's presidential nomination for the 2024 election.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, the question will resolve as **No**.

(b) This will resolve as YES if the probability of Harris winning in the Electoral College according to Nate Silver's model is <=46.6% on Friday, August 9th at 8:40 PM. It will resolve as NO otherwise.
