question.title: Will the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a Woman?
question.body:
Will resolve “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

Will resolve “no” if/when the Democratic delegates select a male presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

not_P.title: Will the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee not be a Woman?
not_P.body:
Will resolve “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates select a male presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

Will resolve “no” if/when the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee to be a Female?
para_P.body:
This will conclude with a “yes” if the Democratic delegates choose a woman as their presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

This will conclude with a “no” if the Democratic delegates choose a man as their presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The same nation wins more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics (b) The 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee is a Man?
question.body:
(a) The question about the 2024 Olympics resolves as Yes if any National Olympic Committee (NOC) wins gold in at least two of the eight women's team sports: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. Otherwise, it resolves as No. 

(b) The question about the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee resolves as Yes if the Democratic delegates select a male presidential nominee for the 2024 election. It resolves as No if they select a female presidential nominee.

This combined question resolves as Yes only if both (a) and (b) resolve as Yes.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) The same nation wins more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics (b) The 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee is a Woman?
not_P.body:
(a) The question about the 2024 Olympics resolves as Yes if any National Olympic Committee (NOC) wins gold in at least two of the eight women's team sports: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. Otherwise, it resolves as No. 

(b) The question about the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee resolves as Yes if the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election. It resolves as No if they select a male presidential nominee.

This combined question resolves as Yes only if neither (a) nor (b) resolve as Yes.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) A single country secures victory in more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics (b) The Democratic Party's presidential candidate for 2024 is a male?
para_P.body:
(a) The inquiry regarding the 2024 Olympics is answered with Yes if any National Olympic Committee (NOC) achieves gold in at least two out of the eight women's team sports: soccer, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. If not, the answer is No. 

(b) The question concerning the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee is resolved with Yes if the Democratic delegates choose a male candidate for the presidential election in 2024. If they opt for a female candidate, the answer is No.

This question as a whole will be answered with Yes only if both (a) and (b) are answered with Yes.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) The 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a Woman? (b) The same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
(a) The question about the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee resolves “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election. It resolves “no” if/when the Democratic delegates select a male presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

(b) The question about the 2024 Olympics resolves as No if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. Otherwise, it resolves as Yes if the same NOC wins at least two of these events.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) The 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a Woman? (b) The same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
not_P.body:
(a) The question about the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee resolves “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates select a male presidential nominee for the 2024 election. It resolves “no” if/when the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

(b) The question about the 2024 Olympics resolves as Yes if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. Otherwise, it resolves as No if the same NOC wins at least two of these events.

para_P.title: Is it possible that either of these events will take place: (a) A Woman will be the Democratic Presidential Nominee in 2024? (b) A single country will secure victories in multiple women's team sports at the 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body:
(a) The inquiry regarding the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee will be considered to have a “yes” answer if the Democratic delegates choose a female candidate for the presidential election in 2024. Conversely, it will be deemed “no” if a male candidate is selected by the Democratic delegates for the same election.

(b) The question concerning the 2024 Olympics will be answered as No if women's teams from eight distinct National Olympic Committees (NOC) claim gold medals in the eight team sports: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. It will be answered as Yes if at least two of these events are won by the same NOC.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

not_P.title: Will Biden not be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker does not ask Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

para_P.title: Will the 25th Amendment Section 4 be used to declare Biden incapacitated prior to August?
para_P.body:
This will be considered YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate authority) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his position" and allows the Vice President to assume the role of Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., does not apply. Biden's activation of section 3 of the 25th amendment is also not applicable.

Context: A GOP legislator urges Merrick Garland to apply the 25th Amendment to oust Biden from office.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President AND (2) Biden is not declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024?
question.body:
(1) This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination.

(2) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and do not cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (1) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President NOR (2) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024?
not_P.body:
(1) This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign does not make a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be ambiguous or inconclusive, leaving room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination.

(2) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) do invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and do cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

para_P.title: Will both of the following take place: (1) Joe Biden makes a public announcement before July 15, 2024 stating that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President AND (2) Biden is not officially deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August 2024?
para_P.body:
(1) This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, and official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue or accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The declaration must be unequivocal and definitive, leaving no possibility that Biden would consider accepting the Democratic Party's nomination.

(2) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or another pertinent body) do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally assert that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and do not enable the Vice President to act as President before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is not relevant. Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden invoking Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is not included.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024, (b) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

(b) This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024, (b) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
not_P.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) does not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

(b) This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign does not make a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

para_P.title: Is it possible that either of the following happens: (a) Biden is declared unfit under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024, (b) Joe Biden states before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
(a) This will resolve to YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to perform the powers and duties of his office" and allow the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this question. Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden's invocation of section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

(b) This question will be considered Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. For a Yes resolution, the statement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve to No.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

not_P.title: Will Biden not be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and do not cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to not invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

para_P.title: Will the 25th Amendment Section 4 be invoked to declare Biden incapacitated prior to August?
para_P.body:
The answer is YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate authority) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his position" and enables the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is excluded. Biden's self-invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also excluded.

Context: A GOP lawmaker requests Merrick Garland to activate the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from the Presidency.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday, July 19, 2024, and (b) Biden not be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question resolves to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. It resolves to “No” if Trump has a higher probability. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, it resolves 50-50. The resolution source is FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast. If no data for July 19 is available by July 22, it resolves according to the nearest previous figures.

(b) This question resolves to YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to declare Biden unable to discharge his duties before August 2024. Biden exiting the office by death, resignation, etc., does not count, nor does Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment. The duration of incapacity does not matter.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday, July 19, 2024, nor (b) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) This question resolves to “Yes” if Joe Biden does not have a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. It resolves to “No” if Biden has a higher probability. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, it resolves 50-50. The resolution source is FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast. If no data for July 19 is available by July 22, it resolves according to the nearest previous figures.

(b) This question resolves to NO if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet do invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to declare Biden unable to discharge his duties before August 2024. Biden exiting the office by death, resignation, etc., does not count, nor does Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment. The duration of incapacity does not matter.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) on Friday, July 19, 2024, the 538 Project predicts Biden as the frontrunner, and (b) Biden will not be deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be answered with “Yes” if the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024, indicates that Joe Biden has a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump. It will be answered with “No” if Trump's chances are higher. If both candidates have equal probabilities, the answer will be 50-50. The resolution source is the FiveThirtyEight forecast for the 2024 presidential election. Should there be no data available for July 19 by July 22, the resolution will rely on the closest preceding data.

(b) This question will be answered with YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet does not activate Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to declare Biden unfit to perform his duties before August 2024. The circumstances of Biden leaving office due to death, resignation, etc., are not included, nor is Biden's invocation of section 3 of the 25th amendment. The length of incapacity is irrelevant.

question.title: Will either Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024, or will 538 project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves to YES if either of the following occurs: (a) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024. This occurs if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count. (b) FiveThirtyEight projects Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024. This occurs if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50. The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market. This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

not_P.title: Will neither Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024, nor will 538 project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves to YES if neither of the following occurs: (a) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024. This occurs if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count. (b) FiveThirtyEight projects Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024. This occurs if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50. The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market. This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that either Biden will be deemed unable to fulfill his duties under the 25th Amendment Section 4 prior to August 2024, or that 538 will indicate Biden as the leading candidate on July 19, 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with a YES if one of the following situations occurs: (a) Biden is deemed unable to fulfill his duties under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024. This happens if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and enable the Vice President to act as President, prior to August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this question. Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden activating section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count. (b) FiveThirtyEight indicates Biden as the leading candidate on July 19, 2024. This occurs if Joe Biden has a greater chance of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have the same odds, this market will settle at 50-50. The resolution will be based on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the figures represented by the blue and red trend lines for the resolution date of this market. Any changes in the method that FiveThirtyEight uses to calculate its figures will not affect the resolution of this market. This market will resolve based on the data for July 19 as soon as data for July 20 is available. If there are no data points for July 19 by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve based on the closest previous figures to July 19.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents when facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat (b) No member of the Trump family is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?
question.body:
(a) There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error. Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

(b) Resolves **Yes** if none of these individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024:

 - Donald Trump
 - Donald Trump Jr.
 - Eric Trump
 - Ivanka Trump
 - Tiffany Trump
 - Melania Trump
 - Barron Trump

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents when facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat (b) At least one member of the Trump family is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error. Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 does not exceed that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 < 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

(b) Resolves **Yes** if at least one of these individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024:

 - Donald Trump
 - Donald Trump Jr.
 - Eric Trump
 - Ivanka Trump
 - Tiffany Trump
 - Melania Trump
 - Barron Trump

para_P.title: Is it true that both of these events will happen: (a) Trump receives a minimum of 3% more support among Manifold participants when matched against Joe Biden rather than a generic Democrat (b) No Trump family member will be the Republican candidate for the US Presidency in 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Two Manifold polls are available, both closing on July 6. One poll asks Manifold participants to vote for Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while another asks them to vote for a generic Democrat on a similar ballot.

Public opinion surveys regularly indicate that Joe Biden is trailing Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, whereas every other Democrat in hypothetical matchups is either ahead or within the margin of error. Do Manifold participants reflect the overall public opinion?

This market will conclude with a YES if Trump's vote percentage in poll 1 surpasses that in poll 2 by 3% or greater when both polls close.

To calculate Trump's vote percentage, the formula used is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). A YES answer is given if the result of this formula for poll 1 minus the formula for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. Otherwise, the answer is NO.

(b) This will resolve as **Yes** if none of the following individuals becomes the Republican candidate for the US Presidency in 2024:

 - Donald Trump
 - Donald Trump Jr.
 - Eric Trump
 - Ivanka Trump
 - Tiffany Trump
 - Melania Trump
 - Barron Trump

(b) Donald Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents when facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat. This is determined by two Manifold polls, both closing on July 6. One poll includes Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and the other includes a generic Democrat. The question resolves **Yes** if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the Biden poll exceeds that in the generic Democrat poll by 3% or more. The formula for the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is **Yes** if this formula for the Biden poll minus the formula for the generic Democrat poll is >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is **No**.

(b) Donald Trump gains less than 3% among Manifold respondents when facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat. This is determined by two Manifold polls, both closing on July 6. The inquiry resolves as **Yes** if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the Biden poll surpasses that in the generic Democrat poll by 3% or greater. The calculation for Trump's vote percentage is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The result is **Yes** if the difference between the Biden poll's formula and the generic Democrat poll's formula is >= 0.03. If not, the answer is **No**.

question.title: Will Joe Biden still be president by the end of July?
question.body: This market will resolve yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024 if Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden not be president by the end of July?
not_P.body: This market will resolve yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024 Joe Biden is no longer officially president of the United States.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden remain in office as president until the conclusion of July?
para_P.body: This market will settle on yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024, Joe Biden is still the duly elected president of the United States.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early; (b) Joe Biden is not president by the end of July 2024?
question.body:
(a) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats must sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early. This involves a drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman, opposing the Democratic Party's effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned. The letter must be signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 signatures are also sufficient.

(b) Joe Biden must not be officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024. If he is not president at that time, this condition is met.

not_P.title: Will at least one of the following not occur: (a) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats do not sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early; (b) Joe Biden is president by the end of July 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats must not sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early. This means that either no letter is drafted or fewer than 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party sign the letter before the end of Sunday, July 21st.

(b) Joe Biden must be officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024. If he is president at that time, this condition is met.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to take place: (a) A minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate endorse a public letter against the plan to virtually nominate Biden ahead of schedule; (b) Joe Biden is no longer the president by the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) A minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate must endorse a public letter that opposes the initiative to virtually nominate Biden ahead of the planned timeline. This pertains to a letter drafted and circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman, which contests the Democratic Party's intention to finalize President Joe Biden’s nomination earlier than initially intended. The letter needs to be endorsed by at least 20 Democratic House Members or Senators before the deadline of Sunday, July 21st. Alternatively, several letters with a total of 20 signatures are also acceptable.

(b) Joe Biden must not hold the office of president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024. If he is not the president at this specified time, this condition is satisfied.

question.title: Will either Joe Biden still be president by the end of July 2024, or at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the early nomination plan?
question.body: This question resolves to YES if either of the following occurs: (a) Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024; (b) A public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st, 2024. Multiple letters with a combined total of 20 signatures are sufficient for a YES resolution. If neither condition is met, the answer is NO.

not_P.title: Will neither Joe Biden still be president by the end of July 2024, nor at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the early nomination plan?
not_P.body: This question resolves to YES if neither of the following occurs: (a) Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024; (b) A public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st, 2024. If either condition is met, the answer is NO.

para_P.title: By the conclusion of July 2024, will Joe Biden remain in the presidency, or will a minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate endorse a public statement against the early nomination strategy?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered a YES if at least one of the following happens: (a) Joe Biden is still the recognized president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31, 2024; (b) At least 20 Democratic House Members or Senators sign a public statement opposing the early nomination strategy prior to the market closing on Sunday, July 21, 2024. It is acceptable for multiple statements to collectively have 20 signatures to achieve a YES outcome. If neither scenario occurs, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will Larry Elder be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Democrats not have a brokered convention in 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party does not require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If more than one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the Democrats will hold a brokered convention in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if the Democratic Party necessitates multiple rounds of voting during its roll call ballot to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Conversely, if only a single ballot is needed, then this inquiry will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early (b) Democrats not have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body:
(a) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early: Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

(b) Democrats not have a brokered convention in 2024: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires only one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If more than one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early (b) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early: Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are met by market close, this market resolves NO.

(b) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Are the following two events going to happen: (a) A minimum of 20 Democrats in the House or Senate will endorse a public letter against the plan to nominate Biden early (b) The Democrats will avoid a brokered convention in 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) A minimum of 20 Democrats in the House or Senate will endorse a public letter against the plan to nominate Biden early: Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a response to their party’s initiative to finalize President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than intended, claiming it suppresses the vital ongoing discussions regarding his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the initiative.

A letter drafted and shared by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO provides the first public indication from Democrats since the attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump that many of their members are still quite concerned about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really poor decision by the DNC. Someone believes it’s a smart tactic to shut down debate and, through sheer force, create unity, but that’s not how it works,” Huffman stated in an interview. He refrained from confirming the letter's existence.

This market will conclude with a YES if at least 20 House Members or Senators who are part of the Democratic Party sign a public letter opposing the early nomination plan before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Even if multiple letters together gather 20 signatures from lawmakers, that would also lead to a YES resolution for this market. 

If these conditions are not fulfilled by the market close, this market will resolve to NO.

(b) The Democrats will avoid a brokered convention in 2024: This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Democratic Party only needs one voting round in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If more than one voting round is necessary, then this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024 (b) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
(a) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024: This occurs if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this does not occur.

(b) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early: This occurs if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient for this to occur. If these criteria are not met by market close, this does not occur.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024 (b) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats do not sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
not_P.body:
(a) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024: This does not occur if the Democratic Party requires only one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election.

(b) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats do not sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early: This does not occur if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. If these criteria are met by market close, this occurs.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that one of the following will happen: (a) The Democratic Party will experience a brokered convention in 2024 (b) A minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate will publicly oppose the initiative to nominate Biden early?
para_P.body:
(a) The Democratic Party will experience a brokered convention in 2024: This situation arises if the Democratic Party needs more than one voting round in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 presidential election in the United States. If only a single ballot is needed, then this does not happen.

(b) A minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate will publicly oppose the initiative to nominate Biden early: This occurs if at least 20 Democratic House Members or Senators sign a public letter against the early nomination plan before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Additionally, multiple letters totaling at least 20 signatures from lawmakers would also fulfill this condition. If these conditions are not satisfied by market close, then this does not happen.

question.title: Will Albania qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Albania participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. The question will resolve as **No** for all other outcomes regarding Albania.

not_P.title: Will Albania not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Albania does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. The question will resolve as **No** for all other outcomes regarding Albania.

para_P.title: Is Albania going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Albania takes part in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. The outcome will be **No** for any other scenario related to Albania.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Iceland qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024 and (b) Albania fails to qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Iceland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (2) Albania either does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either condition is not met, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will either of the following not occur: (a) Iceland qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024 or (b) Albania qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following conditions are met: (1) Iceland does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (2) Albania participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If both conditions are met, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it true that both (a) Iceland makes it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024 and (b) Albania does not make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if the following two criteria are satisfied: (1) Iceland takes part in a Semi-final and is officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024, and (2) Albania either does not take part in a Semi-final or is not officially declared by the EBU as having advanced to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. If either of these criteria is not satisfied, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Will either Albania or Iceland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either Albania or Iceland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. The question will resolve as **No** if neither country qualifies.

not_P.title: Will neither Albania nor Iceland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither Albania nor Iceland participates in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. The question will resolve as **No** if either country qualifies.

para_P.title: Is there a chance that either Albania or Iceland will make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if either Albania or Iceland competes in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. It will be answered with **No** if neither nation qualifies.

question.title: Will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump not testify at the hush money trial?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has not testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump take the stand at the hush money trial?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered as **Yes** if [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that Donald Trump has given testimony, either in person or via remote means, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) related to the alleged "hush money" payments made to Stormy Daniels.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Iran initiate a military action on Israeli territory before August 13, 2024, midnight ET, and (b) Donald Trump not testify at the hush money trial?
question.body:
(a) This part will resolve to "Yes" if Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. A "military action" is defined as any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions, but excludes cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions. Only actions explicitly claimed by Iran or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count. Proxy force attacks do not count.

(b) This part will resolve to "Yes" if credible sources report that Donald Trump has not testified, neither in person nor remotely, at the trial concerning the "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

not_P.title: Will at least one of the following not occur: (a) Iran initiate a military action on Israeli territory before August 13, 2024, midnight ET, or (b) Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
not_P.body:
(a) This part will resolve to "Yes" if Iran does not initiate a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. A "military action" is defined as any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions, but excludes cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions. Only actions explicitly claimed by Iran or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count. Proxy force attacks do not count.

(b) This part will resolve to "Yes" if credible sources report that Donald Trump has testified, either in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) Iran will launch a military operation on Israeli land prior to midnight ET on August 13, 2024, and (b) Donald Trump will not provide testimony at the hush money trial?
para_P.body:
(a) This segment will resolve to "Yes" if Iran carries out a military operation on Israeli territory, airspace, or maritime zones between July 30 and August 12, 2024, at 11:59 PM ET. A "military operation" is characterized as any forceful action conducted by Iran on Israeli land, airspace, or maritime areas that is officially recognized by the Iranian government or supported by a consensus of reliable reporting. This encompasses airstrikes, naval assaults, or ground invasions, but does not include cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic efforts. Only actions that are explicitly claimed by Iran or verified to have originated from Iranian territory will be considered. Attacks by proxy forces do not qualify.

(b) This segment will resolve to "Yes" if trustworthy sources indicate that Donald Trump has not given testimony, either in person or remotely, at the trial regarding the "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

question.title: Will either Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial or will Iran initiate a military response before August 13th midnight Eastern Time?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) [Credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels; or (b) Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. For the purposes of this market, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory (e.g. if a weapons depot on Israeli soil is hit by an Iranian missile, this market will resolve to "Yes") that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count towards the resolution of this market. Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count toward the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces (i.e. Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not count toward the resolution of this market.

not_P.title: Will neither Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial nor will Iran initiate a military response before August 13th midnight Eastern Time?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs: (a) [Credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels; or (b) Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. For the purposes of this market, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory (e.g. if a weapons depot on Israeli soil is hit by an Iranian missile, this market will resolve to "Yes") that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count towards the resolution of this market. Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count toward the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces (i.e. Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not count toward the resolution of this market.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump take the stand at the hush money trial or will Iran launch a military strike before midnight Eastern Time on August 13th?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if one of the following happens: (a) [Reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that Donald Trump has provided testimony, either in person or virtually, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) related to the alleged "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels; or (b) Iran conducts a military operation on Israeli territory, airspace, or maritime zones between July 30 and August 12, 2024, at 11:59 PM ET. For this market, a "military operation" will be defined as any application of force undertaken by Iran on Israeli territory, airspace, or maritime zones (for instance, if an Iranian missile strikes a weapons facility in Israel, this market will resolve to "Yes") that is officially recognized by the Iranian authorities or supported by a consensus of credible reports. This encompasses, but is not limited to, aerial bombardments, naval assaults, or ground invasions. Cyber operations, sanctions, or diplomatic measures will not contribute to the resolution of this market. Only actions by Iranian military forces explicitly acknowledged by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or verified to have been launched from Iranian soil will be considered for the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by proxy groups (such as Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not be included in the resolution of this market.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but not exceeding 4, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown in the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For this question, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024 and will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) The Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this condition is not met. (2) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is less than or equal to 2 or greater than 4, as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. If both conditions are met, this question resolves as **Yes**; otherwise, it resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Democrats not have a brokered convention in 2024 or will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if at least one of the following conditions is met: (1) The Democratic Party does not require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If more than one ballot is required, then this condition is not met. (2) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4, as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. If at least one condition is met, this question resolves as **Yes**; otherwise, it resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Will the Democratic Party experience a brokered convention in 2024, and will Trump's margin over Biden be 2 or less, or exceed 4 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (1) The Democratic Party needs more than one ballot round in its roll call voting to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only a single ballot is needed, then this criterion is not fulfilled. (2) Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is 2 or lower, or exceeds 4, as indicated on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure indicates Biden is ahead. If both criteria are satisfied, this inquiry resolves as **Yes**; if not, it resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? (b) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: (a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question. (b) This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 4 or less than or equal to 2 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? (b) Democrats not have a brokered convention in 2024?
not_P.body: (a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question. (b) This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party does not require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following will take place: (a) Trump's advantage over Biden exceeds 2 but is at most 4 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average? (b) Will the Democrats face a brokered convention in 2024?
para_P.body: (a) This inquiry will be settled based on Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as depicted in the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. In this context, a positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure denotes a Biden lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value for that date shows Trump 2.4 points in front of Biden, which translates to a positive figure of 2.4 for the purpose of this inquiry. (b) This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if the Democratic Party necessitates more than one round of voting during its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Conversely, if only a single ballot is needed, then this inquiry will conclude as **No**.

question.title: Will Portugal qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Portugal participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Portugal does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Portugal not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Portugal does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Portugal qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Portugal going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Portugal competes in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. Conversely, if Portugal fails to qualify, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Poland qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024 (b) Portugal fails to qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Poland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (2) Portugal participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as not having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Poland does not qualify or Portugal qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Poland does not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024 (b) Portugal qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following conditions are met: (1) Poland does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (2) Portugal participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If both Poland qualifies and Portugal does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will the following two events take place: (a) Poland makes it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024 (b) Portugal does not make it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if both of these criteria are satisfied: (1) Poland competes in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having made it to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (2) Portugal competes in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as not having made it to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final.
