question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

not_P.title: Will 538 Project Trump as the favorite on Friday?
not_P.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Biden 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

para_P.title: Will 538 indicate Biden as the frontrunner on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a “Yes” if Joe Biden is assessed to have a greater likelihood of securing victory in the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump, based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Conversely, this market will result in a “No” if Donald Trump is deemed to have a higher chance of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden, according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the same date. In the event that both candidates are evaluated with equal probabilities, this market will resolve to a 50-50 outcome.

The resolution will rely on the FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, found at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically utilizing the figures represented by the blue and red trend lines for the date of resolution. Any alterations in the methodology used by FiveThirtyEight to derive its statistics will not affect the outcome of this market.

This market will finalize based on the data for July 19 as soon as data for July 20 is released. The market may remain unresolved until the July 20 data is available. If data for July 19 is not accessible by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the closest preceding figures to July 19.

It is important to note that the resolution pertains to the winning probabilities for each candidate expressed as a number out of 100, rounded to one decimal place (for instance, "Trump 57 out of 100"). The number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will not be taken into account.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? (2) 538 Project Biden as not the favorite on July 19, 2024?
question.body:
(1) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. 

(2) This market will resolve to “Yes” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50. The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

not_P.title: Will at least one of the following occur: (1) Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? (2) 538 Project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024?
not_P.body:
(1) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. 

(2) This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50. The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (1) Trump's margin over Biden will be more than 2 and at most 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? (2) 538 will not consider Biden as the frontrunner on July 19, 2024?
para_P.body:
(1) This inquiry will be resolved based on Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown in the chart for the date July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. Here, a positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure indicates Biden is ahead. 

(2) This market will conclude with a “Yes” if Donald Trump is projected to have a greater likelihood of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Conversely, it will conclude with a “No” if Joe Biden is projected to have a higher chance of winning than Donald Trump on that date. If both candidates have equal chances, this market will be resolved 50-50. The source for resolution will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, found at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, particularly the values indicated by the blue and red trend lines for the date of resolution. Changes in FiveThirtyEight's calculation methods will not affect the outcome of this market.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Biden is projected as the favorite by 538 on July 19, 2024, (b) Trump's lead over Biden is between 2 and 4 points on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
(a) Biden is projected as the favorite by 538 on July 19, 2024: This will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this will resolve 50-50. The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this date. Changes in methodology by FiveThirtyEight will not affect resolution. Resolution will occur according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the nearest previous figures to July 19 will be used. The resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark. The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

(b) Trump's lead over Biden is between 2 and 4 points on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average: This will resolve based on Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead. For example, a value of Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purpose.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Biden is projected as the favorite by 538 on July 19, 2024, (b) Trump's lead over Biden is between 2 and 4 points on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
(a) Biden is projected as the favorite by 538 on July 19, 2024: This will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this will resolve 50-50. The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this date. Changes in methodology by FiveThirtyEight will not affect resolution. Resolution will occur according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the nearest previous figures to July 19 will be used. The resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark. The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

(b) Trump's lead over Biden is between 2 and 4 points on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average: This will resolve based on Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead. For example, a value of Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purpose.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that either (a) Biden is identified as the frontrunner by 538 on July 19, 2024, or (b) Trump holds a lead over Biden of 2 to 4 points on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
(a) Biden is identified as the frontrunner by 538 on July 19, 2024: This will be considered “Yes” if Joe Biden is assessed to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. It will be “No” if Donald Trump is assessed to have a greater chance of winning than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for that date. If both candidates have equal chances, the outcome will be 50-50. The source for resolution will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, particularly the figures represented by the blue and red trend lines for that date. Adjustments in methodology by FiveThirtyEight will not influence the outcome. Resolution will take place based on the data for July 19 as soon as data for July 20 is available. If there are no data points for July 19 by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the closest preceding figures will be utilized. The resolution pertains to the winning probabilities of each candidate expressed as a percentage out of 100, rounded to one decimal place. The number of simulations from 1,000 in which each candidate prevailed will not be taken into account.

(b) Trump's advantage over Biden is between 2 and 4 points on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average: This will be determined by Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure indicates a lead for Biden. For instance, a value showing Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden would be interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for this analysis.

question.title: Will Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Will Hurd not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Will Hurd is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Will Hurd going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Will Hurd is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a resolution of **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently listed; additional options may be included later.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who secures the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is strictly based on who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, and (b) Will Hurd is not the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

This resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination in the 2024 election cycle. If such a statement is not made before the deadline, it resolves as No.

(b) Will Will Hurd not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

This resolves as Yes if Will Hurd is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If any other candidate is selected, it resolves as Yes. The resolution is based on the selection by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not on who receives the nomination on the day of the election.

not_P.title: Will at least one of the following not occur: (a) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, or (b) Will Hurd is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden not announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

This resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign does not make a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination in the 2024 election cycle. If such a statement is made before the deadline, it resolves as No.

(b) Will Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

This resolves as Yes if Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If any other candidate is not selected, it resolves as No. The resolution is based on the selection by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not on who receives the nomination on the day of the election.

para_P.title: Are both of the following events going to take place: (a) Joe Biden will declare before July 15, 2024, that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination for President, and (b) Will Hurd will not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden make a declaration before July 15, 2024, stating that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

This will be considered Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, and official statement that he will not seek or accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be clear and definitive, leaving no possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination in the 2024 election cycle. If such an announcement is not made by the deadline, it will be considered No.

(b) Will Will Hurd not be chosen as the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

This will be considered Yes if Will Hurd is not chosen by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If any other candidate is selected, it will be considered Yes. The resolution is based on the choice made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not on who is announced as the nominee on election day.

question.title: Will either Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (1) Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the selection of the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. (2) Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination. If neither of these events occurs, this question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election nor Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will accept the Democratic nomination for President?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs: (1) Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the selection of the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. (2) Joe Biden or his campaign does not make a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that Joe Biden will seek and will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be ambiguous and inconclusive, leaving room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination. If either of these events occurs, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that either Will Hurd becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election or that Joe Biden declares by July 15, 2024, that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination for President?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if at least one of the following takes place: (1) Will Hurd is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is based solely on the votes of the delegates at the Republican National Convention, irrespective of who is named the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election. (2) Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, and official statement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, indicating that Joe Biden will not run for and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be clear and definitive, allowing no possibility that Biden would agree to accept the nomination. If neither of these scenarios occurs, this question will conclude with **No**.

question.title: Will Georgia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Georgia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For any other outcome, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Georgia not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Georgia does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For any other outcome, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Georgia going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if Georgia takes part in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a place in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Any other result will lead to a resolution of **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur in Eurovision 2024: (a) Albania qualifies for the Grand Final (b) Georgia fails to qualify for the Grand Final?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Albania participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (2) Georgia does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either condition is not met, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will at least one of the following occur in Eurovision 2024: (a) Albania does not qualify for the Grand Final (b) Georgia qualifies for the Grand Final?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if at least one of the following conditions is met: (1) Albania does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (2) Georgia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If both conditions are met, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it true that in Eurovision 2024, (a) Albania will make it to the Grand Final and (b) Georgia will not make it to the Grand Final?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if the following two criteria are satisfied: (1) Albania competes in a Semi-final and is confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (2) Georgia either does not compete in a Semi-final or is not confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either of these criteria is not fulfilled, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will either Georgia or Albania qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either (a) Georgia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) Albania participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. The question will resolve as **No** if neither Georgia nor Albania qualify for the Grand Final.

not_P.title: Will neither Georgia nor Albania qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither (a) Georgia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, nor (b) Albania participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. The question will resolve as **No** if either Georgia or Albania qualify for the Grand Final.

para_P.title: Will Georgia or Albania make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if either (a) Georgia competes in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) Albania competes in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the EBU as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. The inquiry will be deemed **No** if neither Georgia nor Albania makes it to the Grand Final.

question.title: Will Meta publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, Meta publishes a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

not_P.title: Will Meta not publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, Meta does not publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

para_P.title: Is it expected that Meta will release a public report detailing the findings from an external evaluation of their models' safety by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, Meta issues a *public* report that presents the outcomes from an *external* assessment of the safety of one of their AI models.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) the linked market gets at least 377 traders by end of July 15, 2023, and (b) Meta does not publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body: (a) The market embedded at https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g resolves YES if it has 377 traders before market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time, 2023). Resolves NO otherwise. (b) This question resolves as YES if, by June 30, 2024, Meta does not publish a public report with the results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

not_P.title: Will at least one of the following not occur: (a) the linked market gets at least 377 traders by end of July 15, 2023, or (b) Meta publishes a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
not_P.body: (a) The market embedded at https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g resolves NO if it does not have 377 traders before market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time, 2023). Resolves YES otherwise. (b) This question resolves as NO if, by June 30, 2024, Meta publishes a public report with the results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) the linked market will reach a minimum of 377 traders by the end of July 15, 2023, and (b) Meta will not release a report detailing the outcomes of external safety assessments of their models by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body: (a) The market found at https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g will resolve to YES if it achieves 377 traders before the market closes (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time, 2023). It will resolve to NO if it does not. (b) This question will be considered YES if, by June 30, 2024, Meta has not made a public report available that includes the findings from an external evaluation of the safety of one of their AI models.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Meta publishes a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024, or (b) the linked market gets at least 377 traders by the end of July 15, 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, Meta publishes a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

(b) Resolves YES if the market embedded at https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g has 377 traders before market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). Resolves NO otherwise.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Meta does not publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024, nor (b) the linked market gets fewer than 377 traders by the end of July 15, 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) This question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, Meta does not publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

(b) Resolves YES if the market embedded at https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g has fewer than 377 traders before market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: Is it possible that either (a) Meta releases a public report detailing findings from independent red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024, or (b) the specified market reaches a minimum of 377 traders by the conclusion of July 15, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This question will be considered **YES** if Meta issues a *public* report by June 30, 2024, showing results from an *external* entity that has red-teamed the safety of one of their AI models.

(b) It will resolve as YES if the market linked at https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g has at least 377 traders before the market closes (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). It will resolve as NO in all other cases.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Donald Trump is removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, and (2) Elon Musk does not show up at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if both of the following conditions are met:

1. On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

2. Elon Musk does not become a guest on the official stage of the Bitcoin Nashville 2024, which is one of the largest Bitcoin conferences, taking place on July 25-27, 2024.

If both conditions are met, the question resolves as "Yes". If either condition is not met, the question resolves as "No".

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (1) Donald Trump is removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, nor (2) Elon Musk shows up at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if neither of the following conditions are met:

1. On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must not be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has not been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

2. Elon Musk does become a guest on the official stage of the Bitcoin Nashville 2024, which is one of the largest Bitcoin conferences, taking place on July 25-27, 2024.

If neither condition is met, the question resolves as "Yes". If either condition is met, the question resolves as "No".

If both criteria are fulfilled, the inquiry resolves as "Yes". If either criterion is not fulfilled, the inquiry resolves as "No".

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

not_P.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain less than 3% among Manifold respondents?
not_P.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error. Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 is less than that in poll 2 by less than 3% when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 < 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Trump competes against Joe Biden rather than a typical Democrat, will he secure at least a 3% increase among Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
Two Manifold polls are available, both closing on July 6. One poll requests Manifold participants to choose Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other asks them to select a typical Democrat on the same hypothetical ballot.

Public opinion surveys regularly indicate Joe Biden trailing Donald Trump outside the margin of error, yet every other Democrat hypothetically polled is either ahead or within the margin of error. Are the Manifold participants reflective of the broader public opinion?

This market will resolve to YES if Donald Trump's vote percentage in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or more at the time both polls close.

To calculate Trump's vote percentage, use the formula (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). The result is YES if the calculation for poll 1 minus the calculation for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the result is NO.

These polls and this inquiry will never be marked as N/A and will stay open until the designated closing time regardless of circumstances.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) At least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th, and (2) Trump gains less than 3% among Manifold respondents facing Biden instead of a generic Democrat?
question.body:
(1) Politico reports that two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out, and two of the most endangered Democrats have written off Biden’s chances to win in November. Behind the scenes, multiple drafts of letters are circulating among House Democrats, with at least one calling on Biden to end his campaign. This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time). The individuals must be part of the same group message, such as signing a letter or collectively asking him to drop out. Reports of unnamed Democrats are insufficient unless at least 5 names are made public. If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

(2) Two Manifold polls posted, closing on July 6, ask respondents to vote with Joe Biden and a generic Democrat on a hypothetical ballot. This market resolves YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 is less than or equal to that in poll 2 by less than 3% when both polls close. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 < 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (1) At least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th, nor (2) Trump gains 3% or more among Manifold respondents facing Biden instead of a generic Democrat?
not_P.body:
(1) Politico reports that two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out, and two of the most endangered Democrats have written off Biden’s chances to win in November. Behind the scenes, multiple drafts of letters are circulating among House Democrats, with at least one calling on Biden to end his campaign. This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators do not work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time). The individuals must be part of the same group message, such as signing a letter or collectively asking him to drop out. Reports of unnamed Democrats are insufficient unless at least 5 names are made public. If these criteria are met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

(2) Two Manifold polls posted, closing on July 6, ask respondents to vote with Joe Biden and a generic Democrat on a hypothetical ballot. This market resolves YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 is greater than or equal to that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of these events happen: (1) A minimum of 5 identified Democratic House Representatives or US Senators persuade Biden to withdraw before July 20th, and (2) Trump receives less than 3% among Manifold participants when matched against Biden rather than a generic Democrat?
para_P.body:
(1) According to Politico, two members from secure districts have already publicly called for Biden to step aside, and two of the most vulnerable Democrats have dismissed Biden’s chances for a November victory. Behind the scenes, various drafts of letters are being circulated among House Democrats, with at least one urging Biden to conclude his campaign. This market will resolve to YES if a coalition of at least five named Democratic US House Members/Senators collectively request Joe Biden to reflect on ending his 2024 re-election bid, or to encourage him to do so, prior to Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time). The individuals must be part of the same communication, such as signing a letter or jointly requesting him to withdraw. Reports of unnamed Democrats are inadequate unless at least five names are disclosed. If these conditions are not fulfilled by July 20th, this market will resolve to NO.

(2) Two Manifold surveys, concluding on July 6, ask participants to indicate their preference between Joe Biden and a generic Democrat on a hypothetical ballot. This market will resolve to YES if the share of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll is less than or equal to that in the second poll by a margin of less than 3% when both polls conclude. The calculation for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if the result of the first poll's formula minus the second poll's formula is less than 0.03. Otherwise, it will be NO.

question.title: Will either Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, or a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
(1) Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents? 
- There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.
- This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.
- The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

(2) Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
- This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).
- This could be by signing a letter or another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.
- The market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.
- Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO.

not_P.title: Will neither Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, nor a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
not_P.body:
(1) Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump not gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents? 
- There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.
- This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 does not exceed that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.
- The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 < 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

(2) Will a group of fewer than 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
- This market resolves YES if a group of fewer than five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).
- This could be by signing a letter or another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.
- The market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.
- Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless fewer than 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving YES.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Trump will increase his support by at least 3% among Manifold participants when compared to Joe Biden rather than a generic Democrat, or that at least five identified Democratic House Members or US Senators will urge Biden to withdraw from the race before July 20th?
para_P.body:
(1) When compared to a generic Democrat, will Trump see an increase of at least 3% in support among Manifold participants facing Joe Biden? 
- There are two Manifold polls that will close on July 6. One poll asks participants to vote for Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and the other asks them to vote for a generic Democrat on a similar ballot.
- This market will resolve to YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll is at least 3% higher than in the second poll when both polls close.
- The calculation for determining Trump's vote percentage is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if the result of this calculation for poll 1 minus that for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the answer is NO.

(2) Will a coalition of at least five identified Democratic House Members or US Senators press Biden to withdraw from the race prior to July 20th? 
- This market will resolve to YES if at least five named Democratic US House Members or Senators collaborate to request that Joe Biden considers stepping back from his 2024 re-election campaign, or actively encourage him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).
- This could occur through a signed letter or a group discussion with Biden where they collectively ask him to withdraw.
- The market stipulates that all five individuals must be part of the same collective communication. If five individuals independently express to reporters that they believe Biden should step aside, it will not be sufficient for a YES resolution.
- Any reports regarding unnamed Democrats requesting Biden to step down will not meet the criteria of this market unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed before the market's closing date. In any unclear situations where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond reasonable doubt, this market will tend to resolve to NO.

question.title: Will the Philadelphia 76ers win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
The question resolves **Yes** if the Philadelphia 76ers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). 

It resolves **No** for all other teams as they are eliminated from contention.

not_P.title: Will the Philadelphia 76ers not win the 2024 NBA Finals?
not_P.body:
The question resolves **Yes** if the Philadelphia 76ers are not crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). 

It resolves **No** for all other teams as they remain in contention.

para_P.title: Are the Philadelphia 76ers going to be the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will resolve to **Yes** if the Philadelphia 76ers are declared the winners of the 2024 NBA Finals, based on [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). 

It will resolve to **No** if any other team is the champion, as they will be out of the running.

question.title: Will the Orlando Magic win and the Philadelphia 76ers not win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following occur: (a) The Orlando Magic are crowned the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). (b) The Philadelphia 76ers are not crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** if either the Orlando Magic do not win or the Philadelphia 76ers win the 2024 NBA Finals.

not_P.title: Will the Orlando Magic not win or the Philadelphia 76ers win the 2024 NBA Finals?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) The Orlando Magic are not crowned the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). (b) The Philadelphia 76ers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** if both the Orlando Magic win and the Philadelphia 76ers do not win the 2024 NBA Finals.

para_P.title: Will the Orlando Magic be the champions while the Philadelphia 76ers are not in the 2024 NBA Finals?
para_P.body: This inquiry resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) The Orlando Magic are declared the winners of the 2024 NBA Finals, as stated by [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). (b) The Philadelphia 76ers are not declared the winners of the 2024 NBA Finals, as stated by [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** if either the Orlando Magic do not emerge victorious or the Philadelphia 76ers win the 2024 NBA Finals.

question.title: Will either the Philadelphia 76ers or the Orlando Magic win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if either the Philadelphia 76ers or the Orlando Magic are crowned the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves **No** if neither team wins the Finals, as they are eliminated from contention.

not_P.title: Will neither the Philadelphia 76ers nor the Orlando Magic win the 2024 NBA Finals?
not_P.body: This question resolves **Yes** if neither the Philadelphia 76ers nor the Orlando Magic are crowned the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves **No** if either team wins the Finals, as they are still in contention.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the Philadelphia 76ers or the Orlando Magic to secure victory in the 2024 NBA Finals?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if either the Philadelphia 76ers or the Orlando Magic are declared the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals, as per [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It will result in a **No** if neither team claims the title, as they would be out of the race.

question.title: Will Fidesz-KDNP Maintain Its EU Plurality from Hungary in 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve to "Yes" if, following the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP alliance secures more seats than any other single party or coalition, thereby maintaining the highest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, according to credible sources.

not_P.title: Will Fidesz-KDNP Not Maintain Its EU Plurality from Hungary in 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve to "Yes" if, following the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP alliance does not secure more seats than any other single party or coalition, thereby not maintaining the highest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, according to credible sources.

para_P.title: Will Fidesz-KDNP Retain Its Majority in the EU from Hungary in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a "Yes" if, after the European Parliament elections in 2024, the Fidesz-KDNP coalition obtains a greater number of seats than any other individual party or alliance, thus preserving the largest share of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, based on reliable information.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The European Union announces new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024, and (b) Fidesz-KDNP fails to maintain its EU plurality from Hungary in 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced new tariffs or duties that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU, and (b) Following the 2024 European Parliament elections, credible sources report that the Fidesz-KDNP alliance does not secure more seats than any other single party or coalition, thereby failing to maintain the highest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) The European Union does not announce new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024, nor (b) Fidesz-KDNP maintains its EU plurality from Hungary in 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following conditions are met: (a) Before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has not announced new tariffs or duties that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU, and (b) Following the 2024 European Parliament elections, credible sources report that the Fidesz-KDNP alliance secures more seats than any other single party or coalition, thereby maintaining the highest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) The European Union will declare new tariffs or duties on the importation of Chinese electric vehicles prior to July 5, 2024, and (b) Fidesz-KDNP will not retain its plurality in the EU from Hungary in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (a) Prior to July 5, 2024, reliable sources indicate that the European Union (EU) has declared new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU, and (b) After the 2024 European Parliament elections, reliable sources indicate that the Fidesz-KDNP alliance does not achieve more seats than any other individual party or coalition, thus failing to hold the largest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Fidesz-KDNP maintains its EU plurality from Hungary in 2024, or (b) the EU announces new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve to "Yes" if either of the following occurs: (a) Following the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP alliance secures more seats than any other single party or coalition, thereby maintaining the highest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, according to credible sources. (b) Before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Fidesz-KDNP maintains its EU plurality from Hungary in 2024, nor (b) the EU announces new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve to "Yes" if neither of the following occurs: (a) Following the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP alliance secures more seats than any other single party or coalition, thereby maintaining the highest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, according to credible sources. (b) Before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following happens: (a) Fidesz-KDNP retains its position as the largest Hungarian party in the EU in 2024, or (b) the EU declares new tariffs on electric vehicles from China prior to July 5, 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with "Yes" if one of the following takes place: (a) After the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP coalition obtains more seats than any other individual party or coalition, thus keeping the most Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, based on reliable information. (b) Before July 5, 2024, reliable sources indicate that the European Union (EU) has revealed plans to impose new tariffs or duties on imports of electric vehicles from China into the EU.

question.title: Will Disney announce a new Moana ride for Magic Kingdon at D23 2024?
question.body: This will resolve YES if Disney announces a new Moana-themed ride for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida at or before the D23 convention in August 2024. It will resolve NO if it is discussed in a "spitballing ideas" sense similar to the way that some attractions were discussed at the previous D23. It will resolve NO if a Moana ride is announced for a different theme park in Florida or elsewhere. Betting closes on August 8, the day before the convention. It will be resolved after the convention.

not_P.title: Will Disney not announce a new Moana ride for Magic Kingdom at D23 2024?
not_P.body: This will resolve YES if Disney does not announce a new Moana-themed ride for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida at or before the D23 convention in August 2024. It will resolve NO if it is discussed in a "spitballing ideas" sense similar to the way that some attractions were discussed at the previous D23. It will resolve NO if a Moana ride is announced for a different theme park in Florida or elsewhere. Betting closes on August 8, the day before the convention. It will be resolved after the convention.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Disney will reveal a new Moana attraction for Magic Kingdom during D23 2024?
para_P.body: This will be marked as YES if Disney unveils a new Moana-themed attraction for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida at or prior to the D23 convention in August 2024. It will be marked as NO if it is mentioned in a brainstorming context similar to how some attractions were talked about at the last D23. It will also be marked as NO if a Moana attraction is announced for a different theme park in Florida or in another location. Betting will close on August 8, the day before the convention, and the outcome will be determined after the convention.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Will Deadpool & Wolverine have biggest opening weekend ever for R-rated movie? (2) Will Disney not announce a new Moana ride for Magic Kingdom at D23 2024?
question.body:
(1) Analysts are projecting a huge opening weekend for "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie. The film, directed by Shawn Levy and starring Ryan Reynolds, is projected to earn between $340 million and $360 million globally in its opening weekend. This would mark the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie. Domestically, the film is expected to debut with $160 million to $170 million, making it the biggest R-rated opening of all-time. The record for biggest opening weekend for an R-rated movie is the original Deadpool at $284.5M ($152.2M domestic). This market will resolve YES if Deadpool x Wolverine grosses more than $284.5M globally this opening weekend according to reports AND the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) reports it as the record for an R-rated movie release.

(2) This will resolve YES if Disney does not announce a new Moana-themed ride for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida at or before the D23 convention in August 2024. It will resolve NO if Disney announces a new Moana-themed ride for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida at or before the D23 convention in August 2024. It will resolve NO if it is discussed in a "spitballing ideas" sense similar to the way that some attractions were discussed at the previous D23. It will resolve NO if a Moana ride is announced for a different theme park in Florida or elsewhere. Betting closes on August 8, the day before the convention. It will be resolved after the convention.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (1) Will Deadpool & Wolverine not have the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie? (2) Will Disney announce a new Moana ride for Magic Kingdom at D23 2024?
not_P.body:
(1) Analysts are projecting a huge opening weekend for "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie. The film, directed by Shawn Levy and starring Ryan Reynolds, is projected to earn between $340 million and $360 million globally in its opening weekend. This would mark the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie. Domestically, the film is expected to debut with $160 million to $170 million, making it the biggest R-rated opening of all-time. The record for biggest opening weekend for an R-rated movie is the original Deadpool at $284.5M ($152.2M domestic). This market will resolve YES if Deadpool x Wolverine grosses more than $284.5M globally this opening weekend according to reports AND the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) reports it as the record for an R-rated movie release.

(2) This will resolve YES if Disney announces a new Moana-themed ride for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida at or before the D23 convention in August 2024. It will resolve NO if Disney does not announce a new Moana-themed ride for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida at or before the D23 convention in August 2024. It will resolve NO if it is discussed in a "spitballing ideas" sense similar to the way that some attractions were discussed at the previous D23. It will resolve NO if a Moana ride is announced for a different theme park in Florida or elsewhere. Betting closes on August 8, the day before the convention. It will be resolved after the convention.

para_P.title: Are both of these events going to take place: (1) Will the Deadpool & Wolverine film achieve the highest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie? (2) Will Disney refrain from revealing a new Moana attraction for Magic Kingdom during D23 2024?
para_P.body:
(1) Experts are forecasting a massive opening weekend for the "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover film. Directed by Shawn Levy and featuring Ryan Reynolds, the movie is anticipated to earn between $340 million and $360 million worldwide in its debut weekend. This would set a new record for the largest opening weekend for any R-rated film. In the U.S., the film is predicted to open with $160 million to $170 million, which would make it the highest R-rated opening of all time. The current record for the largest opening weekend for an R-rated film is held by the original Deadpool at $284.5 million ($152.2 million domestically). This market will resolve YES if Deadpool x Wolverine surpasses $284.5 million globally during its opening weekend according to reports AND if the Hollywood Reporter (or an equivalent publication) confirms it as the record for an R-rated film release.

(2) This will resolve YES if Disney does not unveil a new Moana-themed attraction for the Magic Kingdom in Florida at or before the D23 convention in August 2024. It will resolve NO if Disney announces a new Moana-themed attraction for the Magic Kingdom in Florida at or before the D23 convention in August 2024. It will also resolve NO if it is mentioned in a speculative discussion similar to how some attractions were talked about at the last D23. It will resolve NO if a Moana ride is announced for a different theme park in Florida or another location. Betting will close on August 8, the day prior to the convention, and the resolution will occur after the convention.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Disney announce a new Moana ride for Magic Kingdom at D23 2024, (b) Deadpool & Wolverine have the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie?
question.body:
(a) Disney announces a new Moana-themed ride for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida at or before the D23 convention in August 2024. This will resolve YES if such an announcement is made and NO if it is merely discussed as a potential idea or if a Moana ride is announced for a different park. Betting closes on August 8, 2024, and resolution will occur after the convention.

(b) The "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie grosses more than $284.5 million globally in its opening weekend and is reported by the Hollywood Reporter or an equivalent publication as the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie. The film must surpass the previous record set by the original Deadpool, which was $284.5 million globally.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Disney not announce a new Moana ride for Magic Kingdom at D23 2024, (b) Deadpool & Wolverine not have the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie?
not_P.body:
(a) Disney does not announce a new Moana-themed ride for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida at or before the D23 convention in August 2024. This will resolve YES if no such announcement is made and NO if it is merely discussed as a potential idea or if a Moana ride is announced for a different park. Betting closes on August 8, 2024, and resolution will occur after the convention.

(b) The "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie does not gross more than $284.5 million globally in its opening weekend and is not reported by the Hollywood Reporter or an equivalent publication as the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie. The film must not surpass the previous record set by the original Deadpool, which was $284.5 million globally.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that either of the following will take place: (a) Disney unveils a new Moana attraction at Magic Kingdom during D23 2024, (b) Deadpool & Wolverine achieve the highest opening weekend ever for an R-rated film?
para_P.body:
(a) Disney reveals a new ride themed around Moana for the Magic Kingdom in Florida at or prior to the D23 event in August 2024. This will be marked as YES if such a revelation occurs and NO if it is only mentioned as a possible concept or if a Moana ride is introduced at another park. Betting will conclude on August 8, 2024, with resolution following the convention.

(b) The "Deadpool x Wolverine" film earns over $284.5 million worldwide in its opening weekend and is reported by the Hollywood Reporter or a similar outlet as the highest opening weekend ever for an R-rated film. The movie must exceed the former record held by the original Deadpool, which was $284.5 million globally.

question.title: Will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

not_P.title: Will Biden not drop out before July 20?
not_P.body: If Biden does not drop out and is able to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

para_P.title: Is it possible for Biden to withdraw from the race before July 20?
para_P.body: Should Biden choose to withdraw or become incapable of continuing his campaign prior to midnight Eastern Time on July 20, this market will conclude with a yes. If not, the market will conclude with a no.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Mike Pence is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) Biden does not drop out before July 20?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Mike Pence is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (2) Biden does not drop out and is able to continue the race until after July 20 midnight Eastern Time. If either condition fails, this question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will either of the following not occur: (a) Mike Pence is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or (b) Biden drops out before July 20?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following conditions are met: (1) Mike Pence is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (2) Biden drops out and is unable to continue the race until after July 20 midnight Eastern Time. If both conditions are met, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Are both of these events going to happen: (a) Mike Pence becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) Biden remains in the race until after July 20?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (1) Mike Pence is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (2) Biden does not withdraw and is able to continue competing until after midnight Eastern Time on July 20. If either of these criteria is not met, the inquiry will be evaluated as **No**.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Biden drops out before July 20, 2024, or (b) Mike Pence is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: (a) Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20, 2024, midnight Eastern Time. (b) Mike Pence is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the nomination on the day of the election.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Biden does not drop out before July 20, 2024, and (b) Mike Pence is not the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body: (a) Biden does not drop out or is otherwise able to continue the race before July 20, 2024, midnight Eastern Time. (b) Mike Pence is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is not selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who does not receive the nomination on the day of the election.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following will happen: (a) Biden withdraws from the race prior to July 20, 2024, or (b) Mike Pence becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body: (a) Biden withdraws or is otherwise unable to pursue the election before July 20, 2024, at midnight Eastern Time. (b) Mike Pence is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This selection is based on the decision made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, rather than the person who is nominated on election day.

question.title: Will Poland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Poland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Poland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Poland not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Poland does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Poland qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Poland set to make it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Poland takes part in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. Conversely, if Poland fails to qualify, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Will Denmark qualify and Poland fail to qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following occur: (1) Denmark participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (2) Poland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as not having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Denmark does not qualify or Poland qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Denmark not qualify or Poland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (1) Denmark does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (2) Poland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If both Denmark qualifies and Poland fails to qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Denmark succeed in qualifying while Poland does not for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
