para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Denmark competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a place in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (2) Poland competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as not having secured a place in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Denmark fails to qualify or Poland qualifies, the inquiry will be considered **No**.

question.title: Will either Poland or Denmark qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Poland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (b) Denmark participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Poland nor Denmark qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither Poland nor Denmark qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs: (a) Poland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (b) Denmark participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Poland or Denmark qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Poland or Denmark make it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if one of the following happens: (a) Poland competes in a Semi-final and is confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. (b) Denmark competes in a Semi-final and is confirmed by the EBU as having advanced to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. If neither Poland nor Denmark advances, the inquiry will be marked as **No**.

question.title: Will Belgium qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Belgium participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If not, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Belgium not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Belgium does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If so, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Belgium going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if Belgium competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Otherwise, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will Czechia qualify and Belgium fail to qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following occur: (a) Czechia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Belgium participates in a Semi-final and is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Czechia does not qualify or Belgium qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Czechia not qualify or Belgium qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Czechia does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) Belgium participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If both Czechia qualifies and Belgium fails to qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Czechia advance while Belgium does not make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Czechia takes part in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Belgium competes in a Semi-final and is not confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Czechia fails to advance or Belgium qualifies, the inquiry will be deemed **No**.

question.title: Will either Belgium or Czechia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if at least one of the following occurs: (a) Belgium participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) Czechia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Belgium nor Czechia qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither Belgium nor Czechia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs: (a) Belgium participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) Czechia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If at least one of Belgium or Czechia qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is there a chance that either Belgium or Czechia will make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if at least one of the following happens: (a) Belgium competes in a Semi-final and is officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) Czechia competes in a Semi-final and is officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If both Belgium and Czechia fail to qualify, the inquiry will be considered **No**.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden exceed 2 but not surpass 3, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden according to 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a Trump advantage, whereas a negative figure signifies Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which translates to a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Nvidia's market cap is larger than Apple's on June 28, 2024 (b) Trump's lead over Biden is <= 2 or > 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538?
question.body:
(a) This question resolves **Yes** if, on June 28, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to [Companies Market Cap](https://companiesmarketcap.com/), when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

(b) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. The condition is satisfied if Trump's lead is less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Nvidia's market cap is larger than Apple's on June 28, 2024 (b) Trump's lead over Biden is > 2 and <= 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538?
not_P.body:
(a) This question resolves **Yes** if, on June 28, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is not greater than that of Apple, according to [Companies Market Cap](https://companiesmarketcap.com/), when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

(b) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. The condition is satisfied if Trump's lead is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3.

para_P.title: Will both of the following take place: (a) Nvidia's market capitalization exceeds that of Apple on June 28, 2024 (b) Trump's advantage over Biden is <= 2 or > 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will resolve as **Yes** if, on June 28, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization is higher than Apple's, as per [Companies Market Cap](https://companiesmarketcap.com/), when verified by Metaculus around 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

(b) This inquiry will resolve based on Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For this question, a positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure signifies Biden is ahead. The condition is met if Trump's lead is either less than or equal to 2 or exceeds 3.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? (b) On June 28th, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization be larger than Apple's?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

(b) This question resolves **Yes** if, on June 28, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to [Companies Market Cap](https://companiesmarketcap.com/), when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 or less than or equal to 2 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? (b) On June 28th, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization be smaller than or equal to Apple's?
not_P.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

(b) This question resolves **Yes** if, on June 28, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is smaller than or equal to that of Apple, according to [Companies Market Cap](https://companiesmarketcap.com/), when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

para_P.title: Is it possible for one of the following scenarios to take place: (a) On July 15, 2024, will Trump's advantage over Biden exceed 2 but not surpass 3 according to the national polling average from 538? (b) Will Nvidia's market valuation on June 28, 2024, outstrip that of Apple?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be considered resolved if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in the 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For this question, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure indicates Biden is ahead. For instance, if the reported value on July 5, 2024, shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, this would count as a positive 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

(b) This question will be marked **Yes** if, as of June 28, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization is higher than Apple's, based on data from [Companies Market Cap](https://companiesmarketcap.com/), when verified by Metaculus around 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

question.title: Will Czechia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Czechia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Czechia does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Czechia not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Czechia does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Czechia qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible for Czechia to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if Czechia takes part in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if Czechia does not advance, the inquiry will be deemed **No**.

question.title: Will Azerbaijan qualify and Czechia fail to qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following occur: (a) Azerbaijan participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Czechia either does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Azerbaijan does not qualify or Czechia qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Azerbaijan not qualify or Czechia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Azerbaijan does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) Czechia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If both Azerbaijan qualifies and Czechia does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible for Azerbaijan to make it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024 while Czechia does not?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Azerbaijan takes part in a Semi-final and is confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Czechia either does not enter a Semi-final or is not confirmed by the EBU as qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Azerbaijan fails to qualify or if Czechia qualifies, the inquiry will result in **No**.

question.title: Will either Czechia or Azerbaijan qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Czechia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) Azerbaijan participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Czechia nor Azerbaijan qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither Czechia nor Azerbaijan qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs: (a) Czechia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) Azerbaijan participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Czechia or Azerbaijan qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Are Czechia or Azerbaijan set to reach the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if one of the following happens: (a) Czechia competes in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) Azerbaijan competes in a Semi-final and is then confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Czechia nor Azerbaijan advances, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Trump's advantage over Biden exceed 2 but not surpass 3 based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as indicated on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure denotes a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure indicates that Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be interpreted as a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024, and (b) Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
(a) This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

(b) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024, nor (b) Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
(a) This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, there are no credible reports indicating that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

(b) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is not Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden.

para_P.title: Will both of the following happen: (a) Israel execute a lethal strike within Iran prior to May 1, 2024, and (b) Trump's advantage over Biden be 2 or fewer or exceed 3 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will resolve **Yes** if, after the publication date of this question and before May 1, 2024, credible reports suggest that an attack linked to Israel occurring within the borders of Iran has resulted in the deaths of at least five people.

(b) This question will resolve based on Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as documented on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. In this context, a positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure indicates Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure is Trump 2.4 points in front of Biden, which would be considered a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? (b) Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

(b) This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? (b) Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

(b) This question resolves **No** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

para_P.title: Is it possible for either of the following to take place: (a) On July 15, 2024, will Trump's advantage over Biden be more than 2 but not exceeding 3 according to 538's national polling average? (b) Will Israel execute a lethal strike inside Iran prior to May 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be resolved based on Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For this question, a positive figure indicates a Trump lead, whereas a negative figure indicates Biden is in the lead. For instance, as of July 5, 2024, the reported value for that date shows Trump ahead by 2.4 points, which would count as a positive value of 2.4 for this question.

(b) This question will be marked **Yes** if, after the publication of this question and before May 1, 2024, credible sources report that an assault linked to Israel has occurred within the territory of Iran and resulted in the deaths of at least five people.

question.title: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate being selected will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Tucker Carlson not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If Tucker Carlson is selected, this question will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Tucker Carlson going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is chosen by the Republican National Convention to be the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other individual being chosen will result in a resolution of **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently acknowledged; additional options may emerge in the future.

For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who secures the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; the determination is exclusively based on who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election and Tucker Carlson not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following occur: (a) credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled. (b) Tucker Carlson is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Tucker Carlson being selected as the nominee will resolve as No. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

not_P.title: Will the Republican Party not retain Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election or Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if either of the following occurs: (a) no credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled. (b) Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Tucker Carlson not being selected as the nominee will resolve as No. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: Will Ohio's 6th congressional district remain under Republican control in the special election of 2024, and will Tucker Carlson not be the Republican candidate for the 2024 Presidential Election?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if both of the following conditions are satisfied: (a) reliable sources indicate that a representative of the Republican Party has emerged victorious in the special election for Ohio's 6th district. In case of conflicting reports from popular sources, an official statement or source from Ohio will be utilized. If no election occurs prior to January 1, 2025, this question will be rendered void. (b) Tucker Carlson is not chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If Tucker Carlson is chosen as the candidate, this question will be deemed negative. This question is open to candidates not currently listed; additional candidates may be introduced later. For the purposes of this inquiry, the identity of the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election is not pertinent; the determination is based solely on who is selected by the delegates at the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election (b) The Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate being selected will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(b) This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election (b) The Republican Party fail to retain Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
not_P.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If he is selected, it will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

(b) This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that no person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If an election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following will happen: (a) Tucker Carlson becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election (b) The Republican Party holds onto Ohio's 6th congressional district in the special election of 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If any other individual is chosen, it will resolve as **No**. This question is not limited to the currently listed candidates; additional options may be introduced later.

For this question, the identity of the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election is irrelevant; it is exclusively determined by who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(b) This question will resolve as Yes if reliable sources indicate that a candidate representing the Republican Party has succeeded in the special election for Ohio's 6th district. If there is a discrepancy among popular sources, an Ohio State source or statement will be referenced. If no election occurs before January 1, 2025, the question will be void.

question.title: Will the Indiana Pacers win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
The question resolves as **Yes** if the Indiana Pacers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). 

It resolves as **No** for all other teams as they are eliminated from contention.

not_P.title: Will the Indiana Pacers not win the 2024 NBA Finals?
not_P.body:
The question resolves as **Yes** if the Indiana Pacers are not crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). 

It resolves as **No** for all other teams if the Indiana Pacers are crowned the champion.

para_P.title: Are the Indiana Pacers going to be the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals?
para_P.body:
The resolution will be **Yes** if the Indiana Pacers are declared the winner of the 2024 NBA Finals, based on [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). 

It will be **No** for any other teams as they will not be in the running.

question.title: Will the Los Angeles Clippers win the 2024 NBA Finals and the Indiana Pacers not win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
The question resolves as Yes if both of the following occur: (a) The Los Angeles Clippers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). (b) The Indiana Pacers do not win the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). 

It resolves as No if either the Los Angeles Clippers do not win the 2024 NBA Finals or the Indiana Pacers win the 2024 NBA Finals.

not_P.title: Will the Los Angeles Clippers not win the 2024 NBA Finals or the Indiana Pacers win the 2024 NBA Finals?
not_P.body:
The question resolves as Yes if either of the following occur: (a) The Los Angeles Clippers are not crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). (b) The Indiana Pacers win the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). 

It resolves as No if both the Los Angeles Clippers win the 2024 NBA Finals and the Indiana Pacers do not win the 2024 NBA Finals.

para_P.title: Will the Los Angeles Clippers be the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals while the Indiana Pacers fail to secure the title?
para_P.body:
This question is answered with Yes if both of the following conditions are met: (a) The Los Angeles Clippers are declared the winners of the 2024 NBA Finals, as per [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). (b) The Indiana Pacers do not emerge victorious in the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). 

It is answered with No if either the Los Angeles Clippers do not triumph in the 2024 NBA Finals or the Indiana Pacers achieve victory in the 2024 NBA Finals.

question.title: Will either the Indiana Pacers or the Los Angeles Clippers win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
The question resolves as **Yes** if either the Indiana Pacers or the Los Angeles Clippers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). 

It resolves as **No** if neither team wins the championship.

not_P.title: Will neither the Indiana Pacers nor the Los Angeles Clippers win the 2024 NBA Finals?
not_P.body:
The question resolves as **Yes** if neither the Indiana Pacers nor the Los Angeles Clippers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). 

It resolves as **No** if either team wins the championship.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the Indiana Pacers or the Los Angeles Clippers to become champions in the 2024 NBA Finals?
para_P.body:
The resolution is **Yes** if either the Indiana Pacers or the Los Angeles Clippers are declared the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals, based on information from [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). 

It resolves as **No** if both teams fail to secure the championship.

question.title:
Will the  CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS)	
 be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

not_P.title: Will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) be lower Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be less than or equal to the reported number on July 20, 2023.

para_P.title: Will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) increase compared to the previous year on July 20, 2024?
para_P.body: The resolution of this inquiry will depend on the data provided by the St. Louis Fed at this link: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The value recorded on July 20, 2024 must exceed the value recorded on July 20, 2023.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Israel carries out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024, and (2) the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) is not higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
question.body:
(1) This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

(2) This question resolves **Yes** if the reported number for the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) on July 20, 2024, is less than or equal to the reported number on July 20, 2023, based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS.

not_P.title: Will at least one of the following occur: (1) Israel does not carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024, or (2) the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) is higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
not_P.body:
(1) This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, there are no credible reports indicating that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

(2) This question resolves **Yes** if the reported number for the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) on July 20, 2024, is greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023, based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (1) Israel executes a lethal assault inside Iran before May 1, 2024, and (2) the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) does not exceed its Year-over-Year value on July 20, 2024?
para_P.body:
(1) This inquiry resolves **Yes** if, after the publication date of this question and prior to May 1, 2024, reliable sources confirm that an offensive attributed to Israel has occurred within the territory of Iran, resulting in the fatalities of at least five people.

(2) This inquiry resolves **Yes** if the value reported for the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) on July 20, 2024, is less than or equal to the value reported on July 20, 2023, according to data from the St. Louis Fed available here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024? (b) Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

(b) This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024 nor (b) Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) This question will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must not be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

(b) This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, there are no credible reports indicating that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that one of the following will happen: (a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will exceed its Year-over-Year value on July 20, 2024? (b) Israel will execute a lethal strike inside Iran prior to May 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be resolved based on data from the St. Louis Fed found here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The value reported for July 20, 2024 must surpass the value reported on July 20, 2023.

(b) This question will be answered **Yes** if, after the publication date of this question and before May 1, 2024, reliable reports confirm that an attack linked to Israel occurring within the territory of Iran has resulted in the deaths of at least five people.

question.title: Will "Twisters" (2024) have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 75%? ("Certified Fresh")
question.body:
"Twisters" (2024) Rotten Tomatoes page

This resolves YES if the Tomatometer score is 75% or higher, one week after release (July 26th). 

Details 

I will use whatever precision is listed by Rotten Tomatoes (typically an integer percentage, no decimal).

For example, the original "Twister" (1996) currently has a Tomatometer of 63%. This is the equivalent score I will use.

"Certified Fresh" is just used for illustrative purposes (AFAIK, it requires >=75% Tomatometer, but there might be other restrictions—the market resolves solely based on the displayed score).

"Twisters" (2024) is a standalone sequel to the 1996 original, directed by Lee Isaac Chung ("Minari"), starring Glen Powell ("Top Gun: Maverick") and Daisy Edgar Jones ("Normal People").

question.title: Will Nikki Haley be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Nikki Haley not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Nikki Haley is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If she is selected, this question will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Nikki Haley going to be the chosen candidate for the Republican Party in the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if Nikki Haley is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be deemed **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently mentioned; additional options may be introduced later.

For the purposes of this question, it does not matter who secures the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively based on who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Joe Biden still be president by the end of July 2024, and will Nikki Haley not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) At 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024, Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States. (2) Nikki Haley is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It does not matter who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden not be president by the end of July 2024, or will Nikki Haley be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if at least one of the following conditions is met: (1) At 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024, Joe Biden is not officially president of the United States. (2) Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It does not matter who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: By the conclusion of July 2024, will Joe Biden remain the president, and will Nikki Haley not be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered as **Yes** if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (1) At 11:59 pm on July 31, 2024, Joe Biden is still the official president of the United States. (2) Nikki Haley is not chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The identity of the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election is irrelevant; it is determined solely by the selection made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will either Nikki Haley be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or Joe Biden still be president by the end of July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

(a) Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), not by who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024.

not_P.title: Will neither Nikki Haley be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election nor Joe Biden still be president by the end of July 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs:

(a) Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), not by who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024.

para_P.title: By the conclusion of July 2024, will either Nikki Haley be the chosen Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election or will Joe Biden continue to hold the presidency?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if at least one of the following takes place:

(a) Nikki Haley is chosen as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election by the Republican National Convention. This decision is made based on the selection by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), rather than who is named the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) Joe Biden remains the official president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

not_P.title: Will Greens–EFA not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group does not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **No**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Will the Greens–EFA group secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political faction secures the highest number of seats post the 2024 European Parliament elections, and it will be a **No** for any other result. In the event that two groups have an equal number of seats, both sub-questions will be resolved as **Yes**.

The resolution of this question will be based on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable news sources.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024, and (b) Greens–EFA not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
(a) The question resolves as **YES** if ChatGPT is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise. "Generally available" means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries, or unavailable to certain groups, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for interacting with GPT models, still resolving positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same.

(b) This question resolves as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group does not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. If two groups are tied for seats, this question resolves as **No**. This resolves based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024, nor (b) Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
not_P.body:
(a) The question resolves as **YES** if ChatGPT is not generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise. "Generally available" means that the default state for people in the EU is that they cannot access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If available in certain EU countries, or available to certain groups, this will still resolve negatively, assuming at most ≤50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for interacting with GPT models, still resolving negatively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is not substantially the same.

(b) This question resolves as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. If two groups are tied for seats, this question resolves as **Yes**. This resolves based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) OpenAI's ChatGPT becomes widely accessible in the European Union by June 30, 2024, and (b) the Greens–EFA fail to secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
(a) The query will be answered with **YES** if ChatGPT is widely accessible in the EU by June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise. "Widely accessible" implies that the standard condition for individuals in the EU is that they can utilize it without a VPN (potentially requiring payment). If it is not available in specific EU nations, or to certain demographics, it will still be considered positively, provided that more than 50% of the population can access it. "ChatGPT" denotes the overall web platform for engaging with GPT models, and it will still be deemed positively even if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same.

(b) This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political faction does not possess the greatest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. If there is a tie in the number of seats between two groups, this question will resolve as **No**. The resolution will depend on official announcements from the European Parliament or reliable media coverage.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either (a) the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, or (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024. 

For (a), the question resolves as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, this will resolve as **Yes**. This resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

For (b), the question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise. "Generally available" means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries, or unavailable to minors, it will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. It still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither (a) the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, nor (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024. 

For (a), the question resolves as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group does not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, and as **No** if they do hold the most seats. If two groups are tied for seats, this will resolve as **No**. This resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

For (b), the question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is not generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise. "Generally available" means that the default state for people in the EU is that they cannot access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If available in certain EU countries, or available to minors, it will still resolve negatively, assuming at least >50% of the population cannot use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. It still resolves negatively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Is it possible that either of the following happens: (a) the Greens–EFA secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, or (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT becomes widely accessible in the European Union by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if either (a) the Greens–EFA political group secures the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, or (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT is widely accessible in the EU by June 30, 2024. 

For (a), the inquiry resolves as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group secures the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, and as **No** for all other scenarios. In the event of a tie between two groups for seats, this will resolve as **Yes**. This determination is based on [official statements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable media reports.

For (b), the inquiry resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is widely accessible in the EU by June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise. "Widely accessible" means that the default situation for individuals in the EU is that they can access it without using a VPN (possibly requiring payment). If it is not available in specific EU countries, or not accessible to minors, it will still resolve positively, provided that more than 50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. It will still resolve positively if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains largely the same (entering queries into systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

Multiple such letters with a combined total of fewer than 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democratic members from the House or Senate endorse a public statement against the proposal to nominate Biden ahead of schedule?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating an initiative to publicly oppose their party’s attempt to expedite President Joe Biden’s nomination, which they claim suppresses the critical ongoing discussions regarding his candidacy, according to a legislator involved in the initiative.

A letter that has been drafted, shared by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, represents the first public indication from Democrats since the recent assassination attempt on former President Donald Trump that many of their own members are still quite concerned about Biden’s candidacy moving forward.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman stated in an interview. He refrained from confirming the existence of the letter.

This market will resolve to YES if a public statement opposing the early nomination proposal is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators affiliated with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple letters with a total of 20 lawmakers’ endorsements would also suffice to resolve this market to YES. 

If these conditions are not fulfilled by the market close, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Larry Elder will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) fewer than 20 House/Senate Democrats will sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not by who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) A public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by fewer than 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. If these criteria are met by market close, this condition resolves YES; otherwise, it resolves NO.

Both conditions must be satisfied for this question to resolve as **Yes**. If either condition is not met, this question resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Larry Elder will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, nor (b) fewer than 20 House/Senate Democrats will sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if neither of the following conditions are met:

(a) Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not by who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) A public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by 20 or more House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. If these criteria are met by market close, this condition resolves NO; otherwise, it resolves YES.

Neither condition must be satisfied for this question to resolve as **Yes**. If either condition is met, this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Larry Elder becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) less than 20 Democrats in the House or Senate will endorse a public letter against the proposal to nominate Biden early?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **Yes** if both of the following criteria are fulfilled:

(a) Larry Elder is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention and not by who is declared the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) Before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st, fewer than 20 members of the House or Senators who are part of the Democratic Party sign a public letter opposing the early nomination plan. If these conditions are satisfied by the market close, this condition resolves as YES; otherwise, it resolves as NO.

Both criteria must be met for this question to resolve as **Yes**. If either criterion is not met, the question resolves as **No**.
