question.title: Will an athlete win more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

not_P.title: Will no athlete win more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if no athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

para_P.title: Is it possible for an athlete to secure multiple medals in tennis during the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: This question will be answered as **Yes** if any athlete achieves a minimum of two medals in tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

question.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Win ≥21 Gold Medals and No Athlete Win More Than One Medal for Tennis at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves to "Yes" if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games, as verified by the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources. If Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 21 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, this condition resolves immediately to "Yes". (2) No athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics. If both conditions are satisfied, the question resolves to "Yes"; otherwise, it resolves to "No".

not_P.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Win <21 Gold Medals or At Least One Athlete Win More Than One Medal for Tennis at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
not_P.body: This question resolves to "Yes" if either of the following conditions is met: (1) Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win less than 21 gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games, as verified by the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources. If Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won less than 21 gold medals prior to the end of the Games, this condition resolves immediately to "Yes". (2) At least one athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics. If either condition is satisfied, the question resolves to "Yes"; otherwise, it resolves to "No".

para_P.title: Will Neutral Individual Athletes Achieve 21 or More Gold Medals Without Any Athlete Securing More Than One Medal in Tennis at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a "Yes" if the following two criteria are fulfilled: (1) Neutral Individual Athletes collectively earn 21 or more gold medals during the Paris 2024 Olympic Games, as confirmed by the official medal count released by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other reliable sources. If it is established that Neutral Individual Athletes have won at least 21 gold medals before the Games conclude, this condition will instantly resolve to "Yes". (2) No athlete obtains two or more medals in tennis during the 2024 Paris Olympics. If both criteria are met, the question will resolve to "Yes"; if not, it will resolve to "No".

question.title: Will either an athlete win more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics or Individual Neutral Athletes win ≥21 gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics. (b) Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution for (b) will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 21 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

not_P.title: Will neither an athlete win more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics nor Individual Neutral Athletes win ≥21 gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs: (a) Any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics. (b) Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution for (b) will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 21 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "No".

para_P.title: Is it possible for an athlete to secure over one medal in tennis during the 2024 Paris Olympics, or for Individual Neutral Athletes to achieve a total of 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if at least one of the following takes place: (a) Any athlete earns a minimum of two medals in tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics. (b) Individual Neutral Athletes together attain 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The resolution source for (b) will be the official medal count released by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other reliable sources if the IOC's reporting is not available. If it is confirmed that Individual Neutral Athletes have won 21 or more gold medals before the conclusion of the Games, the market will promptly resolve to "Yes".

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be 2 or less, or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but not exceeding 4 based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude based on the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP (2) Trump's lead over Biden is less than or equal to 2 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
(1) Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP. If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to yes. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to no. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

(2) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024, is less than or equal to 2 or greater than 4. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (1) Kamala Harris is not nominated as the Democratic VP (2) Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
(1) Kamala Harris is not nominated as the Democratic VP. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to yes. If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to no. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

(2) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024, is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (1) Kamala Harris gets selected as the Democratic Vice President (2) Trump's advantage over Biden is either 2 points or fewer, or exceeds 4 points on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
(1) Kamala Harris gets selected as the Democratic Vice President. If Kamala Harris is chosen as the Democratic Vice President, this market will conclude with a yes. If a different individual is appointed as VP, this market will conclude with a no. Any changes to the VP after the initial selection will not affect the outcome of this market. The market can conclude right after the selection.

(2) Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024, is either 2 points or fewer, or more than 4 points. For this question, a positive number indicates a Trump lead, while a negative number indicates Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure for that date shows Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would count as a positive figure of 2.4 for the purpose of this question.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, or (b) Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP?
question.body:
(a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average: This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

(b) Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP: If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to yes. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to no. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

not_P.body:
(a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average: This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

(b) Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP: If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to yes. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to no. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following happens: (a) Trump's advantage over Biden exceeds 2 but is at most 4 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average, or (b) Kamala Harris becomes the Vice President for the Democrats?
para_P.body:
(a) Trump's advantage over Biden exceeds 2 but is at most 4 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average: This inquiry will be determined by Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure indicates Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value indicates Trump is 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would count as a positive figure of 2.4 for this inquiry.

(b) Kamala Harris becomes the Vice President for the Democrats: If Kamala Harris is chosen as the Democratic Vice President, this market will resolve affirmatively. If a different candidate is appointed as VP, this market will resolve negatively. Any changes to the VP position after the initial selection will not impact the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately following the nomination.

question.title: Will Nikki Haley be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Nikki Haley not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Nikki Haley is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If Nikki Haley is selected, this question will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Nikki Haley going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Nikki Haley is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be answered with **No**. This inquiry is not limited to the candidates currently mentioned; additional options may be introduced later.

For this question, it does not matter who gets the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is determined solely by who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday and will Nikki Haley not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: 
(a) There is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 
(b) Nikki Haley is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. 

If both conditions are met, this question resolves YES. If either condition is not met, this question resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden not die before Saturday or will Nikki Haley be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as YES if at least one of the following conditions is met: 
(a) There is no official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 
(b) Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. 

If at least one condition is met, this question resolves YES. If both conditions are not met, this question resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Joe Biden will pass away before Saturday and that Nikki Haley will not be chosen as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered affirmative if both of the subsequent criteria are satisfied: 
(a) An official statement regarding Joe Biden's death is made before the market closes on Friday, July 26th. 
(b) Nikki Haley is not nominated by the Republican National Convention for the 2024 US Presidential Election. 

Should both criteria be fulfilled, this inquiry will be marked as YES. If either criterion is unmet, this inquiry will be marked as NO.

question.title: Will either Nikki Haley be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention). (b) There is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. If neither of these events occurs, this question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither Nikki Haley be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election nor Joe Biden die before Saturday?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs: (a) Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention). (b) There is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. If either of these events occurs, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Nikki Haley becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election or that Joe Biden passes away before Saturday?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if one of the following takes place: (a) Nikki Haley is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, as determined exclusively by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention). (b) An official declaration of Joe Biden's death is made before the market closes on Friday, July 26th. If neither of these scenarios occurs, the inquiry will conclude with a **No**.

question.title: Will Paris Saint-Germain win the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League?
question.body: The question resolves "Yes" if Paris Saint-Germain wins the Final on the 1st of June 2024, according to [UEFA](https://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/). All other outcomes resolve "No".

not_P.title: Will Paris Saint-Germain not win the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League?
not_P.body: The question resolves "Yes" if Paris Saint-Germain does not win the Final on the 1st of June 2024, according to [UEFA](https://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/). All other outcomes resolve "Yes".

para_P.title: Is it possible for Paris Saint-Germain to secure victory in the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if Paris Saint-Germain triumphs in the Final on June 1, 2024, as per [UEFA](https://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/). Any other result will lead to a "No" response.

question.title: Will Bayern Munich win and Paris Saint-Germain not win the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League?
question.body: This question resolves "Yes" if both of the following occur: (a) Bayern Munich wins the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League Final on the 1st of June 2024, according to UEFA, and (b) Paris Saint-Germain does not win the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League Final on the 1st of June 2024, according to UEFA. Any other outcome resolves "No".

not_P.title: Will Bayern Munich not win or Paris Saint-Germain win the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League?
not_P.body: This question resolves "Yes" if either of the following occurs: (a) Bayern Munich does not win the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League Final on the 1st of June 2024, according to UEFA, or (b) Paris Saint-Germain wins the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League Final on the 1st of June 2024, according to UEFA. Any other outcome resolves "No".

para_P.title: Is it possible for Bayern Munich to secure victory while Paris Saint-Germain fails to win the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered "Yes" if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Bayern Munich triumphs in the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League Final on June 1, 2024, as per UEFA's official ruling, and (b) Paris Saint-Germain does not achieve victory in the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League Final on June 1, 2024, according to UEFA. Any other result will be deemed "No".

question.title: Will either Paris Saint-Germain or Bayern Munich win the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League?
question.body: The question resolves "Yes" if either Paris Saint-Germain or Bayern Munich wins the Final on the 1st of June 2024, according to [UEFA](https://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/). If any other team wins, the question resolves "No".

not_P.title: Will neither Paris Saint-Germain nor Bayern Munich win the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League?
not_P.body: The question resolves "Yes" if neither Paris Saint-Germain nor Bayern Munich wins the Final on the 1st of June 2024, according to [UEFA](https://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/). If either of these teams wins, the question resolves "No".

para_P.title: Is there a chance that either Paris Saint-Germain or Bayern Munich will claim victory in the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if either Paris Saint-Germain or Bayern Munich emerges as the winner in the Final on June 1, 2024, as per [UEFA](https://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/). A win by any other club will result in a "No" answer.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

not_P.title: Will Biden not remain President through end of July 2024?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if Biden does not remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he remains President through that time.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a NO resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

para_P.title: Will Biden still be in office as President by the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
Determines YES if Biden is still the US President by the end of July 2024 (ET); determines NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President prior to that date.

A temporary delegation of authority under the 25th amendment (such as designating his Vice President as Acting President) does not result in a YES resolution. (The Acting President is not the same as the President according to the Constitution)

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Ron DeSantis is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) Biden ceases to be President before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: 

1. Ron DeSantis is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the selection made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention and is not affected by who is the nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

2. Joe Biden resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be US President before the end of July 2024 (ET). Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not count as ceasing to be President for this question.

If both conditions are satisfied, the question resolves as **Yes**. If either or both conditions are not satisfied, the question resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Ron DeSantis is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election nor (b) Biden ceases to be President before the end of July 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following conditions are met: 

1. Ron DeSantis is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the selection made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention and is not affected by who is the nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

2. Joe Biden resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be US President before the end of July 2024 (ET). Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not count as ceasing to be President for this question.

If either or both conditions are not satisfied, the question resolves as **Yes**. If both conditions are satisfied, the question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it true that: (a) Ron DeSantis becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) Biden no longer holds the presidency before the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if both of the following criteria are fulfilled: 

1. Ron DeSantis is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is based solely on the choice made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention and is independent of who is the candidate on the date of the 2024 US election.

2. Joe Biden steps down, passes away, or otherwise stops being the US President before the end of July 2024 (ET). A temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not qualify as ceasing to be President for the purposes of this question.

If both criteria are met, the question will be answered as **Yes**. If either or both criteria are not met, the question will be answered as **No**.

question.title: Will either Biden remain President through end of July 2024 or Ron DeSantis be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: This question resolves YES if either of the following occurs: (a) Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution) (b) Ron DeSantis is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ron DeSantis is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

not_P.title: Will neither Biden remain President through end of July 2024 nor Ron DeSantis be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body: This question resolves YES if neither of the following occurs: (a) Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution) (b) Ron DeSantis is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This question will resolve as **No** if Ron DeSantis is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **Yes**. This question is not restricted to candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden continue to be President until the end of July 2024, or will Ron DeSantis become the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if at least one of the following happens: (a) Biden stays in office as the US President until the conclusion of July 2024 (ET); it will be answered with NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise ends his presidency before that time. A temporary power transfer under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as Acting President) does not result in a YES answer. (An Acting President is not the same as a President according to the Constitution.) (b) Ron DeSantis is chosen by the Republican National Convention to be the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This question will be resolved as **Yes** if Ron DeSantis is nominated by the Republican National Convention for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will be resolved as **No**. This question is open to candidates not currently listed; additional options may emerge later. For this question, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 US election. It is strictly based on who is chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 3 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the difference in favor of Trump over Biden be more than 3 but at most 4 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on the assessment of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In the context of this question, a positive number indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative number signifies that Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure indicated Trump was 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this question.

question.title: Will Glenn Youngkin be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and will Trump's lead over Biden be either less than or equal to 3 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. Glenn Youngkin is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), not who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

2. Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is either less than or equal to 3 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart for that date, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead.

not_P.title: Will Glenn Youngkin not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if at least one of the following conditions is met:

1. Glenn Youngkin is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), not who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

2. Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart for that date, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead.

para_P.title: Is Glenn Youngkin going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and will Trump's advantage over Biden be either 3 or fewer or exceed 4 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if both of the following criteria are fulfilled:

1. Glenn Youngkin is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), rather than who is announced as the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

2. Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is either 3 or fewer or exceeds 4 on July 15, 2024, as shown on the chart for that date, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure signifies a Trump lead, while a negative figure signifies a Biden lead.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? (b) Glenn Youngkin be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

1. **Trump's Lead over Biden**: Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart for that date when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

2. **Glenn Youngkin as Nominee**: Glenn Youngkin is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the selection made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 4 or less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? (b) Glenn Youngkin not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs:

1. **Trump's Lead over Biden**: Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is greater than 4 or less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart for that date when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

2. **Glenn Youngkin as Nominee**: Glenn Youngkin is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the selection made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that one of the following events will take place: (a) Trump's margin over Biden exceeds 3 but does not go beyond 4 by July 15, 2024, based on the 538 national polling average? (b) Glenn Youngkin will be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if at least one of the subsequent scenarios happens:

1. **Trump's Margin over Biden**: The difference in polling between Donald Trump and Joe Biden, as per 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/), is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to the data available on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates Trump is ahead, while a negative figure suggests Biden is in the lead.

2. **Glenn Youngkin as Candidate**: Glenn Youngkin is chosen by the Republican National Convention to be the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is made exclusively by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but not exceeding 4 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden as indicated by 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on the chart dated July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In the context of this question, a positive figure signifies a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure indicates Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which would be considered a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden will still be president by the end of July 2024 and (b) Trump's lead over Biden will be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body: (a) Joe Biden will still be president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31, 2024. (b) On July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden will be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 4, as reported on the chart for that date when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates Biden is leading.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden will still be president by the end of July 2024 nor (b) Trump's lead over Biden will be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body: (a) Joe Biden will not be president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31, 2024. (b) On July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden will be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4, as reported on the chart for that date when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates Biden is leading.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Joe Biden will remain president until the end of July 2024 and (b) Trump's advantage over Biden will be either 2 or less, or exceed 4 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body: (a) Joe Biden will continue to hold the office of President of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31, 2024. (b) On July 15, 2024, as per 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden will either be 2 or lower, or greater than 4, as shown on the chart for that date when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates Trump is ahead, while a negative figure shows Biden is in the lead.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by the end of July 2024: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, or (b) Joe Biden still be president?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

(b) This market will resolve yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024 if Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur by the end of July 2024: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, nor (b) Joe Biden still be president?
not_P.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

(b) This market will resolve yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024 Joe Biden is not officially president of the United States.

para_P.title: By the conclusion of July 2024, will one of the following take place: (a) Trump's advantage over Biden be more than 2 and at most 4 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average, or (b) Joe Biden remain in the presidency?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will conclude with Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in the 538 national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as displayed on the chart dated July 15, 2024, when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For this question, a positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure signifies Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump 2.4 points in front of Biden, which would be interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for this question.

(b) This market will affirmatively resolve if Joe Biden is still the officially recognized president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden not have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
not_P.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden does not appear in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If a qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Joe Biden will engage in a face-to-face interview on camera lasting over 45 minutes before the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
The latest qualifying discussion was Biden's guest spot on The Howard Stern Show in April, where he responded to inquiries for approximately 70 minutes. 

If Biden participates in another such face-to-face interview for no less than 45 minutes, this market will conclude with a YES. Conversely, if no qualifying interview is published before the market closes at the end of July, it will conclude with a NO. 

This market does not take into account press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It may include appearances on podcasts or late-night shows, or segments edited into a program like 60 minutes. However, there must be a minimum of 45 minutes of fresh footage of Biden being interviewed in person for such appearances to be considered valid. A 50-minute video might only showcase 20 minutes of Biden being interviewed, which would not qualify.

For reference, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his guest appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his previous segments on 60 minutes have all contained less than 30 minutes of footage of Biden being interviewed.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) Joe Biden not have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

(b) The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count. For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, nor (b) Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

(b) The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count. For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) Trump's advantage over Biden will be more than 3 but not exceeding 4 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average, and (b) Joe Biden will not conduct an in-person interview/conversation on camera lasting 45 minutes or longer, prior to the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be resolved by examining Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For this question, a positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure signifies Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump 2.4 points in front of Biden, which translates to a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

(b) The latest qualifying interview was Biden's participation on The Howard Stern Show in April, during which he responded to questions for about 70 minutes. Should Biden engage in another in-person interview lasting a minimum of 45 minutes, this market will resolve to YES. If no qualifying interview is made public before the market closes at the end of July, this market will resolve to NO. This market excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It may include appearances on a podcast or late-night show, or an interview edited into a program like 60 Minutes. Nonetheless, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage showing Biden being interviewed in person for such appearances to be considered valid. A 50-minute video may only contain 20 minutes of Biden being interviewed, thus it would not qualify. For additional context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his previous segments on 60 Minutes have each featured less than 30 minutes of footage of Biden being interviewed. A list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts can be found here.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024, or (b) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
(a) Joe Biden must appear in an in-person interview for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024 for this to resolve YES. The interview must be on camera, and can include appearances on podcasts, late night shows, or shows like 60 minutes, but must have at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. Press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, and town halls do not count.

(b) Trump's lead over Biden must be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average. This will be determined by the value reported on 538's national polling average chart for July 15, 2024, accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for less than 45 minutes before the end of July 2024, nor (b) Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 3 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
(a) Joe Biden must not appear in an in-person interview for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024 for this to resolve YES. The interview must be on camera, and can include appearances on podcasts, late night shows, or shows like 60 minutes, but must not have at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. Press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, and town halls do not count.

(b) Trump's lead over Biden must be less than or equal to 3 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average. This will be determined by the value reported on 538's national polling average chart for July 15, 2024, accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following takes place: (a) Joe Biden participates in a face-to-face interview recorded on camera for over 45 minutes before the conclusion of July 2024, or (b) Trump's advantage over Biden exceeds 3 but is no more than 4 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
(a) For this to be considered a YES, Joe Biden needs to be featured in a face-to-face interview for a minimum of 45 minutes prior to the end of July 2024. The interview must be recorded on camera and can be part of podcasts, late-night television shows, or programs like 60 Minutes, but it must contain at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in person. Events such as press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, and town halls will not be counted.

(b) Trump's advantage over Biden must be greater than 3 and no more than 4 on July 15, 2024, as per 538's national polling average. This will be verified by the figure shown on 538's national polling average chart for July 15, 2024, which Metaculus will access on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a lead for Trump.

question.title: Will a swimmer win the most gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: The question resolves as **Yes** if the athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events.

not_P.title: Will a swimmer not win the most gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
not_P.body: The question resolves as **Yes** if the athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals does not compete in the swimming events.

para_P.title: Is it possible for a swimmer to achieve the highest number of gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: The question will be answered with **Yes** if the competitor who secures the greatest total of gold medals at the 2024 Olympics participates in swimming events.

question.title: Will both of the following occur at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) At least 5 countries win their debut gold medal, and (b) A swimmer does not win the most gold medals?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions), and (b) the athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals does not compete in the swimming events.

not_P.title: Will not both of the following occur at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) At least 5 countries win their debut gold medal, and (b) A swimmer wins the most gold medals?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if not both of the following conditions are met: (a) 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions), or (b) the athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 5 nations secure their first-ever gold medal and at the same time, a swimmer will not have the highest gold medal count at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (a) 5 or more nations achieve their inaugural Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, based on [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions), and (b) the individual who earns the most gold medals in the 2024 Olympics does not participate in swimming events.

question.title: Will either of the following occur at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) A swimmer wins the most gold medals (b) At least 5 countries win their debut gold medal?
question.body: (a) The question resolves as **Yes** if the athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events. (b) This question resolves as **Yes** if 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, according to credible sources.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) A swimmer wins the most gold medals (b) At least 5 countries win their debut gold medal?
not_P.body: (a) The question resolves as **Yes** if the athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals does not compete in the swimming events. (b) This question resolves as **Yes** if fewer than 5 countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, according to credible sources.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of these events will take place during the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) A swimmer secures the highest number of gold medals (b) Five or more nations achieve their first Olympic gold medal?
para_P.body: (a) The outcome is considered **Yes** if the competitor with the most gold medals in the 2024 Olympics participates in swimming events. (b) This question is marked as **Yes** if at least five nations earn their inaugural Olympic gold medal at the Paris Games, based on reliable sources.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will fewer than 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
not_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if no public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of fewer than 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democratic members from the House or Senate endorse a public statement against the strategy to nominate Biden early?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a response to voice their opposition against their party’s initiative to finalize President Joe Biden’s nomination ahead of schedule, arguing that it suppresses the crucial ongoing discussion regarding his candidacy, as per a lawmaker involved in the initiative.

A letter drafted, shared by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, serves as the initial public indication from Democrats following the recent attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump that many of their members remain significantly concerned about Biden’s candidacy moving forward.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Someone believes it’s a smart tactic to restrict debate and perhaps achieve unity through sheer force, but that’s not how it functions,” Huffman stated in an interview. He chose not to confirm whether the letter exists.

This market will conclude with a YES if a public statement opposing the early nomination strategy is signed by at least 20 members from the House or Senate who affiliate with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Even if multiple letters collectively gather 20 lawmakers' signatures, that would also be adequate to resolve this market to YES. 

Should these conditions not be fulfilled by the market close, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024 and (b) fewer than 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
(a) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024: This occurs if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this does not occur.

(b) Fewer than 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early: This occurs if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by fewer than 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. If these criteria are not met by market close, this does not occur.

not_P.title: Will at least one of the following not occur: (a) Democrats do not have a brokered convention in 2024 or (b) 20 or more House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
not_P.body:
(a) Democrats do not have a brokered convention in 2024: This occurs if the Democratic Party does not require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this occurs.

(b) 20 or more House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early: This occurs if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by 20 or more House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. If these criteria are met by market close, this occurs.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to happen: (a) the Democrats hold a brokered convention in 2024 and (b) fewer than 20 Democratic members of the House/Senate endorse a public statement against the proposal to virtually nominate Biden ahead of time?
para_P.body:
(a) The Democrats hold a brokered convention in 2024: This takes place if the Democratic Party needs more than one round of voting during its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only a single ballot is necessary, then this does not take place.

(b) Fewer than 20 Democratic members of the House/Senate endorse a public statement against the proposal for early nomination of Biden: This occurs if a public statement opposing the early nomination plan is signed by less than 20 House Members or Senators who align with the Democratic Party prior to the market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. If these conditions are not fulfilled by market close, this does not occur.

question.title: Will either at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early, or will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body:
This is a combination of two questions:

1. Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?

   - A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.
   - “It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.
   - This resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

2. Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
   - This resolves as YES if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as NO.

The combined question resolves as YES if either of these events occur.

para_P.title: Is it possible that at least 20 Democrats from the House or Senate will endorse a public letter against the plan to virtually nominate Biden ahead of schedule, or will there be a brokered convention for Democrats in 2024?
para_P.body:
This question encompasses two parts:

1. Is there a chance that no fewer than 20 Democrats from the House or Senate will back a public letter opposing the early virtual nomination of Biden? 
   - According to Politico, numerous House Democrats are coordinating to voice their dissent against their party’s intention to expedite President Joe Biden’s nomination, which they believe suppresses the ongoing critical discussions regarding his candidacy, as per a lawmaker involved in this initiative.

If these conditions are not fulfilled by market close, this market will resolve to NO.

2. Is there a possibility that the Democrats will hold a brokered convention in 2024?
   - This will be considered YES if the Democratic Party necessitates more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only a single ballot is needed, then this question will resolve to NO.

The overall question will resolve to YES if either of these scenarios takes place.

question.title: Will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Ted Cruz not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is not selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Will Ted Cruz be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Any other candidates will result in a **No** answer. This question is open to the possibility of additional candidates being included in the future.

For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who obtains the Republican nomination on the date of the 2024 US election; the outcome is strictly based on who is appointed by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model (b) Ted Cruz not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).
